loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika L. Sangama is a twenty-five year old mother of two.  Erika lives with her partner and her sons in the Villa Oriente district of Pucallpa.  She is a member of the communal bank Damas del Oriente or “Ladies of the Orient”.  Her bank is so named because the bank members live in an asentamiento humano (or, legalized squatter settlement) named Villa Oriente.

The asentamiento humano is located in the Ucayali region of Perú.  Asentamientos humanos are formed when immigrants from other parts of the region invaden, or literally, “invade” an abandoned section of land outside of an urban area.  These immigrants may come from other Peruvian metropolises or from villages in the sierras or the jungle, but all come with the dual purpose of finding work and owning their own home.

Erika moved to Villa Oriente three months after the neighborhood was officially formed in 2005.  Currently, Erika works selling breakfast along the side of the regional highway from 4am to 7am in the morning.  She has to get up at 3:00 am to prepare patarashka (fish wrapped in banana leaves and grilled on an open flame) and tacacho (green banana mixed with pork rinds mashed into a ball) to sell.  At nights, Erika studies to earn her high school degree.

Erika is requesting 2,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase cooking oils, plates and cups for her business.  Erika says her business allows her to buy school materials for herself and motivates her to keep studying to earn her degree.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oils, plates and cups for her business

loans.name: Ivetti  Nelly

texts.es:
Ivetti es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. 
Ivetti es casada, tiene 50 años, estudio industria del vestido en al universidad San Martín. Hizo su practicas en un taller de costura y se quedó trabando durante  diez años, decide renunciar  y poner un taller en su casa, pero la zona donde vive no pagan bien, entonces se dedica hacer composturas de ropa, le rinde más; ella tuvo impedimento para seguir trabajando, estuvo mal de la vesícula,  se sometió a  en tratamiento químico y pudo eliminar las piedras que tenia en la vesícula.  Ahora si puede trabajar y entregar sus pedidos a tiempo.

Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como llevar sus cuentas,  pudo comprar su remalladora, recubridora. Le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal.
 Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para arreglar sus maquinas de cocer.
El  sueño que tiene Ivetti es, hacer ropa diseñada por ella y venderla.
texts.en:
Ivetti is a member of the Las Orquídeas Community Bank. She is 50 years old and married, and studied clothing manufacturing at San Martín University. She worked for 10 years in a dressmaking workshop, before deciding to leave and start a workshop in her home. However, she wasn't able to earn much money in the area where she lives, so she started offering mending services which brought in more income. Ivetti encountered an obstacle in continuing her work: she had gall stones, and had to undergo chemical treatment to eliminate the stones in her gall bladder. Now she is able to work and deliver her orders on time. Since working with FINCA she has learned how to balance her accounts, and has been able to buy specialised sewing machines. She enjoys the meetings of the community bank. She is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to fix her sewing machines. Ivetti's dream is to design and sell her own clothing line.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her sewing machines

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva B. owns a rice field. Everyday, she and her husband go out to their farm. They cultivate the soil, work under the heat of the sun, and remove all the of weeds that grow to ensure a quality harvest.

Genoveva is 53 years old. She has 5 children. Her husband Jose B. is a carpenter. He also earns income to help support their children's education. Together, they do their best to uplift their lives. Through hard work is their best chance to achieve their goals.

Now, Genoveva is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizers, urea and triple 14. She also hopes to supplement their income with other income-generating projects.

CEVI provides its clients the credit assistance that they need. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren B. is married and has a 17-year-old daughter. She lives in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia). Her husband is a truck driver. He spends a lot of his time on the road. In 2005, she started renting a small stall to sell apparel for young people. Although she was unemployed before this retail business, she decided to start her small business with 300,000 tugrig (Mongolian currency; $1=1600 tugrig) in capital. Since its inception, her business has successfully expanded; it now boasts a capital of 1,500,000 tugrig. In a typical month, her revenue averages about 1,000,000 tugrig; her profit is about 200,000 tugrig.  She is requesting a loan to buy more apparel to expand her retail business. She is a quiet yet very caring person.  She hopes that in the future her business will enable her to afford college tuition for her only daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more apparel

loans.name: Heremakono (Dans L’Attente Du Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Heremakono sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 47 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  7 enfants. Les membres du groupe Heremakono vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Dah de la préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent la même activité de vente  de condiments alimentaires et d’arachide. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Heremakono  a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires à San, des sacs d’arachide pour les décortiquer et en faire de la pâte et des cacahouètes pour la vente. Les condiments sont vendus en détail à la maison et aux marchés proches. Quant à la pâte d’arachide et aux cacahouètes, elles  sont vendues  au marché de San  à la maison et en ambulant au comptant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 35 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Heremakono group are all married; they have an average age of about 47 and they have an average of seven children each. The Heremakono group members live in traditional large extended families in the village of Dah in the prefecture of San (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They all perform the same business activity selling condiments and peanuts. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Heremakono group found a solution to their problems by joining the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy condiments in San, and sacks of peanuts to shell and make peanut butter and also sell the peanuts. The condiments are sold retail from home and in nearby markets. As for the peanut butter and the peanuts, they are sold in the San market, from home and door-to-door for cash. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make an average profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts and condiments

loans.name: Oyatullo

texts.en:
N. Oyatullo is twenty-eight years old. He is married and has one child. Oyatullo’s wife is a housekeeper. Oyatullo works hard as he is the only breadwinner in the family. For two years he has been selling bedclothes and towels. Oyatullo buys the goods from the market “Korvon”. He tries to choose a variety of goods of high quality and attractive prices which helps him keep his clientele. The business brings in a stable income and allows Oyatullo to improve the living conditions of his family. Today Oyatullo requests $700 to purchase more bedclothes and towels in order to increase the range of the products he sells. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly in ten months. The progress of Oyatullo’s business is in your hands. Your support will really help him.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Maria Luisa es casada tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 4 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Maria Luisa empezó a trabajar desde joven a los 17 años el papa de una amiga confeccionaba zapatos y ella empezó vendiéndolos, desde entonces vende zapatos, ahora le traen zapatos de cuero  del norte del país. También ella trabaja en un colegio como profesora.   
Maria Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para la compra de zapatos botines, botas. Para venta por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió administrar su negocio, aprendió a invertir, ahorrar
El sueño de Maria Luisa es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is married with 3 children of 13, 9 and 4, all studying in the state school. Maria Luisa started working at 17, selling shoes made by the father of a friend. She has been selling shoes since that time, now they are brought from the north of the country. She also works as a professor in a college. Maria Luisa needs a loan of $475 to buy shoes, ankle boots, and knee boots to sell for Mother's Day. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned how to administrate her business, and how to invest and save. Maria Luisa's dream is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, ankle boots, and knee boots

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren B. is a 41-year-old single mother who has two children. Her husband died three years ago. Since her husband's death, she has been running a dressmaking business. Nyamsuren makes traditional clothing such as deels, vests and belts. Her younger sister sells the clothes at her clothing stall in the local market. With her profit, Nyamsuren pays her elder daughter's university tuition. This child is studying in Erdenet city, which is 380 kilometers north of the capital city. Nyamsuren lives with her younger child in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) district on a plot of land her younger sister owns in the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Her wish is to help her daughter graduate successfully from university and start a good life. Nyamsuren also hopes to have her own plot of land to live on. She requests a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Help We Sef Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata J., Oya T., Isatu J. and Sallay T.. They named their group Help We Sef. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty mile from Freetown. This is their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses.

Fatmata (right) is the leader of the group. She is 35 years of age. She was born in Bumpeh-Rotufunk. She is married to a teacher and the two have six children. Three of their children are already grown-ups, one is in secondary school and the rest are in primary schools. She has been a businesswoman for over 20 years now. Fatmata sells market food – onions, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi, tomatoes and so on. So far, Fatmata faces no serious challenges in her business that are worth noting. Business is going fine and well. She enjoys what she does for a living.

loans.use: Expand food market business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi O. sells hardware such as paint, nails, cement, locks, etc. in a store by the street. He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. 

Kofi is 50 years old. He is married and has four children, all of whom are still school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the busy commercial town of Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kofi works hard to be able to provide for his family. His aspiration is to sponsor all his children through school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Manito Poderosa Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ana del Carmen B. P., Valentin Valerio Martínez González  y Leyla Francisca
texts.en: Photo from left to right: Ana del Carmen B. P., Valentin Valerio Martínez González, and Leyla Francisca

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en:
Jorinda D. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jorinda is married, and she has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Jorinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. She explains that the main source of income from the business comes primarily through the planting and harvesting of corn and bananas for sale. Jorinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Jorinda has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jorinda is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional crops for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jorinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business and to help pay for her children's school tuition. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing fertilizers and additional crops

loans.name: Handmaa

texts.en: Khandmaa is a 57-year-old, single mother of two living in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her daughter attends a university while her son works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 1993, Khandmaa has been selling clothing through her stall at the local market in Arvaikheer. She purchases clothes in Erlian, China, once a month. With the success of her business, Khandmaa pays tuition for her daugther and plans to expand her business. Khandmaa is requesting 800,000 tugrugs (approx. $552 USD) to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Hebron, a city of Palestine.

Raed has been working as a car mechanic for four years. He also sells new and used spare parts. He requests a loan of $2,100 USD from Ryada in order to purchase merchandise for his garage.

Raed thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Alice is a hair dresser by profession. She works in a salon by the road side in her community. Alice buys her working materials such as artificial hair, pomade, lotion, weave-ons, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy working materials in larger quantities to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To buy hair salon products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
“Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining”, says Rowena as she sees hope behind all hardships in life that her family experiencing nowadays. Rowena is 29 years old and she is already married but she has no children yet. Having a big family is what she dreams for. So far, the couple is focused in improving their businesses for the preparation of their future children. The couple lives in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela. 
	Rowena is engaged in hog raising business in their village.  The profit they earned from vending grown-up hogs made it possible for her to build her new variety store which she now manages.  Her husband is in full support with her businesses and they hope that they will be able to further expand their business.
	Rowena is requesting to obtain a loan of PHP5,000 for the growth of her businesses. This amount will be of big benefit especially to her general store which is starting to grow. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: additional capital for the growth of her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For the past 15 years, she has been in the business of selling wood, and she notes that she has been a member of LAPO for the past two years. Rebecca is now requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 ($675) to purchase more wood so as to meet the high demand of her customers. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional wood

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty es una mujer muy amigable, tiene 34 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos. 
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, en un lugar que acondicionó en su misma casa para su bodega. Su esposo adecuó algunas tablas de madera para que le sirvan como andamio, y es donde hoy exhibe sus productos. 
Durante todo este tiempo su bodega se ha hecho muy conocida en su zona; por ello, Ketty se esmera en dar una buena atención a sus clientes, que son principalmente sus vecinos. A veces le piden productos que ella no tiene, y eso le entristece, pero está segura de que con perseverancia y buen trato, su negocio crecerá; pues su mayor anhelo es que su tienda esté llena de toda clase de productos y de ese modo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella es la presidenta de su banco comunal, y a todos sus compañeros les inculca el cumplimiento de sus cuotas para seguir contando con los créditos. Para hacer realidad sus sueños, Ketty solicita este dinero, el cual invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Ketty is a very friendly woman; she is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and father of her 5 children.

Since two years ago, she sells basic foodstuffs in her home in a place especially made for her small store. Her husband adapted some wood planks to serve as a stand, where she now displays her products.

During this time, her small store has become very well known in her area. Because of this, Ketty works very hard to give her customers, who are mostly her neighbors, the best attention. Sometimes they ask for products that she doesn’t have, and that saddens her but she is sure that with perseverance and courtesy for her customers, her business will grow. Her biggest wish is to have her store full of all types of products and in this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) she is the president of her communal bank, and to all of her colleagues she instills in them the need for them to pay all of their quotas on time so they can keep getting loans. To make her dreams come true, Ketty needs this money, which she will invest in buying merchandize for her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandize.

loans.name: Georgita

texts.en:
Expand her business, earn a good living, improve family living conditions and be able to send their children to school and finish their studies -- these are the main concerns of Georgita F., 43 years old, and her husband Leonardo. They are blessed with 3 young school-aged children. The family lives in the Prk. Waling, Waling Brgy, Busay Bago City, Negros Occidental. 

Georgita has a general store, a rice business, and also sells gasoline to earn additional income to help her husband sustain the needs of the family and meet their dreams in life. She started her business when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, because she knew that if her husband alone had to generate all of the family's income, it might be too much pressure on him.  She was even worried that their children would not be able to finish their studies. But through their cooperative efforts, she and her husband are reaching for their dreams, but helping each other support their family. Now she earns a minimum monthly income of PHP 6,000, a portion of which she sets aside for the education of their children.

She borrowed PHP 8,000 with her previous loan, and used it as additional capital for her general store and other businesses. She was able to earn and repay her loan every week without delay and she was able to fully pay her loan within term. Now, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to be used as additional working capital for her businesses. The income from it will be invested in expanding their business and to invest in the buying and selling of eggs. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital for her general store.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina M. is from the village of Laturan , Libona Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Saturnina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Saturnina has been working in this business for over 20 years.

In 2007, Saturnina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Saturnina is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Saturnina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline P. is 42 and married with 5 children (ages 2-months - 16).  She works in her 's business, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Karoline has 4 years of experience in this business.  Karoline needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Karoline joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Karoline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Karoline etelo are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Alexis Genaro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor ALEXIS, el pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años de edad es soltero, y siguiendo el ejemplo de sus primos y hermanos, el empezó trabajando de boletero (cobrador de pasajes), en la ruta Cusco, y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró ahorrar y pedir préstado un capital para comprar su propia combi de último modelo, el socio cubre la ruta del Sr de Cabildo y en uno de los viajes sufrió un accidente pequeño que le ocasionó un golpe fuerte a lado lateral del carro y este requiere ahora un planchado y pintado, para seguir operativo, el socio dice que este es el amor de su vida y lo cuida como su propio hijo, Él solicita el présatamo para poder arreglar su combi starex. 

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mr. Alexis, he belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the city of Cuzco, is 23 years old and single, and following the example of his cousins and brothers, he started to work as a ticket seller in the Cusco route, and with a lot of effort and dedication he managed to save enough and to borrow some capital to buy his own brand new VW bus. The partner covers the route from Sr de Cabildo and in one of the trips he suffered a small accident that banged the side of the car and now requires straightening and painting to keep operating. The partner says this is the love of his life and takes care of it like his own son. He is asking for a loan to be able to fix his bus. The partner is grateful and expresses the satisfaction of being able to keep his business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of the loan in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing and painting of transport after an accident

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn says she learned the value of savings when she joined CEVI. She is a 44-year-old rice grower from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has eight children. She has been growing rice for quite a while. The farm provides income for her household. She wants it to grow so her income will improve and her family’s needs will be met. She applied for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI. The loan will go for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 32-year-old mother of three. She operates a "hotel" (small restaurant) in Machakos, Kenya,. She has been in this business for two years. She wants to start a new line of business by opening a grocery store. Thus, she has requested for a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya Ltd. She hopes to start another hotel, acquire and develop a piece of land, and own a car in the future. She describes herself as hard-working and jovial.

loans.use: Start a grocery store

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong G. is a villager who lives with other family members in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia. She feeds a few pigs to make a living. She is married with six children. One child is married, and her other children are single. She depends on the income from her husband who catches fish in and around the river. Kong G. has recently finished building a new pigpen located behind her home, and she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise. Because Kong G. doesn't have capital yet, she requested a loan to purchase feed and piglets for her new stall. (Kong G. was not available when this photo was taken. So, her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is an ambitious 41-year-old man who has been operating a barber shop for six years.  He also practices mixed farming for commercial use and for his own consumption.  His wife is also a business-lady who runs a green grocer shop.  Joseph uses his money to educate his four children, provide for his family's basic needs and to pay wages to his two employees.  

He appreciates that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his sales have increased hence his living standards have improved.  He saves part of his income with Faulu Kenya and he plans to take a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open up a salon.  Therefore, he wants to buy a hair blow drier, hair products and hair drier.  He hopes to establish a permanent home for his family in the future.

loans.use: Equipment and supplies for salon

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Nandintsetseg is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ‘ger,’ the Mongolian nomadic tent dwelling, in a yard that belongs to her parents. 

Presently, she operates a tailoring and clothing trading business in her town. She manufactures a variety of clothing and leather bags using customer-specified designs. Nandintsetseg has been operating her business since 2007, after she graduated from the Urlah Erdem Institute of Fashion and Design. In addition to her tailoring business, she operates a clothes trading business at a rented counter. 

Over the years, she has expanded her business and has gained valuable experience. She has been planning to build own house for her family (with her family's help), and already she has started the building process using the profits from her business.

Nandintsetseg is a friendly person who has many plans in the future. She tells us, “My dream is to have my own salon for my tailoring business. In addition, I would like to expand my business into a more stable operation.” 

She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing for her clothes trading business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her clothes trading business

loans.name: Irangani

texts.en:
Irangani is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has two children who are 22 and 18 years old.  

Irangani has a tailoring business.  Her husband assists her with her business; they are very close and work well together.  Irangani started her business two years ago and she is very positive and enthusiastic about it.

Irangani has requested a 35,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help her business and purchase cloth. She is grateful for BRAC because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke loves business and she is happy in business. She sells drinks at retail prices. She hopes to grow her business in the future. She is 41 years old, married with 3 children. Jumoke is very determined to excel in her business and family life. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Chontacancha Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Santa Rosa D. Chontacancha está ubicado en L. comunidad D. Chontacancha, en el departamento D. Huancavelica, inicia su 1er ciclo con 14 socias.

Gregoria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 12,14 y 17 años, se dedica a L. venta D. cereales y abarrotes, inició su negocio hace 10 años, en esa época elL. era L. única que vendía ahora hay mucha competencia en su comunidad, es por ello que ahora Gregoria lleva su mercadería a otras comunidades cercanas como Lircay. El préstamo que va a recibir le servirá para comprar cereales al por mayor y bebidas por cajas. El sueño D. Gregoria es tener una tienda bien granD. llena D. mercadería, elL. sabe que lo logrará.

Francisca, es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 14, 18 y 20 años, se dedica a L. venta D. quesillo y helados, inició su negocio adquiriendo una congeladora para L. preparación D. chupetes y helados para vender en las escuelas y fiestas D. su comunidad, Francisca quiere cambiar D. negocio y por ello con el préstamo que va a recibir invertirá en L. compra D. animales para criar y vender, aumentando así su capital. Su sueño es llevar sus helados a otras comunidades y a L. vez preparar yogurt D. frutas.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa D. Chontacancha Communal Bank is located in the Chontacancha community, in the state of Huancavelica. They began their first cycle with 14 members. Gregoria is married and has three children, ages 12, 14, and 17. She sells grains and groceries. 10 years ago, when she first began her business, she was the only one that sold these products in her community, but now there is a lot of competition. As a result, Gregoria now sells her merchandise in neighboring communities, such as Lircay. The loan that she is seeking would help her purchase grains in bulk and boxes of refreshments. Gregoria's dream is to have a large store full of merchandise. She believes that she can achieve it. Francisca is married and has 3 children, ages 14, 18, and 20. She sells cheese and ice-cream. She started her business by buying a freezer and making popsicles and ice-cream to sell at schools and local festivals. Francisca wants to change her business and plans to invest her future loan in the purchase of animals to raise and sell, thus increasing her capital. Her dream is to sell her ice-cream in other communities and at the same time prepare fruit yogurts.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains in bulk and refreshments.

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal LIBERTAD.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
Un ejemplo claro es Rose Mary P. de 35 años, vecina de la ciudad de El Alto y es la primera vez que se ha animado a solicitar un préstamo, ya que ella tiene el negocio de venta de repuestos, trabaja juntamente con su esposo y por el nivel de venta que tiene se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Bs.- 2000, con el que piensa comprar diferentes artículos de movilidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Association LIBERTAD meets at the Exaltación Regional Office. The members of this Association have a variety of businesses which are dedicated to sales, production and service. One clear example is Rose Mary, 35, resident of the city of El Alto. This is her first time seeking a loan. She has a business selling spare parts and works alongside her husband. Given her sales volume she has seen the need to seek a loan of 2000 Bs. with which she plans to purchase various mobility-related items.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobility-related spare parts.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem S., 38 years-old, earns a living selling grilled bananas in her village. In addition to this, Nhem S. and her husband farm rice crops during the coming growing season in order to have a stock of rice to eat.  The couple now has a young child who attends school. This season is good for planting but Nhem S. lacks adequate capital to use for her field. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to hire laborers to help her with the farming activities. (Mrs. Nhem S.'s husband is pictured above.)

loans.use: To hire laborers.

loans.name: Nuru-Lumo Group

texts.en:
Charity M., age 48, is married with three children, ages 22, 18 and 14. She has operated a general store business for ten years now.  She works from 6:30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $168.

This will be Charity’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her business sales and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to start a poultry business. 

Charity will share this loan with her loan group, Nuru-Lumo, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture Charity is sitting behind the table, the first one on the right.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia C. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 32 years old. Leticia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leticia owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Aside from that, she also sells vegetables in the village. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 34 years old and married with four children.  Her children are 3, 6, 8, and 10 years old and her three eldest are in school.  She and her husband have been able to afford health insurance for the entire family.  They also keep a reserve of money for illnesses not covered by the insurance.  

Speciose buys handicrafts and sells them in the market. Her husband assists her with this job.  They have been doing this business for 7 years and have become known for selling high quality goods. With the loan she plans to increase the amount of handicrafts they sell.  She eventually hopes to be able to hire staff to assist her in the business. Her goal is to save enough to construct a house to live and work in. Also she hopes to save money to give to her children.

loans.use: Buying more handicrafts

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba D. sells provisions at Takoradi. Araba has attained senior high level of education. She helps her husband in the general welfare of the home. She is married and living with her four children. Her husband is a mason. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: David Weru

texts.en:
David Weru N. is 42 years old and he supports a family of three. He is married and he has two school-going children, aged twelve and nine. David is a businessman running an electronics shop in Narok town. He has been in this business for the last five years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member in KADET. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy more electronics goods to increase his stock. He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another electronics shop in another street within Narok town.

David’s dream is to become a wholesaler and be the electronic goods distributor in Narok town. He is a hardworking man with great vision.

loans.use: To buy more elecronic goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 7 años de edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente, Departamento de San Miguel. Él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas y lo atiende desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde desde hace 6 años, este oficio él lo aprendió por unos amigos que también tienen taller y le enseñaron a realizarlo perfectamente.
Las condiciones del taller son inadecuadas por lo que Manuel quiere mejorarlo pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la modificación por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder realizar el trabajo, su inversión será en madera, polines, láminas y de esta forma reparar el local.
Este préstamo le será útil pues necesita reparar el local y al realizar los cambios estará mas cómodo y seguro, no le afectaran las lluvias ni la delincuencia.
Las aspiraciones de Miguel son continuar con el taller en mejores condiciones, que sus ingresos aumenten para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 29 years old and lives with his wife and seven year old son, in San Rafael Oriente, within the San Miguel department.  He has a metal shop and for the past six years he has been there from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  He learned this trade from some friends who also had a shop and they taught him well.

The shop’s condition is inadequate.  Manuel wants to improve it, but he doesn’t have the money he needs, so he is requesting this loan so he can do the work.  He will use the money to buy poles and metal in order to make some repairs to the shop.

This loan will be useful because he needs to repair the shop.  He will be more comfortable and secure once the improvements are made and he will no longer be affected by the rains or by the crime.

Miguel wants to continue with his shop, under better conditions.  He wants his income to increase so that he can support his family and pay for his son's education.

loans.use: Repairs to his shop

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Francilia Abel

texts.pt:
Francilia Abel S. nasceu na Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique é viúva, mãe de uma rapariga de 15 anos de idade que vai a escola. Vive na casa do estado e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Boane enviando lhes 500.00mt por mês. 

 Francilia começa trabalhar na Cruz Vermelha como Servente, mas devido a sua dedicação ganha uma bolsa e faz um curso na Ação Social primeiramente enquadrada na Província de Nampula a Norte de Moçambique onde junta se com seu falecido marido. Devido a perda do marido ela pede uma transferência e é enquadrada no Distrito de Namaacha como Técnica no Serviço Distrital de Saúde Mulher e Ação Social, onde trabalha ha mais de 10 anos. Recebe 3.324.00mt por mês e também presta serviços no Município do mesmo distrito, como membro da assembléia Municipal a mais de 1 ano auferindo um valor mensal de 5.314.00mt num contrato de 5 anos. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt foi usado para comércio e habitação (legalização do seu terreno). 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais ainda para poder concluir a sua casa e sair da casa do estado onde vive atualmente.
texts.en:
Francilia was born in the Maputo Province, in South Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of a 15 year old girl who is in school. She lives in government housing and takes care of her parents who live in Boane by sending them 500 meticais every month. 

Francilia started working for the Red Cross as a janitor. Due to her dedication she earned a scholarship to take a class at Social Action. She was first assigned to Nampula Province, in North Mozambique where she met her deceased husband. After her husband's passing, she requested a transfer and was assigned to the Namaacha District as a technician at the District's Women's Health Services and Social Action where she has been for more than 10 years. She earns 3,324 meticais per month and has also been rendering services to the City in the same District as a member of the City's Assembly for more than a year, earning a monthly salary of 5,314 meticais under a 5 year contract. She spends her earnings with household expenses and manages to save some in her savings account. 

She never had loans with other banks. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. With this loan, in the amount of 25,000, she plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, iron and others) to continue her construction. The previous loans were for 5,000 and 20,000 meticais and were used for commerce and housing (to legalize her lot of land). 

She is confident she will pay ahead of time and request even more to finish her house and leave the government housing she currently lives in.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Ilusión. Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ILUSIÓN se formo con 9 mujeres, originarias D. Tlaxcala; esta ciudad últimamente ha ido creciendo, gracias a la gran derrama económica que se ha desatado, gracias a la creación D. comercios y fábricas. Las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle a su grupo Ilusión, ya que gracias al crecimiento económico que ha tenido la ciudad que habitan, tienen la Ilusión D. que sus negocios prosperen y así puedan darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus respectivas familias. La señora Eva Sánchez es la Tesorera del grupo, fue elegida para ese puesto, pues es muy responsable y capaz para los negocios; ella se dedica a la elaboración D. productos tejidos con  estambre, como boinas, bufandas y productos D. moda como bolsas D. manta bordadas con listón;  ella los elabora y los anda ofreciendo con sus conocidos; actualmente ya cuenta con clientes que le hacen pedidos para ofrecer sus productos en boutiques y tiendas D. accesorios, esta actividad para ella representa una entrada económica importante, ya que no podría dedicarse a otra actividad,  dado que tiene una hija con capacidades diferentes, la cual necesita D. su atención. La señora Eva le está enseñando a elaborar estas artesanías y es su propósito que a través D. su hija pueda dar talleres a otras personas con capacidades diferentes y estas a su vez puedan destacar por sí mismas. Para ella el éxito se vería reflejado viendo a su hija valiéndose por sí misma y siendo reconocida por sus habilidades y aptitudes como artesana.
texts.en:
This group is called ILUSIÓN ("hope"). It consists of 9 women from Tlaxcala, which has recently grown thanks to the great economic boom that has occurred as a result of the creation of new businesses and factories. The members of the group decided to call themselves Ilusión because thanks to their city's economic growth they've had more reason to hope that their businesses will prosper and they'll be able to improve their families' quality of life. 

Eva Sánchez is the treasurer of the group. She was elected to this office because she's very responsible and skilled in business. She makes woven products from worsted yarn, such as berets, scarves and fashionable bags with borders. She makes them and sells them to acquaintances. She currently sells to customers who then sell her products in boutiques and accessory shops. This job is every important to her economically because she's not able to perform another activity because her daughter has special needs and requires her attention. 

Eva is preparing to make some hand-maD. products and she plans, with the help of her daughter, to teach workshops to other people with special needs so that they can learn to excel. For her the success will be in seeing her daughter value herself and being recognized for her abilities and skills as an artisan.

loans.use: Working capital to grow the business and teach knitting classes to people with special needs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La sra. Leticia es una persona humilde ella esta divorciada, tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual es la que le ayuda a salir adelante tiene 3 hijos de los cuales nada mas uno depende de ella, la Sra. Leticia  necesita el dinero ya que este es su unico ingreso de dinero ya que ella  quiere tener mas mercancia para ofrecerle a sus clientes, ella es muy responsable y le preocupa el bienestar de su hijo, es madre soltera desde hace 20 años aproximadamente. La Señora Leticia les agradece su amable ayuda.
texts.en: Leticia is a humble person.  She is divorced and has a grocery store which helps her to get ahead.  She has 3 children, only one of whom still depends on her.  Leticia needs this loan as her business is her only source of income but she would like to have more goods to be able to offer her customers.  She is very responsible and looks after the welfare of her son.  She has been a single mother for approximately 20 years.  She is very grateful for your kind help.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Luciano Javier

texts.es:
Luciano de 44 años de edad  habita en la Colonia La Fonseca junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos, todos aportan al trabajo de la finca, desarrollando actividades de siembra de cultivos y cuido del gando. 

Luciano, solicita el 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en siembra de pasto mejorado para asegurar la alimentación del ganado en tiempo de verano y así mantener su hato ganadero con buen desarrollo y tener mayor peso y producción de leche. Ademas de la siembra se dedica a la venta de leche y de semoviente en el año, obteniendo ingresos que le permiten mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano, 44 years old, lives in Colonia La Fonseca with his family, made up of his wife and children, all of whom contribute to the work on the farm, sowing crops and raising cattle.

Luciano is requesting his second loan from AFODENIC in order to invest it in improved sowing of his grazing pastures to ensure the food supply of his cattle during the summer, and thus maintain the healthy development of his herd, enabling them to grow to a heavier weight and have a higher milk yield.  In addition to sowing, he works selling milk and livestock throughout the year, earning an income that allows him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: establish grazing pastureland

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 53 años,  vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon (empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo). vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana,  llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos suficientes y así dales una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Ella vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un local de productos Avon.
texts.en:
Flor, age 53, sells products for personal use, like cosmetics, through an Avon catalogue. This is a business that helps enterprising women sell cosmetics at low cost. She lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after orchids because when it was founded it had a lot of orchid blossoms).

She began selling Avon cosmetics in order to have sufficient income and, thus, give a better life to her two children, who study in public schools. She sells makeup, perfumes, creams, and deodorants at a low cost by catalogue. She sells these products to her acquaintances and neighbors. In order to increase her inventory she wants to use the loan to purchase perfumes makeup, and creams for her business. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to have a shop for Avon products.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, and deoderants.

loans.name: Shirine

texts.en:
Shirine is the mother of two daughters living in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Shirine's husband, Shawqi, is a taxi driver who works on transportation lines between Rafah and neighboring cities. Shirine's husband wants to do regular maintenance and paint the car. The maintenance will improve the car's performance and make better returns.

Shirine's husband wishes to be able to save money and take another loan from FATEN to buy a better car in the near future. Shirine's husband appears in the picture here as she is not comfortable with having her picture published online as she comes from a religious family.

loans.use: To paint and fix a taxi car

loans.name: Kisembo

texts.en:
Kisembo is a 28-year-old married man with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of paying school fees for his children and providing other basics.

He has a general merchandise shop and has been running it for nine years now. He started by selling local gin and saved to start his current business. He faces a challenge of bad debtors, but in the future he hopes to turn his business into a wholesale shop. 

He needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante M. is from the village of Samonte. He is 52 years old. Dante is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dante owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dante has been engaged in his business for over 32 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dante joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dante is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dante from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma A. is from the city of Malaubang, Ozamis City. She is 39 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Alma joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe U. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling dried fish and squid in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Dame Ahoefa  a  4 enfants à charge  et est mariée.  Elle vend  les  céréales et produits d'alimentation  pour  améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle compte dans cette  activité  5 ans et achète les céréales et produits  au  grand marché de Lomé.    Elle revend  à son domicile à côté de l’école Agnassan. Elle est née à Aného et habite quartier  Benomé. Elle espère accroitre son commerce  et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Ahoefa has four children in her care and is married. She sells cereals and food products in order to improve her children's living conditions. She has five years' experience in this business and buys cereals and food products at the large market in Lomé. She resells them from her home next to the Agnassan school. She was born in Aného and lives in the Benomé district. She is hoping to expand her business and is thus requesting a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and food products

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is a 28-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a carinderia (local eatery).   She lives in the island of Palawan in the Philippines. Mary Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy stock so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Mary Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her general store

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 25 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria has been raising pigs for six years. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Victoria is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Qalqilia. Ahmad runs a small mobile phone accessories store and repair workshop. Ahmad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a mobile phone repair kit that would help him fix more phones with different problems as well as buying more mobile accessories to increase sales.

Ahmad who appears in the picture here helps his father support the family. His father runs a small grocery store in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to purchase  a mobile phone repair kit and parts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 29 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo D. un año D. edad. Vive en casa propia la cual ha construido D. a pocos fruto D. su trabajo y la D. su esposo.  La casa D. Francisca resiD. en la cuidad D. Eten.

Francisca  posee una bodega la cual ella misma administra con una experiencia D. más D. 05 años.  En el negocio sus ventas son D. forma diaria y al contado.  Adicionalmente Francisca se dedica a realizar trabajos en ternopol (adornos, dibujos y letras para diferentes ocasiones). 

Francisca esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa para poder invertir en la compra D. productos para su  bodegas y la compra D. insumos para su negocio D. ternopol.  Además quiere comprar un estante para un mejor almacenamiento D. sus productos. 

Francisca es una nueva cliente para Edpyme Alternativa y no presenta deudas.  Ella se ha propuesto a sacar adelante a su menor hijo y hacer crecer su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor calidad D. viva a su pequeño.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 29-year-old widow with a son aged 1. She lives in her own house, a place she has just finished building thanks to hers and her husband’s efforts. Francisca’s house is located in the town of Eten.

Francisca owns a shop and she has been running it for more than 5 years. She sells her products every day for cash. On top of this, Francisca engages in creating "tecnopol"* objects (ornaments, drawings and letters for different occasions).

Francisca is requesting a loan to Edpyme Alternativa in order to invest in the purchase of products for her shop and of ingredients for the tecnopol activity. Moreover, she wants to buy a shelf to better display her products.

Francisca is a new customer of Edpyme Alternativa and she has no debts. Her aim is to proviD. for her young son and to make her activity grow, in order to offer a better standard of living to her young son.

<cite>Tecnopol is a a brand of styrofoam or polystyrene </cite>

loans.use: To buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno is a hard-working businesswoman who has been engaged in the business of selling women's shoes for the past 15 years. She has been engaged in selling women’s shoes. She sells her products at the market known as “Khair.” She has regular customers and earns a good income. She would like to request a loan of 10,000 Somoni in order to purchase new, fashionable, and high-quality goods, which will allow her to attract new customers. She is married and is the loving mother of one child.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road as well as the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase new, fashionable, and high-quality goods, which will allow her to attract new customers at market

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, oro, plata y enchape, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 12, 10 y 9 años D. edad, él negocio D. María es D. forma ambulante, visitando casa por casa a sus vecinos y amigos, desD. hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, cremas, maquillajes, lociones, con esta mercadería podrá ofrecer a los clientes nuevos productos, dando la oportunidad D. que sus clientes demanden la nueva mercadería y le genere mayores ventas.
El  objetivo D.  ella es trabajar por sus hijos, que tengan alimentación, salud y puedan estudiar, también poco a poco mejorar la infraestructura D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
María sells cosmetics, gold, silver, and plated jewelry. She lives with her husband and three children (ages 12, 10, and 9). María operates her business as a traveling merchant, going house-to-house to visit neighbors and friends. She has been in business for six years.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as crèmes, makeup, and lotions. By acquiring this merchandise, she will be able to offer her customers new products so that they will have the opportunity to purchase them. As a result, she will generate more sales.

Her goal is to work on behalf of her children so that they will be well-fed, healthy, and educated. In addition, she hopes to gradually improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to purchase crèmes, makeup, and lotions.

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 33ans, Mazalo achète des céréales (maïs, de mil, du fonio) à l’intérieur du pays depuis 2009. Elle est employée et ajoute à son activité la vente de céréales. Elle désire assurer la garantie de sa vie et de sa future vie maritale c’est pour cela elle veut ce montant pour renforcer son activité. Elle vend à son domicile.
texts.en: A young woman of 33 years, Mazalo buys grains (corn, millet and fonio, a nutritious grain widely consumed in West Africa) in the center of the country since 2009. She has a job, but adds cereal-selling to her usual work. She would like to secure a good life for herself and in her future marriage, which is why she wants to borrow money in order to grow her business. She sells from her home.

loans.use: to buy grain (corn, millet)

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
L. Alcancía Comunal “Arco Iris” está conformada por 11 comuneros responsables, quienes se dedican a L. agricultura y ganadería en las zonas altas D. Huarochirí donD. para llegar a su comunidad se debe viajar en solo dos fechas a L. semana.
Hermenegildo  es un hombre  trabajador que junto a su esposa se dedican  hace  20 años a L. ganadería a L. fecha ya esta  contando con más D. 50 vacas producto D. ellas prepara y venD. queso, pero también se dedica a L. agricultura:  siembra y cosecha  papas, habas y maíz. Hermenegildo a sus 52 años ha logrado comprar su propio terreno y  sacar adelante a su familia. El sueño D. Hermenegildo es  seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus  estudios superiores D. contabilidad por que ya está por culminar su carrera, además desea seguir  trabajando  y obtener ganancias para brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado piensa comprarse una vaca que le fue ofrecida aun precio económico y a si asegurar su producción D. quesos. Los podemos ver en L. foto todos reunidos en nuestras instalaciones EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad, luego D. L. reunión D. desembolso  D. su capital D. trabajo.  Jesús y Gilberto no pudieron estar presentes en el desembolso por motivo D.  transporte.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Arco Iris” (rainbow) is maD. up of 11 responsible members who work in farming and cattle raising in the high zones of Huarochiri where to  travel to their village, they can only go twice a week.

Hermenegildo is a hard-working man who for the past 20 years has worked with his wife in cattle-raising and currently has more than 50 cows.  They use the milk to make and sell cheese, but also they are farmers.  The plant and harvest potatoes, lima beans and corn.  Hermenegildo is 52 and has been able to buy his own land and to get his family ahead.  His dream is to continue supporting his son in his accounting studies because he is almost finished with his degree.  He also wants to keep on working and to obtain income to improve his family’s standard of living.  He will use the loan to buy a cow that was offered to him at a good price and that will insure his cheese production.  
We can see them all together in the photo in the ESAPROSPO -Prosperidad (prosperity) office after the meeting when the working capital is distributed.   Jesús and Gilberto couldn’t be at the distribution because of transportation problems.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Aslamkhon

texts.ru: Асламхон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Асламхон предоставляет услугу. Он имеет точку, где под навесом он готовит и продает самбусу и пирожки. В этой области он более 5 лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности. Он хочет взять в аренду помещение, чтобы продолжать свою деятельность в холодное время суток, то есть зимой.
texts.en: Aslamkhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a housewife. Aslamhon provides a service. He has a place under a canopy where he makes and sells sambusas and pies. He has been doing this more than five years. He is taking out a loan to expand his business. He wants to lease a place so that he can continue working when it gets cold, during the winter.

loans.use: to expand his business by renting a shop

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 42 ans celibataire avec 6 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 14 et 23 ans.
Ayant considere ses charges , elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie en 2002 pour prendre soin de sa  famille,  Elle vend en moyenne 6000 a 75000 frs par semaine. 
A l’octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en ajoutant les ballots de draps neufs, des serviettes non utilisées, des chemises hommes , des marinieres et des body .
Avec ses benefices , elle compte epargner pour aboutir a  ses objectifs . 

Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un magasin pour vendre les vetements d'enfants,des femmes et  d'hommes pour assurer la scolarite de ses enfants et les amener a faire des etudes universitaires
texts.en:
This borrower is a businesswoman, aged 42 and single, raising six children whose ages vary between 14 and 23. In view of her responsibilities, she began to sell used clothing in 2002 to care for her family. She makes sales of on average 6,000 to 75,000 francs per week. 

The loan will allow her to grow her stock of merchandise by adding bales of new sheets, un-used towels, men's shirts, and baby clothes. With her profits she intends to save in order to reach her goals. 

Her ambition is to open a shop to sell  men's and women's and children's clothing, so that she can pay school fees for her children and send them to university.

loans.use: to expand her stock of bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Raja

texts.en: Raja is a 22-year-old single man who lives in Dier Al-Ghsoon village near Tulkarem in Palestine. Raja is a construction worker in addition to having a store selling clothes. Raja wants to buy a new collection of summer season clothes, but the income he earns isn't enough to pay in cash. Raja has some of the amount but lacks the $3,000 he borrowed  from FATEN. When Raja gets the FATEN loan, he will have a diversity of summer clothes in the store, so he can compete with others, increase customer demand and therefore, increase his income and have better living conditions. Raja is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the subscription fees to his service provider and buy cartons of beer, stout and soft drinks.

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
“Being smart is used in the development of own self, people around you and not to use for self-interest.”  This quotation is stated by Florante. He is a business-minded man who operates his own furniture and upholstery shop. In his statement, he has proven that he used his skills and abilities to develop his business and provide employment to their community, especially to the married man.

He’s already been administering his business for 28 years. For these years, he usually earns a net income of PHP 40,000 that he saves for his future family. Despite being single at the age of 45, he works hard as if a married man to provide the needs of his parents as well as his own needs.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional working capital. This will be use to buy wood, lumber and varnish as added materials in his shop. He hopes that he can carefully roll his loan amount to improve their lifestyle as well as his business.

loans.use: to buy wood, lumber and varnish

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores es una joven de 33 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Francisco de la Palmera, localizada en San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros.

Desde unos meses Maria Dolores inicio su negocio con una Tienda Bazar. El cual es muy beneficioso para la comunidad, ya que se vende toda clase de artículos que los vecinos del lugar necesitan a diario.

Actualmente Maria Dolores está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de más mercancía para la tienda, para que continúe siendo de mucho provecho y utilidad para los vecinos.
