Con esta inversión espera que su negocio crezca mucho mas. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder seguir adelante y superarse como familia.

Maria Dolores es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores is a young woman who is 33 years of age. She lives with her family in the community of San Francisco de La Palmera, which is located in San Carlos in Alajuela Province. This rural community has great potential for development since there are already existing businesses tied to agriculture, such as raising cattle, and available community services. There is also opportunity for small retailers, microenterprises, and other ventures.

A few months ago, Maria Dolores started her own business – a bazaar. This has been very beneficial to her community because she sells all types of products to her neighbors on a daily basis.

Maria Dolores is currently requesting a microloan in the amount of 500,000 CRC so that she can buy more merchandise for her store. This will allow her to continue providing great benefit and value to her neighbors. With this investment, she hopes that her business will grow much more. All of this assistance will help improve her living conditions, thus enabling her to move forward and succeed with her family.

Maria Dolores is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Francisco de La Palma, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. In addition, she will be an active participant in her local credit organization.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her bazaar.

loans.name: Elisabeth S. E.'s Group

texts.fr: Mariée, Élisabeth est responsable du groupe qu'elle a formé avec Doris pour se donner caution en vue d'obtenir un prêt à FINADEV. Élisabeth vit avec son mari et leurs 4 enfants dans un quartier populeux de la ville. Leurs enfants évoluent très bien à l'école. Les charges du ménages sont supportées par le couple. Femme dynamique et expérimentée, elle commercialise divers articles tel que des sacs de riz, des pâtes alimentaires, des conserves, des boissons, de la tomate fraîche, des pommades etc... Elle a une clientèle variée constituée essentiellement de ses voisins. En fonction de la demande, Élisabeth s'approvisionne pratiquement au quotidien auprès des grossistes de la capitale économique. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité, elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV son premier crédit pour accroitre le volume de son stock de marchandises afin de répondre au mieux aux demandes de sa clientèle. Élisabeth compte tirer de cet appui financier un revenu supplémentaire pouvant lui permettre d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir les charges familiales. Elle envisage ouvrir une autre boutique de vente de divers articles dans les environs de Cotonou. Élisabeth est en caution solidaire avec Doris.
texts.en:
Élisabeth is married and is the leader of the group she has formed with Doris so that they can guarantee each other and receive a loan from FINADEV.

 Élisabeth lives with her husband and their four children in a crowded area in the town. Their children are doing well at school. The household expenses are shared between the couple. A dynamic and experienced woman, she sells various items such as sacks of rice, pasta, tinned goods, drinks, fresh tomatoes, ointments, etc. She has a varied clientele, essentially made up of her neighbors. According to demand, Élisabeth shops practically daily for goods from wholesalers in the economic capital of the country. 

In order to earn more from her business, she requested and obtained her first loan from FINADEV to grow her inventory and better respond to the needs of her clientele. 

Élisabeth expects to use this loan to make more income which will allow her to be financially independent and cover family expenses. She plans to open another general store in the Cotonou area.  Élisabeth guarantees her co-member Doris's loan.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: La señora Tania es artesana; tiene una joyería donde realiza joyas en plata. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: plata, oro y otros elementos necesarios. Esta actividad artesanal es su principal fuente de ingresos. Vive en casa en alquiler en una casa la misma que queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Tania solicita un crédito y por el carácter social se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Tania is a craftswoman.  She has a jewelry shop where she makes silver jewelry.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like silver, gold and other necessary elements.  This crafts work is her main source of income.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s married and has two children.  This is the first time Tania’s asked for a loan and because of its social nature it’s channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, etc. for her jewelry making workshop.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат житель района Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем. У нее 8 детей. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области она 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Muhabbat lives in the Yavan district.  She is 30 years old, married and has eight children.  She earns a living by breeding cattle and has been involved in this business for 15 years.  Muhabbat is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Vilma has a duckpond and she sells duck eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the ducks.

Vilma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the ducks

loans.name: 0404009-Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hộ operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell.

Hộ is 45 years old and she is married and has 4 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 0404009-Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Hộ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hộ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hộ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hộ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Savan, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells groceries, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a construction worker. Savan is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Savan appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 42, resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilson, a landscape artist, and is the mother to their six children, five of whom are still studying. She is working hard to send all her children to college, because like most Filipino parents she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Rowena operates a landscaping business. Together with her husband, she offers landscaping services to those who would like to improve their homes or gardens. She also supplies ornamentals plants and other materials for landscaping to those people who do landscaping as a hobby. She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php50,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more landscaping materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rowena dreams of having a new outlet for the expansion of their business and hopes to send all her children to college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for landscaping materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Mujeres Emprendedoras” está conformado por 19 emprendedoras, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación y venta de colaciones, venta de ropa nueva y accesorios, entre otros. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Verónica presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en tercer lugar, entre las tres que lo están, además usa anteojos y su cabello es ondulado. 
Se dedica a la producción de mermeladas caseras, de acuerdo a la fruta que esté de temporada. Además para la temporada de navidad agrega a su negocio la preparación de pan de pascua y galletas. Y durante la época de invierno prepara frutas en conserva. 
Comenta que éste oficio lo aprendió de manera autodidacta y lo realiza desde hace 10 años. 
Con el tiempo ha ido incrementando el número de clientes, ya que sus mismos clientes son quienes promocionan sus productos, por lo que ahora cuenta con clientela fija.
Sus insumos como los frascos de vidrio, los compra en la ciudad de Santiago y las frutas las encarga a la ciudad de Quillón. 
Con el crédito comprará ollas grandes, que le servirán para cocer la fruta y después prepararla como mermelada. Además de frutas de temporada.
Una de sus metas para su negocio, es participar de algún curso que otorgue la municipalidad para perfeccionarse en sus preparaciones. Otra de sus metas es tener un local en su misma casa, donde pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos.
Verónica vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijas de 25, 21 y 20 años de edad, quienes estudian carreras profesionales, situación que tiene muy contenta y orgullosa a Verónica.
La motivación de Verónica de continuar con el negocio, se debe a que ella disfruta mucho lo que realiza.
Además está muy contenta y agradecida de participar en Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, por lo demás las capacitaciones han sido un gran aporte para su negocio, con los aprendizajes de contabilidad, ya que le ha permitido invertir y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos. 
Por otro lado el grupo del Banco comunal, del cual forma parte es muy unido, comprometido y solidario, por lo que Verónica se siente muy cómoda y contenta. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Enterprising Women." It consists of 19 entrepreneurs, who work in different areas, among which are preparation and sale of sweets, and sales of new clothing and accessories. All the members live in the city of Concepción.

In the photo, Verónica, the president of the communal bank, is seated in the third spot; among the three seated women, she has glasses and her hair is wavy. She makes homemade jams, using whatever fruit is in season. In addition, for the Christmas season, she adds the preparation of fruitcake and cookies to her business. And during the winter season she prepares fruit preserves. She comments that she learned this business by teaching herself and she has been doing it for 10 years. With time, she has increased the number of customers. Since the same clients are the ones who promote her products, she now has a fixed customer base. She buys her supplies, such glass jars, in the city of Santiago, and she gets the fruits in the city of Quillón. With her loan she will buy big pots, in which she will cook the fruit and make it, for example, into marmalade, and in addition, she will buy seasonal fruit. One of her goals for her business is to participate in a course that the municipality offers to perfect her products. Another of her goals is to have a shop in her own house, where she can offer and sell her products. 

Verónica lives with her husband and their three daughters, ages 25, 21, and 20, who are studying for professional careers, a situation which makes Verónica very happy and proud. Verónica's motivation to continue with her business is due to the fact that she very much enjoys what she does. In addition, she is very happy and thankful to participate in Fondo Esperanza, since it has permitted her to invest in her business. Apart from this, the training sessions, with the training in accounting, have been a great contribution to her business, since it has permitted her to invest and distribute her income better.

From another perspective, the community bank, of which she is a part, is very united, committed, and supportive, so Veronica feels very comfortable and happy.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Bíobío river, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile in the Bíobío region. It has had an important role in our history, being the site of important battles and related agreements, especially during the war of Arauco, because it was on the frontier of the Mapuche territory. Now the city has experienced important economic and demographic development and has come to be considered one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy big pots for cooking fruit and preparing marmalade and to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Eterna

texts.en:
Eterna is married with three school-aged children. She is 57 years old and lives in Looc, Maria Siquijor.

To earn a living, Eterna has a general store business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her General Store business. Eterna has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Eterna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, solicita de nuevo otro préstamo debido que quiere seguir progresando en su negocio de medicina natural comprando mas productos por ejemplo: suplementos alimenticios, medicinas curativas, vitaminas, analgésicos, en fin para toda clase de enfermedad, de esa forma podrá tener variedad para sus ventas diarias con sus clientes.
Miguel cree que el prestamo anterior le ayudo porque compro mercadería permitiendole mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is requesting another loan again since he wishes to continue progressing in his natural medicine business by buying more products, such as nutritional supplements, curative medicines, vitamins and analgesics for every type of illness. In this way, he will be able to have variety for his daily sales to his customers. Miguel believes that the previous loan helped him because he bought merchandise permitting him to improve the income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional supplements, vitamins, analgesics.

loans.name: Domitilio

texts.en:
Domitilio is 60 years old, married to a house keeper and together involved in raising hogs to fatten and breed. This is the primary source of their income. Domitilio also serves the community as a Counselor at their Barangay. The couple had eight children. Seven of them settled into marriage and live separately with them. The youngest is still in high school. Though his children, live separately from them, he still helped them in times of need especially on financial matters. 

He is now asking for this loan to have an additional capital to enhance his hog raising business. He is asking for P20,000 to buy medicines, vitamins and hog feed for sustainability. He wants to ensure proper growth of hogs so that he can offer it at a higher cost upon disposal. He also hopes to renovate the pigpen. 

Someday, with his patience, sacrifices and hard works, he will achieve his goal of financial stability.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamins and hog feed for sutsainanbilty

loans.name: Bayanbish

texts.en: Bayanbish is 37 years old and lives with 4 children and wife in a ger in Darhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Masar, is 37 years old. She is an unemployed. His daughters, Ariunzaya and Amarzaya, aged 17 and 15 responsive.They are a second school student. His sons, Gonchigsumlaa and Bayarjargal, aged 13 and 3. Gonchogsumlaa is a second school student. Bayarjargal is join a kindergarden.He has been serving as a taxi driver after purchased a car. He is well-experienced and popular in the town. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,400,000MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his a car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his a car

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Bashiru.  He is married, and has two children, aged 5 and 15.  In 2008, Bashiru established his auto spare parts business. He began his business because after high school there was no job, so he decided to go into this business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000 . Bashiru requires a loan in order to buy more spare parts of different kinds for resale. In the future, Bashiru plans to get another shop for business expansion. He is very hard working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts of different kinds for resale

loans.name: Milebenan Group

texts.fr: MILEBENAN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjouavi Yvette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Adjouavi Yvette est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Paulin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Adjouavi Yvette et son mari. Pour ce faire, Adjouavi Yvette vend des tissus, des mèches et de la farine de blé par la technique de distribution depuis quatre ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Adjouavi Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adjouavi Yvette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MILEBENAN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des mèche et de la farine de blé.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en: Micaela is 22 years old she is divorced and she has a 5 month baby Micaela pays rent. Micaela works at a grocery store from sunday to sunday since 8:00 am until 9:00 pm Micaela needs a loan to buy products  for her grocery store (soft drinks, food cans, bread, etc) She hopes you can help her Micaela is healthy and she loves her baby a lot.

loans.use: to buy products  for her grocery store (soft drinks, food cans, bread, etc)

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд активный и жизнерадостный человек из района Бохтар. Ему 51 год. Он счастливый отец троих сыновей. Старший работает на чужбине, так как не смог найти работы в родном краю. Двое младших сыновей служат в армии. Скоро один из его сыновей женится, к чему Махмуд безгранично рад. Махмуд счастлив, что скоро его сын приведет в дом невестку. Поэтому счастливый отец готовится к свадьбе. Свадьба пройдет у них в доме и Махмуд начал понемногу ремонтировать дом. 
  Свадьба в Таджикистане проходит масштабно, и количество гостей доходит до 100-150, и конечно это затратное мероприятие и Махмуд для этого просит кредит. Он надеется, что его поддержат и разделят с ним радость

loans.use: Для проведения свадьбы сына

loans.name: Petronilla's Group

texts.en:
Petronilla is 56 years old and has 8 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Petronilla is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya.

Petronilla started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2007, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Petronilla’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 50 years old married with 4 children, two of them are independent and two still in college and secondary school.

She has been running a small shop for the last 8 years, realizing a net income of approximately USD 100 per month. She has also a small coffee farm, which brings in some income seasonally.However, this is not enough to sustain her family requirements thus, need for extra source of income.

loans.use: She intends to buy a high breed dairy cow that will produce aleast 18 litters of milk per day.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a store where she sells all types of food items. She has 3 years of experience. When she married her husband he motivated her to start a bazaar with some savings and loaned her $100. Later she started a food store because she was selling more food than other types of products. Her store is located in her mother's home; she is adapting an area of her own home, across the street, so that she'll be able to move the business there. She tends to the store every day of the week from 7 am to 9 pm. Her mother helps her take care of the business.

She needs the loan to food staples and buy milk products and meat. She has turned around the capital she initially invested in the business, which has allowed her to grow.

Esther was born on Guayaquil. She is 21 years old. She does not have any children. Her husband works as a door to door salesman selling eyeglasses and cases for cell phones. They are a young couple who fight to get ahead. Thanks to her husband's savings they bought a plot of land where they plan to build their house out of cane. Their dream is that their businesses grow, since they are the couple's only source of income.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Esther tiene una tienda donde vende toda clase de víveres para la comida. Su experiencia es de 3 años. Cuando se caso su esposo la motivo a poner un bazar con unos ahorros y presto $ 100, pero luego puso una tienda porque se vendía más estos productos. Su tienda esta ubicada en la casa de su madre, esta adecuando un espacio en su casa para trasladarse que es al frente. Ella atiende el negocio todos los días de la semana de 7:00 AM a 9:00PM, su madre también le ayuda atender.

Ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar sus víveres y comprar lácteos y carnes. Con su capital que ella invirtió le ha dado la vuelta lo que le ha permitido crecer.

Esther nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 21 años. No tiene hijos. Su esposo trabaja como vendedor ambulante vendiendo gafas, estuches para teléfonos. Ellos son una pareja joven que luchan por salir adelante. Gracias a los ahorros de su esposo ellos ya se compraron un terrero donde piensan construir su casa de caña. Su ilusión es que sus negocios crezcan ya que son sus únicos ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use: Buy food staples, milk products and meats

loans.name: Nafeesa

texts.en:
Nafeesa D/O Besmillah, 33, lives in District 8 of Kabul City. She is married and has 7 family members. She has an embroidery business at home, and through this she assists her husband in solving financial problems. After her marriage she faced lots of financial problems because her husband was jobless for 3 months. At that time she wanted to start her business in a shop, but her husband didn't give her permission to start a business in a shop. Therefore she decided to start her business in her home.

With her first loan, she purchased abrics and produced some clothes and sold them in the market. Her business grew from the time she took her 2nd and 3rd loans. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and wants to continue taking loans because she is happy that through loans, she was able to start a successful business.

loans.use: Buying cloth, thread, etc

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal M. is 52, and he has four members in his family. He owns a small farm in Saatli. He needs extra funds for the development of his animal husbandry business. He has applied for a loan of $900 USD to broaden his business.

loans.use: To develop animal husbandry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and rice for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a dynamo. She is 47 and the chairperson and founding member of the Alinyikira Lending Group in her village of Mutundwe. Alinyikira means “continue hard work”. She has raised seven children, two are still in secondary school. Five of her children have degrees from the university. In addition, she cares for four of her sister’s children. She is very busy, knows everyone and smiles and laughs with ease. She travels around Mutundwe with a swift, confident gait and cordial face for everyone.
Mutundwe is a village just outside of Kampala and it is known for its catering, bakeries and poultry. Janet has two businesses: a bakery and a poultry business. Behind her house, she raises hens, 350 of them. She used to raise boilers, but the price dropped so she now has layers.
Her loan will enable her to increase her bakery supplies and follow her dream of continuing to expand her hen farm and egg business. (If you would like to learn more about this amazing women and the other members of the Alinyikiri Lending Group please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: Alinyikira: “Continue Hard Work”).

loans.use: Janet will increase her bakery supplies for the upcoming holidays and expand her hen farm

loans.name: Shokhret

texts.ru:
Shokhret J. was born and lives in the town of Saatli in the Republic of Azerbaijan. She is 37 years old, and she comes from a poor family. She is married and has 3 children. Two years ago, while jobless, she decided to open her own business. Shokhret and her husband (see photo) rented space, bought tables and chairs, dishes and equipment for a cafe. But returns from the business were so low that Shokhret did not have the money to fix up the old cafe and as a result her clients started to leave the business. In order to stop clients from leaving, Shokhret asked for a $500 loan from the Norwegian Microcredit partner of Kiva. She will use the money to renovate the cafe.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Г-жа Шохрет родилась и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ей 37 лет, она выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Два года тому назад, будучи безработной, нужда заставила её в поисках заработка открыть собственное дело. Она с супругом (см. фото) арендовала помещение, купила столы и стулья, посуду и оборудование. Но низкая прибыль не позволяла Шохрет отремонтировать обветшавшее помещение кафе, и, как следствие, клиенты начали уходить. Чтобы прекратить отток клиентов, Шохрет обратилась за получением ссуды в 500 долларов к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA. Сумму кредита она собирается использовать для обновления помещения.

loans.use: For renovation

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence A. is a 40 year old married mother of 5 children (20, 16, 13, 11, 9) who is in the fish business. She wants the loan so she can invest in her current business and with the profits start a new business that sells more durable items like stationary.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To invest in her current business and use the profits to start a new business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Habiba S.. She is married with five children, aged between 20 and 32, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces. In 2005 Habiba established a shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $525 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store in bulk.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul S. resides in the Abdurahmon Jomi district in Tajikistan. She is 41 years old, single and has 2 children. Kurbongul has a high school degree and no professional degree. For the last three years she has been selling groceries at the local market. She brings her goods from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan, where she purchases them from wholesalers. Kurbongul is planning to use the loan money to increase the assortment of goods she can offer at her market stand. Since she is not married, the whole burden of supporting a family lies on her shoulders and her business allows her to feed her children. The goods she sells at her stand allow the locals to purchase the necessary groceries cheaply and without having to leave their town. Kurbongul is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Саидова Курбонгул жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми.возраст 41 год. Не замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее, специальности не имеет.Занимается торговлей продуктов питания на районном рынке.Работает в этой сфере около 3 лет. Привозит товар из Душанбе покупая товар у оптовых реализаторов.Так как клиентка не замужем обеспечение семьи лежит только на ее плечах, поэтому ее бизнес позволяет клиентке кормить ее семью. Кроме того товар привозимый ею помогает населению приобретать товар прямо в районе не выезжая из селения, а так же по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding the assortment of goods offered for sale

loans.name: Sorie Bunting

texts.en: Sorie K. is 47 years old and married with 5 children.  Working as a teacher, his salary is not enough to enable him to complete the construction of his house. It took him a long time to save the money required to put up the structure while also renting a house for the family.  Sorie is therefore requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheets and timber for the completion of the family house.  He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a family home

loans.name: Željka

texts.en:
Željka is 37 years old and married with two children, 10- and 12-years-old. They are from the town Derventa. Her husband works and earns about 750 KM monthly.

Željka sews and she has an old machine for sewing. Željka will use this loan of 1200 KM to buy parts for her machine and material for sewing. She hopes to improve business and increase her income for her household.

loans.use: To buy machine parts and material.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1969 in Dalavé in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of five children, plus takes care of a nephew. After primary school, he learned motorcycle mechanics. After three years' training, he opened a workshop in Tsévié, which he manages well. His wife, who sells miscellaneous items, contributes very little to the family expenses. Dynamic and honest, Mr A. is exceptionally skilled at his trade. To be able to satisfy his customers, he is asking for a loan that he can use to buy more materials for his work, sell motor oil and buy a motorcycle for transport. This will enable him to increase his income so he can better look after his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 décembre 1969 à Dalavé dans la Préfecture du Zio, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants et a en charge un neveu. Après les études primaires, il apprit la mécanique à deux roues. Après trois ans de formation, il a ouvert son atelier à Tsévié, qu’il gère bien. Sa femme, revendeuse de divers produits et contribue très peu aux charges de la famille. Dynamique et honnête, Monsieur A. Komi a une parfaite maîtrise de son métier. Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat d’autres matériels de travail, la vente d’huile à moteur et l’achat d’une moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle taxi and sell motor lubricant

loans.name: Bonin Colette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bonin Colette O. D. sells ice, cold water, ice pops, and refrigerated beverages at her home. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. Bola (13) is no longer enrolled in school, Hamidath (10) is in fourth grade, and Mouba (7) is in second grade. Since she lacks the financial means to expand her drinks sales, Mrs. O. D. is requesting her third loan to acquire a refrigerator which will permit her to increase her production and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame O. D. Bonin Colette est vendeuse de glâce, d'eau fraîche,des sucettes et de la boisson fraîche à la maison. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont Bola âgée de 13 ans a cessé de fréquenter, Hamidath âgée de 10 ans est élève en classe de CM2, Mouba âgé de 7 ans est en classe de CP2. Faute de moyens financier pour renforcer la ventede la boissons, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acquérir un réfrigérateur qui lui permettra d'augmenter sa production et de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congélateur

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma P. is a farmer and pig breeder in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 53 years old and a widow with five children, two of whom are employed while the other three are attending school.

Since both of her businesses have been doing well, Mrs. Ma P. wants to expand them so she asked for a loan to buy a pig for breeding and she would use the rest money to purchase fertilizers for her rice field. In the past, Mrs. Ma P. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piece of land to cultivate rice and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding and she would use the rest money to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Nachum

texts.en:
Nachum is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 8, 4 and 2. She also takes care of 2 other people aged 60 and 50 years old. She has sold charcoal and perfumes since 2007. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $82 from her sales.

Nachum now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeung C. is a villager in Prothorng Village in Takeo Province. She is 26 years old and the mother of a three year old child who is too young for school. She is a farmer who can make a little revenue from rice because she owns a small field. Her husband, Mr. Mao Kan, is a construction worker who can make $4 a day. He is shown on the left in the picture.

Even though Mrs. C. and her husband each have businesses, they still cannot afford to build a new house. Thus, Mrs. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia, socia del Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y gaseosas. Está en esta actividad desde hace poco y le esta yendo muy bien. El negocio está ubicado en la casa de sus padres en el Jr. Agricultura S/N, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Sonia tiene 27 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Es una mujer trabajadora que quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y su meta es la de surtir más su negocio y el poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "La Libertad" [Freedom] Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, Bellavista province and district, town of La Libertad. She sells groceries and soft drinks. She started this business a short while ago and it is going very well. The business is located in her parents' house at Jiron Agricultura S/N, where her clients -- many of whom are her neighbors -- go every day. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Sonia plans to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of various sizes, toilet paper, detergents, soaps of various brands and sizes, among others. These purchases will provide an ample stock for her business and help make sure her customers can find what they need. Sonia is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a hard-working woman who would like to continue growing her business. Her goals are to increase her business's stock and to be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods (rice, sugar, milk, oil)

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 55 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años llamado Juan José. Se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos, como cigarros, juguetes, golosinas, hojas de coca, etc. Ella realiza este trabajo desde hace 27 años, para cubrir los gastos de su único hijo, el cual está estudiando y requiere de más gastos. Lo bueno del trabajo de Judith es la tranquilidad que posee, ya que no requiere de estar caminando, ni cargando paquetes, haciéndole muy satisfactorio el salir a trabajar. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero adquirirá más productos y más variados para vender en su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
55-year old Judith is a single mother with a 16-year old son called Juan José. Her job is selling different types of products such as cigarettes, toys, candy, coca leaves etc. She has been doing this for the last 27 years so that she can provide for her only son who is a student. This necessitates many expenses. The good thing about Judith’s work is that she can work in comfort from one place, without having to walk far or carry heavy packages. Working in conditions like these is very satisfactory. This is her first loan with Micro Finanzas Prisma, and she is planning to be very punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy more and a wider variety of products to sell from her small stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the range of products that she sells

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en: Fizuli is a single man who lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan.  He was born in 1960.  He has been in the business of transporting goods for 2 years. He is currently seeking a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts he needs to improve his transport business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Dorti

texts.en:
Dorti C. I. is 37 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  

Dorti is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her transportation business.  Dorti owns a boat that she uses to transport goods throughout the Ucayali River region.  Her customers transfer their products between port towns using Dorti's services.

Dorti is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase replacement parts for her motorboat.  She will also purchase - over the course of her loan - 40 gallons of gas and 1 gallon of motor oil.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for her motorboat, gas and motor oil

loans.name: Roman Alberto

texts.es: Roman es un pequeño productor arrocero reconocido en su comunidad por su dedicacion a la siembra de este cultivo, habita en la finca junto a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos de 6 y 10 años que estudian la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad. La esposa ademas de atender el hogar tambien da clase como docente de primaria.  Don Roman con este credito tiene la intencion de participar como socio de la construccion de un trillo arrocero y asi alcanzar su sueño como productor de cultivo de arroz.
texts.en:
Roman is a small-scale rice grower who is well-known in his community because of his dedication to this crop. He lives on the farm with his family, which is comprised of two children, ages 6 and 10, who attend the local elementary school. Aside from her household duties, his wife also works as an elementary school teacher. Mr. Roman will use this loan to participate as a member in the construction of a rice threshing machine, thus he can reach his dream as a rice grower.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribution towards building a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Sanch

texts.en: Sanch P., 42, sells fish and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. On average, she makes around US$1.80 each day. Her husband earns US$2 per day by working as a farmer and fisherman. This couple has five children, three of whom are employed and two who are in school. Mrs. Sanch would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase fish for sale and fertilizers to expand her husband’s cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
H. Nosir has spent several years in the business of agriculture. He grows potatoes and wheat on his 3.5-hectare land. At the same time he raises cattle and sheep at his house. Nosir has a friendly family who always try to help each other. It is important to stress that he is a man whose responsibility is to provide for his family by giving them all that is necessary for their development.

Today Nosir needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops. He confidently awaits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in his business and that his family will greatly benefit. With part of the loan he will also purchase sheep to increase the head of his animals. The loan will greatly improve Nosir’s income and his family's living standards and for that he says a sincere thank you!

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily S. is currently in the business of selling perfumes in a shop and is requesting a loan to buy shoes and bedsheets to sell. Lily is 45 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy shoes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy M. is 26 years of age and comes from Brgy. Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental. He lives there with his wife and three children. They have their "sari-sari" (variety) store and his wife is obliged to care for it. it. People from their area who can not visit the downtown city will go over to Randy’s sari-sari store and buy their needs.

Randy is always optimistic for their business. He is happy that somehow he can extend help to his fellow villagers. Randy is very grateful that he became an active member of HSPFI (Kiva Partner), for that means he is able to have assistance for his business. As of this time, he is planning an expansion of his sari-sari store, and to that end, he is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. Randy now is aspiring for the success of what he had started.

loans.use: acquiring additional goods intended for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van L., 39, makes and sells rice wine in the local market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$5 per day and is aided by her husband, who raises pigs. On average, he makes US$7 in revenue a day. This couple has two children, both in school. Van L. needs a loan of US$1000 to purchase pigs and pig feed. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who hopes one day to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Shahida Noreen Muhammad Irshad Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shaista baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

Kosar baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors, creams) for her barber shop.

Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy ready-made garments to sell.

Shahida noreen baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. She is a very responsible lady and a very good human being. All of her members respect her a lot. Her husband belongs to a construction supplies business. He completes the orders of building contractors and earns income. Shahida baji performs her duties as a wife and as a woman brilliantly. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Josefa Bernarda

texts.es: Josefa Bernarda M. A. tiene la edad de 56 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Josefa tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicia este negocio por que es un mujer muy trabajadora, ya que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante con su negocio, por lo que desde muy temprano ella comenzaba a cocinar para vender la comida de manera ambulante, por lo que tenia que cargar todos los días una canasta, donde depositaba su comida al inicio solo elaboraba comidas rápidas como gallo pinto, huevos, queso frito y maduro. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para realizarle mejorar a su negocio para no perder a sus clientes. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa Bernarda M. A. is 56-years old and has 3 dependent children. Her work activity is selling food, which she has done for more than 11 years. She started this business because she is a very hardworking woman; she has always liked advancing in business, that's why she begins to cook very early in order to have food ready to sell on the streets. Josefa fills a basket everyday with the food she sells. At first, she only made fast food such as 'gallo pinto' (a dish of mixed rice and beans, called 'mottled rooster'), eggs, fried cheese and aged cheese. Now, she is requesting financing in order to improve her business, so that she doesn't lose her customers. Her wish is to improve her business every day and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 60 years old. Maria is widowed and has 3 adult children. Maria owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she prepares. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean D., 31-years old, is the mother of three children. She is married to a farmer. She started helping her husband till the rice field to contribute to the family income. They also raise chickens in their backyard. She uses the income that she gets from growing rice to meet the needs of her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy 1 bag of Furadan insecticide and 1 sack of fertilizer. She thinks that this will be a good investment in improving her business. She hopes that she will have better, healthier rice in the future. 

She participates actively in the CEVI cluster meetings. She has learned many things from other micro-entrepreneurs who have used the credit services of CEVI.

loans.use: To buy 1 bag of Furadan insectide and 1 sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Ramieh

texts.en:
Ramieh is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Ramieh has been selling clothes from her house. She also sells accessories, towels, lingerie, etc… She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Ramieh has requested a loan.

Ramieh is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and offers good quality merchandise. Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Ramieh decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family's income. In the future, she plans on opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou D. est âgée  de 50 ans,  mariée et  mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Pelengana Nord  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire  de formation, elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus depuis qu’elle était  élève.  Après avoir mener plusieurs commerces (vente de parfums, chemises et robes pour jeunes), sans grande réussite, elle finit par apprendre le métier de  teinturière  auprès d’une amie. Après sa  phase d’initiation, elle exerce seule ce métier depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation qui dépasse aujourd’hui le cadre de Ségou. Elle reçoit de la commande de l’intérieur du pays comme de l’extérieur principalement de la France où elle a sa fille mariée. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son Gala (teinture) et surtout à la broderie des habits qui sont faits des mains des maîtres.
Pour faire de la teinture, elle dilue différents produits de teintures modernes et traditionnels dans de l’eau chaude ensuite elle trempe les tissus blancs  dans cette eau pour leur donner la couleur voulue. Les tissus teintés sont étalés sur une corde pour séchage et par la suite blanchis et soigneusement emballés.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante elle a fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis  42 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3eme  prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 pièces de bazin moins, 10 kg de soude caustique et 8 kg de gomme arabique. Elle s’approvisionne  en  matières premières  sur place à Ségou. Madame  Mamou D. vend au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui  permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de prendre en charge certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un atelier de couture.

loans.use: Achat  de bazins et d’ingrédients pour la teinture.

loans.name: Grace Nyanjau

texts.en:
Grace is separated from her husband and she has three children namely Sarah, Anne and James who are 17, 13 and 6 years old.

Grace has been in the green grocery business for one year and she operates her business in a semi slum area with a large population having clients who are residents of the area.

The client was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has not borrowed form anywhere else before. She is acquiring the loan to buy more stock of green grocery and she also wants to venture into the business of cooking beans and other grains for sale. With the extra profits the clients intends to pay school fees.

Graces believes she is hardworking and she aims to achieve her hopes and dreams which are to own a retail shop. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock of vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak P., 55, lives with her husband and two of her children in the Takeo province. She raises chickens to earn a living and is able to make for less than US$1 each day. Her husband sells traditional medicines. He typically makes US$3.30 every day. This couple is also aided by one of the children who work in private company. Prak P. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and married with four children. All her children are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and her family's needs because she believes the children are her greatest asset.

She sells smoked fish in bulk at the market in the community where she lives. She has five years of selling experience. Fatima purchases her stock of goods from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells it at retail prices to her customers. She sometimes spends more time when she buys her stock so that she can buy good quality dried and smoked fish. This keeps her from having to travel frequently. She requests this loan to buy more stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a supply of smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old with two school-age children, a son and a daughter. She sells used women's clothing in a busy location in Nairobi. She's been in business for three years and previously worked at a photocopy shop. She is requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory.

Nancy says that Faulu has given her economic empowerment and, in the future, she would like to be the managing director of her own company.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma P. lives in the village of Pader Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She is 43 years old. Her husband, Rene, works as a fisherman and sometimes as a carpenter. She has three children who are between 11 and 16 years old and they are all presently studying. This couple help each other provide a better future for their children by sending them to school so that they can get a proper education and be able to improve their living conditions. They also work hard because they want to provide a comfortable life for their youngest daughter who has special needs. They plan to send her to Bacolod for special education.

Alma decided to start a business because she saw that her husband's income was not secure, and she was afraid that if she couldn’t help her husband by earning even a little income, maybe someday they would not be able to afford the education of their children and not have a stable future. This is the reason she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 – so that she could access much needed capital to put up a general store and have an independent income. As her income capacity increased, she started selling vinegar and later frozen products, earning a good income. Her businesses now earns her 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She saves most of her profit for the education of her older children and medication for her special child.

Alma's previous loan of 19,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her general store. It was fully repaid without delay and now she wants to borrow 19,500 PHP (her ninth loan) to buy a refrigerator for her general store for the frozen products she sells.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her general store

loans.name: Kabang

texts.en:
Kabang G. is currently in the business of selling bread and cakes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour and make cakes to sell. Kabang is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour and make cakes to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 45 years old. She tills a two-hectare rice field in South Cotabato. She prepares the land for cultivation well in order to have a good harvest. However, she lacks the capital to purchase other necessary farm supplies. This is why she has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. The loan will enable her to purchase the farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona del Carmen L. H., tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y ellos habitan en el Barrio conocido como Pablo Calero, un barrio en donde sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos, que luchan día  a día para poder tener el sustento diario, ellos tiene 3 hijos de 28, 25 y 19 años todos sus hijos ya están casados y se mantiene de forma independiente. La señora Ramona trabaja como afanadora   tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera y por la baja entrada de dinero no ha podría realizar los cambios que desea para su vivienda, pero con la ayuda que se le proporcione, ella conseguirá repellar las paredes de su casa y mejorar el piso de su hogar con este crédito se comprara los materiales h utilizar tales como cemento, bloque arena y hierro, con estos cambio podrá la familia L. tener  mejores comodidades para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Ramona del Carmen L. H. is 54 and married. They live in the neighborhood known as Pablo Calero. People in this neighborhood have scarce resources, and they fight day to day for their daily support. They have three children; 28, 25, and 19. All of their children are married and independent. Ramona has worked as a janitor for ten years. With the low amount of money she receives, she has not been able to make the changes to her house that she wants to make. With the help that is provided, she will replaster the walls of her house and improve the floor to her home. She will use this loan to buy materials like cement, blocks, sand, and iron. With these changes the L. family will be able to have more comforts in order to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni B. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol beverages. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell. Poni is 35 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. is from the village of Banquero. She is 42 years-old and married with seven school-aged children. Rosa raises crops and primarily plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosa joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike weaves and sells the traditional cloth of the Yoruba’s called ‘aso-oke’. This cloth comes in various colors and it is worn in Nigeria on various occasions. Nike also sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. She hopes to expand her business. 

Nike hopes for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. Her children are excelling in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Aydelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aydelina del Carmen L. G. desde muy joven se dedica a la realización de calzado, en sus inicios trabajo en varios talleres donde aprendió esta hermosa labor.  Luego de un tiempo decidió independizarse y en el 2005 junto con su esposo instala un pequeño taller de calzado.   

Este es un negocio familiar el cual ha ido creciendo  según  L. esto es debido a que ellos  se han distribuido el trabajo adecuadamente, ella se dedica a la administración y comercialización del producto mientras su esposo se encarga de la producción junto a su hijo mayor y cinco trabajadores.  
 
Actualmente ella necesita del préstamo para invertir en materia prima para la producción de sandalias finas, veraniegas y de cuero que es lo de mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Aydelina del Carmen L. G. has made shoes since she was a young girl; she learned by working in various shops. In time, she decided to become independent and in 2005, together with her husband, she set up her own small cobbler's shop. This is a family business that has been steadily growing. According to her, this is due to the fact that they share the workload adequately: she administers the shop and sells the product while her husband, together with their oldest son and five employees, manufacture the goods. She currently needs financing to invest in raw materials to make fine Summer, leather sandals, which are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: K. Proscovia is forty-two years old. She is a married woman with five children and has three of her dependents in schooling. She owns a dairy shop that she has been operating for over fourteen years. She is using the loan to purchase cows for milk, donuts, bread, and so forth. Her dream is to get more income to boost her business by purchasing more cows for milk so that she can be able to supply milk to fulfill the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase cows for milk, donuts, bread, and so forth.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria tiene 49 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Mariano (49), que es agricultor, y de sus 2 hijos menores, sus hijos mayores ya viven independientemente.

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo papa y alverjas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y cuida con mucha paciencia cada planta para que lleguen sin dificultad a la cosecha. Cuando debe recoger la producción contrata a operarios para que le ayuden y la producción la vende finalmente a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona. Con las ganancias obtenidas del esfuerzo que hace junto a su esposo, puede ofrecer  una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, además de educación.
Para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar su producción y vender en mayor cantidad, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus hijos y dejarles como herencia tierras fértiles en las que puedan seguir sembrando.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos los integrantes cumplen puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas y son un grupo bastante organizado, ya que han logrado juntar una buena cantidad de ahorros.

Hilaria tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono, guano e insecticidas para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras y así sembrar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 49 years old, she lives in her own house with her husband Mariano (49) who is a farmer, and their two younger children, their grown-up children are independent.

Since very young she has been a farmer, presently she is planting potato and pea together with her husband. She likes her work very much as it is calm and she patiently takes care of each plant to make the harvest successful. When the crop is ready she hires helpers and the production is finally sold to wholesalers in the area. With the profit of her and her husband's effort she can offer a good living quality as well as schooling to her children.

For the future she plans to increase the production and sell more as she wishes to give her children the best and leave her children fertile land for them to continue farming.

This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that have made the loan possible for her to continue working in search of progress. She is very pleased with the work of her community bank as well, as all the members repay their loans punctually and they are a well organized group as they have succeeded in gathering a good amount of savings.

Hilaria plans to invest the requested money in buying fertilizer, guano, and pesticides to give maintenance to her land and be able to farm without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, owns a small, two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years. She is a very talented and hardworking lady. She operates a clothes-sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She sews clothes for her neighbors and charges them  PKR100 for simple stitching and PKR150 for stitching designer suits. She sews two suits in every day and usually generates an income of almost PKR 300 daily. She uses half of her money to purchase kitchen items and she saves the other half for a rainy day. She has good managing skills. She not only works for the betterment of her family but also takes care of their health as well. She handles the domestic chores and cooks food for them. 

Her husband is involved in an animal selling business. He purchases the animals from the animal market and sells them to his customers. He also loves to take care of the animals. When the animals are fully grown, he sells them to the animal market and generates income. He has been in this profession for the last ten years. 

Shahnaz is applying for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchase the animals (goats) and increase the profit of his business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Nelly  Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Del Futuro desde hace 6 ciclos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo cada 15 días, nuestra socia Nelly esta casada mantiene una maravillosa relación de 10 años con el padre de sus hijos, tiene una niña de 8 años y a la espera de su segundo niño.

La señora Nelly tiene un Kiosco  de comida rápida en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ofrece a sus clientes empanadas, hamburguesas y  batidos, hace un año que instaló su negocio  lo ubicó en la parte frontal de su casa, compró sillas y mesas y empezó a trabajar hasta los actuales momentos y le va muy bien, tiene que abrir todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Nuestra socia con este nuevo crédito  podrá invertir en un techo  para el negocio al igual que en mesas y licuadoras y en los productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos, quien le ayuda en el negocio es  su esposo y su hermana, esta muy feliz porque sus ventas están bien.
texts.en:
Nelly has belonged to the Mujeres Del Futuro Communal bank for six cycles. This bank meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. Our member, Nelly, is married. She maintains a marvelous ten year relationship with the father of her children. She has an eight year old daughter, and she is expecting her second child. Nelly has a fast food kiosk in the city of Portoviejo. She sells empanadas, hamburgers, and milk shakes to her customers. She set up her business a year ago, and it is located in the front part of her house. She bought chairs and tables, and she started to work. She continues to work, and it is going very well for her. She has to open everyday from six in the morning until ten at night.
