With this new loan our member will be able to invest in a roof for her business, tables, blenders, and the necessary products to prepare the food. Her husband and her sister help her in the business. She is very happy because her sales are good.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A roof for her kiosk, tables, blenders, meat, bread, fruit, flour, and eggs

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Ta Preah village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srey S. is the group leader as selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey S. was born in 1974. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. At present, she has some problems because her field is infertile and it needs to be plowed. In order to improve production, Mrs. Srey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rent a machine to plow her field, and, with the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Sam Art Den, is a duck breeder. She is the mother of three children who all attend the local public school. The day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Srey S. was busy working in the field. Therefore, her husband, Mr. Sam Art Den, received the loan for her. The photo above is of Mrs. Srey S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a plow.

loans.name: Jacira

texts.es: Jacira tiene 22 años, comparte su vida con su madre, juntas viven en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años se dedica en la venta de comida, en un pequeño local que arrendó cerca de su casa. Desde entonces, y a partir del medio día, empieza con la venta de comida, además su madre es el principal apoyo que tiene, ya sea en la preparación o atención de los clientes. Afirma además, que disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya que recibe los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hijo, otras de las ventajas que tiene con este trabajo, es que puede cuidar de su hijo. Por tanto desea mejorar su establecimiento, implementándola y mejorando en la atención. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ollas nuevas, mesas y alimentos no perecibles que le servirá en la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Jacira is 22 years old and shares her life with her mother. They live together in her parents' house. For the past two years she's been selling food from a small stall that she set up close to her home. Ever since then, beginning at noon, she begins selling food. Her mother is her primary helper, whether it includes food preparation or tending to customers. She says that she enjoys the work she does, especially because she earns the income she needs to support her son. Another advantage this business gives her is that she is able to care for her son. Now, she would like to improve her establishment and customer service. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy, knowing that she has financial support and she is grateful to be a part of a communal group because all of its members are very responsible and supportive. She will use the money from this loan to buy new cookware, tables, and non-perishable food items that she will use to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Bombooti Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BOMBOOTI a vu le jour depuis la création du Banc Villageois il ya 9 ans. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de 05 femmes du même quartier. Il a pour but de renforcer la solidarité de groupe en particulier et de s'entraider entre membre en cas de difficulté de remboursement en général.

Madame Georgette KALAMON à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge.

Elle envisage de vendre des légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner à Ziguinchor et revend sa marchandise à domicile au marché Tiléne dans le département de Ziguinchor. 

Son nouveau crédit de 250.000 francs CFA lui permettra d’acheter de choux pommé, de carottes, de navets, de piments etc.

Son objectif est de développer son activité. Appuyer son mari sur les charges familiales tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The BOMBOOTI group was formed when the Banc Villageois of NEMA2 was created nine years ago. It consists of five women from the same neighborhood. Specifically, its goal is to strengthen the bond of solidarity within the group and more generally, for the members to help each other in case of difficulties with loan repayment. Mrs. Georgette KALAMON, at the far right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is 47 years old. She is married and a mother to nine dependent children. She plans to sell vegetables. She has good experience in this field. She expects to get her stocks in Ziguinchor for resale at her local market in Tiléne, in the Ziguinchor department. Her new loan of 250,000F CFA will allow her to buy cabbage, carrots, turnips, peppers, etc. Her goal is to expand her business, help her husband with the family’s expenses, and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education.

Mercy sells ladies’ underwear at Takoradi and assists her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. She will use the loan to purchase more ladies’ wear to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' wear to sell

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoraida R. M. cliente recurrente  de nuestra entidad,  vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque.
 La titular cuenta con una despensa hace mas de 15 años, posee una buena clientela formada ya que es una de las despensas mas surtidas en el barrio, dicho préstamo solicito para comprar un lote de mercaderías y artículos de mercería para dicho negocio. 
Ha la fecha la Sra. Felicia ha retirado su segundo préstamo y  opera con nuestra institución desde el 2009.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le ayudara para un  mejor nivel de vida.-
texts.en:
Sra. Zoraida R. M. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. She lives in her own home in the city of Luque. Zoraida has been operating a food pantry for more than 15 years. She has a good customer base and manages one of the best stocked shops in the neighborhood. With this loan request, she will buy a batch of merchandise and dry goods for her business. As of this date, Sra. Zoraida has repaid her second loan and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2009. She says this loan will help improve the profit margins of her business and raise her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, flour, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional bags of charcoal

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que vive en el Municipio de Malambo con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 27 años. Desde muy niña conocía bien el negocio que hoy tiene, porque  viene de una familia  de pescadores, de allí nació la idea de tener una microempresa de comercialización de  pescado y esta misma iniciativa le desarrolló su capacidad emprendedora; es así como también se presta  el servicio de transporte en motocicleta  en su municipio, lugar  donde es usual trasladarse de un lugar a otro en este vehiculo. 
Desde hace mas de 23 años se dedica a la comercialización de pescado, su esposo es pescador en Palermo, un puerto en Barranquilla y a su alrededor es muy conocida la actividad que él realiza, por eso le compran en su propia casa,  porque  saben que ella ofrece el mas sano y fresco pescado diariamente. Gracias a su trabajo logro adquirir su vivienda y a obtener ingresos con el que logró su otro negocio de transporte en motocicleta; ella y sus hermanos se encuentran vinculados desde hace ya varios años a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y conocen muy bien a esta organización, por eso en la actualidad esta aplicando para obtener sus credickiva  con el cual comprará una canoa, que facilitará la oferta permanente de su producto, pues la que tienen es pequeña y no está en buenas condiciones. Con los financiamientos de esta organización ha logrado comprar su enfriador, mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo construir su historia crediticia. 
Su mayor desafío es cuando el pecado escasea  y le resulta difícil atender la demanda de los clientes, por eso  su solución es la compra de una canoa de mayor tamaño y en perfectas condiciones. Sus sueños están enfocados en la ampliación de su negocio porque lo conoce perfectamente y también con incrementar su oferta de servicios comprando a mediano plazo una nueva moto para el transporte que es otra actividad generadora de ingresos que ayuda al mejoramiento de sus condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a hardworking woman who lives in the town of Malambo with her husband. She has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 27-years-old. Since a very young age she's known the fishing business well because she comes from a family of fishermen. From that background came the idea to have a small commercial fishing company, and this initiative helped develop her skills as a businesswoman. From this knowledge comes also the transportation service that she provides in her town, where it's typical to get from one place to another on motorcycles. For more than 23 years she has sold fish. Her husband is a well-known fisherman in Palermo, a port in Barranquilla, and people come to their home to buy the fish because they know that Luz Marina offers the freshest and healthiest fish every day. Thanks to her work she managed to buy a house and and save enough income to start her motorcycle transport service. She and her siblings have been connected for serveral years with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and they know the organization very well. Currently she's applying to obtain this Kiva loan with which she will buy a canoe, which will help her ensure the stability of her product. The canoe they currently work with is small and in poor condition. With the loans from this organization she's managed to buy a smoke chiller, increase her income and, above all, build her credit. Her biggest challenge is when the fish supply is low and it becomes difficult to meet the demand of her customers. The solution to this is the purchase of a bigger canoe in perfect condition. Her dreams are focused on the expansion of her business because she knows well that increasing her services will help her buy a new motorcycle for her transport business, which is another generator of income that will help improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a canoe

loans.name: Emily Chepngetich

texts.en:
Emily Chepngetich S. is a hardworking lady of 41 years, married to Nelson Lagat who is a teacher. Together they have five children, aged 17 years, 15 years, 12 years, 10 years and six years. They live in Kapsoya Eldoret, Kenya. She has been farming (poultry Farm) for about five years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs.5,000.

When she learned about KADET LTD she has no history with any other MFI. she has applied for her second loan of Ksh. 30,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy supplies of poultry feed and more chicks to rear and sale later at a profit. She will also have more eggs to sell to her customers .She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to buy a dairy cow.

Emily hopes to grow her business and become the leading local business in poultry farming in the area and to see her children realize their dreams in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy supplies of poultry feed and more chicks to rear and sale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 36 años, vive al lado de su esposa Maribel de 42 años y de su pequeña hija de 10 años, juntos luchan cada día en busca del progreso. Desde hace 12 años su vida ha estado ligada al transporte, primero era cobrador de un vehiculo de transporte publico, pero el salario era muy poco y él aspiraba a más. Es por esta razón que hace 1 año empezó a laborar como “datero” para la misma empresa de transportes; y la función  que desempeña es informar acerca de los horarios entre los vehículos, de esta manera pasa el dato a los choferes y obtiene mejores ganancias que en otras épocas, además trabaja al lado de su esposa que marca el reloj del paso de los vehículos de la misma línea para la que trabajan  (para llevar el control de la empresa). Pedro trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y esta muy satisfecho pues su labor es muy entretenida; y como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad ya que no quiere quedar mal con su compañera de grupo, que es trabajadora al igual que él; y también no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Pedro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para refaccionar el techo de la pieza de su casa que la convertirá en tienda; además empezará  a comprar mercadería en comestibles para comenzar con el negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro, 36, lives with his wife Maribel, age 42, and their 10 year old daughter. Together they struggle every day to get ahead. For the past 12 years he has been in the transportation industry, first as a fare collector on a bus, but the salary was low and he had greater aspirations. For that reason he started working as a "datero" for the same company. This job entails reporting on the schedules for various buses, information which he passes along to the drivers and  keeps a record for the company. 

Pedro works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and is happy with his job as it's quite interesting. Since he is an entrepreneurial man he plans to start a small general store in his home. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to pay back on time since he doesn't want to let his friend in the group down since she is also hard working like him. He also doesn't want to let all the people who made this loan possible down since it will allow him to keep working. 

Pedro plans to invest the loan in the purchase of materials to repair the roof in the area of his house where his store will be. He will also start buying inventory for the business.

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair his roof as well as purchase inventory for a store he wishes to start.

loans.name: Yessica Lizbeth

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de flores artificiales en su domicilio. Estos objetos son ornamentales y muy apreciados por las familias de la zona. Ella vende estos productos por pedidos. Adicionalmente comercializa prendas de vestir bajo el mismo método pero en menor cantidad. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Jessica desea ampliar su negocio aumentando su stock de productos de modo que sus ventas y sus ganancias se puedan incrementar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Jessica es una joven bastante tranquila y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su negocio por temporada navideña y aumentar su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Jessica is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the District of Olmos, an agricultural area that experiences considerable business activity. This community is situated in Lambayeque Province and is located more than 1½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jessica sells artificial flowers from her home. These items are used as decorations and well-appreciated by the families in the area. She sells these products upon request. In addition, she sells clothes in the same manner but in fewer quantities. With the income she generates from her business, she is able to cover her personal expenses and help her family with their daily needs.

Jessica wants to expand her business by increasing her inventory of products to increase her sales and generate more revenue. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN to help achieve her goal.

Jessica is a peaceful young woman who has great desire to succeed. Her greatest wish is to increase her business during the Christmas season and generate more sales with her clothing business.

loans.use: Purchase artificial flowers to expand her business

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace 14 años que tiene este negocio,  el negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, en donde asisten vecinos, amigos, familiares y público en general, Carlos conoce muy bien a sus clientes y lo que más demandan. Esta no es la primera que realiza financiamientos ya que han sido un gran aporte. Actualmente es él quien se está haciendo cargo de sus 2 hijos menores de edad y les proporciona alimentos, vestimenta, estudios y les enseña a como sobrellevar la vida. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carlos has had a grocery store for the last 14 years.  It is located in his home where friends, neighbors, family members and the general public come by.  Carlos knows his customers and what they need very well.  This isn’t his first loan because they have been of great use to him.

He is currently caring for his two minor children.  He feeds, clothes, educates and teaches them how to carry on in life.

The reason for the loan is to buy stock items like basic grains, sweets, beverages, bread and detergents, among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Betis Carolina

texts.es: Betis Carolina tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Es una mujer muy emprendedora no es la primera vez que solicita créditos ya que es una persona muy trabajadora. El financiamiento es para comprar pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos, cremas entre otras cosas ya que se acerca una buena temporada navideña. Sueña con mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Betis Carolina takes care of her 3 children. She engages in selling cosmetics. She is a very resourceful woman, and it is not the first time she has asked for a loan as she is a very hard-working person. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy nail polish, lipsticks, power, creams and other items as the profitable holiday season is approaching. She dreams of improving her economic condition.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell during the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: El Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Para Yolanda tener una buena sazón para preparar las comidas fue el primer motivo por lo cual decidió emprender su  negocio D. venta D. menú, al principio solo tenia pocos clientes por lo mismo preparaba pocas cantidades con el paso del tiempo la cantidad D. comensales ha aumentado actualmente atienD. a muchas personas que disfrutan D. su buena sazón, para esto ha tenido que usar parte D. su casa para  poner sillas y mesas donD. atienD. al publico que acuD. en busca D. su buena comida, D. ese modo les brinda comodidad sus clientes quienes mayoritariamente son  trabajadores D. la zona y estudiantes D. un instituto que esta cerca D. su casa, además D. eso reparte pedidos para varios negocios D. la zona, Yolanda es feliz por que su negocio crece cada día además cuenta con la ayuda  D. su único hijo y una sobrina, gracias a su trabajo ha podido darle una buena educación a su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera, ella sabe que su negocio crecerá mas, para eso se esta preparando, quiere tener su restaurante D. manera formal con atención al publico ahora esta terminando la construcción en una parte D. su casa y su préstamo le servirá para terminar el piso D. su local, como miembro del grupo “EL BELLO AMANECER”  tiene el cargo D. presidenta  una gran responsabilidad por que dirige a 10 socias, que al igual que ella tratan se surgir en sus negocios.

* Yolanda esta con chompa celeste y pantalon blanco.
texts.en:
Being a good cook was the reason that maD. Yolanda deciD. to start a restaurant business.  At the beginning she had few customers and thus she only maD. small amounts of food, but with time, the quantity of meals needed  increased and now she has many people who enjoy her good food.  She has had to use part of her house to put tables and chairs where she serves the public who come for her good food.  Most of her customers are workers from the area and students of the institute that is near her house. She's able to offer them a comfortable place to eat.  She also delivers food to various businesses in the area.  Yolanda is happy that her business is growing more every day and  since she is a single mother, one of her sons helps her.  She knows that the business will grow more and she is getting ready for this. She would like to have a more formal restaurant for the public and she is completing the construction of a part of the house.  The loan will help her finish the floor of the restaurant area.  She is a member of the group El Bello Amanecer where she is the president.  This is a big responsibililty since the is in charge of 10 members, who like her, are trying to improve their businesses.

Yolanda is the one with the blue sweater and white pants.

loans.use: To finish putting down the floor of her new restaurant

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. She also cares for three adopted children. Francine sells bananas. She employs five other people to help her. Francine has been in the business for eight months and the hours of the business are from 6am to 9pm every day. 

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel D. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Maricel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Malaika Group

texts.fr: Furaha H.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Malaika, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Son conjoint  l’assiste dans s son business.  Furaha H.  est  vendeuse de braises,elle s’ installe dans un dépôt d’exposition de grossistes.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari d’une valeur 300$. Depuis 2000, elle exerce cette activité.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (57 sacs des braises).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et voir ses enfants finir leurs études. La cliente Furaha H. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Malaika est constitué de 13 membres, bien habillés confortablement avec  l’uniforme d’unité.
texts.en:
H. Furaha is an entrepreneur and leader of the Malaika business group. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of six children. Her spouse assists her in her business.

H. Furaha sells charcoal in a depot where wholesalers display their goods. She started her business with her own funds, $300 supplied by her husband. She has been running her business since 2000.

Later she benefited from a $50 credit loan from the Hekima MFI. This new loan will serve to resupply her merchandise (57 bags of charcoal). Moreover her ambition is to expand her business and see her children complete their education.

As a customer H. Furaha thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to impoverished people who are excluded from normal banking services. The Malaika group is made up of 13 members, comfortably dressed in their unit’s uniform.

loans.use: 57 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. is from the village of Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Susan is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector operating a motorcycle transport services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del NOrte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  George has a bar, which he has had for two years.         

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more beer and soda for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, George hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, George hopes to finish all his rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: Yasini

texts.en:
Yasini is a married man with six children, three of whom attend lower level school while one attends college. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past twenty years, he has operated a fish and crab selling business. He sells at the market to his neighbors and to tourists visiting the area. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase sacks of fish and crabs for sale. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Yasini dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale shop in the future. He decided to join Yehu microfinance to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish and crabs for sale

loans.name: Ammabel

texts.en: Ammabel is 39 years old and married with three children in school. Ammabel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Ammabel has been in her business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as curls, shampoo, soap, candy and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Ammabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zorik

texts.en:
A 50-year-old resident of Ddmashen village, Sevan area, Zorik M. is married and has a son and a daughter, the latter a student. Zorik, his wife and his son are engaged in farming, raising cows, pigs and chickens, the income from which pays for his daughter’s education and supports his family. He now
needs a 300.000 AMD loan to repair his cattle shed’s roof.

loans.use: to repair his cattle shed’s roof.

loans.name: Elenita Languido's Group

texts.en: Elenita is a married woman with three adult children. She is 52 years old and has had a food-selling business for 10 years. She sells vegetables like cabbage, eggplant and some other varieties to generate profits daily. Elenita has been in this business for 10 years. She is the group leader of her group of seven members. They have individual loan requests and will pay collectively every week. Elenita is requesting a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos to buy vegetables to sell such as pechay (cabbage), tomatoes and potatoes too. In the future, Elenita hopes to provide a sustainable livelihood for her family to progress. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell such as pechay (cabbage), tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 46 years old,  married and living in Natappian East, Solana, Cagayan. She has four children. Divina's spouse works as a farmer and together they work hard to meet their family's daily consumption.

Divina has been in the business of hog raising for 10 years now. She plans to use this loan to buy vitamins and medicines for the hogs and purchase vegetables to vend in order to have another source of income.

Divina has been a client of ASKI for five years. In the future, she would like to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and medicines for her  hogs andto  purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He lives in Kirillovka, a small town on the Azov Sea, which is a resort area. Alexander runs a small retail business selling souvenirs and imitation jewelry at the local bus station marketplace. He usually purchases merchandise wholesale in Odessa and then resells it to tourists in Kirillovka. Alexander has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, he has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas.
Alexander is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional souvenirs, imitation jewelry and semi-precious gems for further retail sale in small coastal resort areas. Alexander is planning to increase his sales and develop his range of merchandise as a result. He is hoping to open an additional vending location as a result of business expansion. Alexander is very enterprising; he knows how to organize and run his business effectively.

loans.use: to purchase additional souvenirs, imitation jewelry and semi-precious gems for resale.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont 3 enfants.   
Kossi a travaillé comme chaudronnier depuis 2005. Il fabrique des objets pour la décoration des portes pour toutes personnes.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une meuleuse à disque, une perceuse à perçu et un étau métallique. Il veut satisfaire la demande croissante, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 33 year old man.  He is married to a seamstress. They have 3 children. Kossi has worked as a boilermaker since 2005.  He makes objects for door decorations for everyone.  Kossi requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a disc sander, a drill, and a metal vise.  He wants to meet growing demand, guarantee a better future for his children, and participate in the support of his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma is 49 years old.  She is married and has 4 children. With all 4 children in school, Ma. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.  She sells a  variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, snack food and other groceries.   She has been in this business for 2 years.  

Ma. Elma has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 39 years old. He is a hardworking and determined businessman who is always working to succeed. He is married and blessed with three children, of whom two are in school. Andrew earns his income by making pans using scrap metals. His association with Kiva's partner, Faulu Kenya, has enabled him to benefit by getting business ideas and accessing financial resources. He hopes in the next five years to reach a wider market. His dream is to be self reliant and independent. Andrew is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine and scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and scrap metal

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, logro aprenderlo como una alternativa de trabajo. Ella siempre ha sido una persona muy independiente y disfruta de tener un medio de ingres para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, toallas, adornos, vasos de vidrio y cortinas. Ella sueña con mantener su negocio muy activo y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Socorro is 55 years old.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business over 30 years.  She managed to learn it as an alternative source of work.  She’s always been a very independent person and enjoys having a source of income to support her family. The loan she’s requesting is to buy clothes, cosmetics, sheets, towels, decorations, glass drinking glasses and drapes.  She dreams with keeping her business very active and with increasing inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, footwear, sheets, towels, decorations, glass drinking glasses and drapes.

loans.name: Olparari

texts.en:
Olparari, 40 years old and married, has three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and land preparation). 

With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like wheat seeds and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una mujer trabajadora y muy creativa y muy esforzada, tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Tiene su restaurante desde 5 años y medio, sus hijos la animaron a tener su negocio aprovechando de la buena sazón que tiene en cada plato que prepara. Este negocio actualmente lo desarrolla en un local que alquiló y se ubica en una zona muy comercial. Es así que todos los días atiende su restaurante, sus hijos la ayudan en la atención, de esta manera logra vender buena cantidad de platos al día que le permite tener ganancias satisfactoria. Afirma que cada día le agrada trabajar en este negocio porque le permite alimentar bien a su familia y  desarrollar lo que le apasiona como es la cocina, es por esta razón que continuará trabajando en este rubro con el objetivo de ser un restaurante de prestigio. Desde que decidió trabajar con MFP desde hace varios años no ha dejado de responder adecuadamente en el pago de cada cuota de manera puntual, razón por la cual sigue accediendo a estos préstamos porque se ha ganado la confianza cuyo respaldo es su responsabilidad. En esta ocasión es su oportunidad 15 de solicitud de crédito de manera grupal. Con el dinero que solicita, se abastecerá comprando al por mayor los ingredientes básicos en la preparación de comida como: arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Alicia is a very hardworking, creative and dedicated woman. She is 39 and lives with her husband and 3 children in a rented house. She has had her restaurant for five and a half years. Her children encouraged her to open her business and capitalize on her wonderful cooking skills. 

Her business is currently operated in a rented space and is located in a very commercial area. There she runs her restaurant every day, with her children’s help, and is able to sell a large enough number of meals a day to earn a satisfactory income. She says that every day she is grateful to work in this business because it enables her to provide well for her family and to do what she is passionate about, which is to cook. For this reason, she plans to continue working in this field with the goal of becoming a restaurant of renown.

Since she has been working with MFP for the past several years, she has always made her payments on time and therefore continues taking out these loans because she has gained the confidence that comes from meeting her obligations. At present, this is her 15th loan request as part of a group. With this loan, she will stock up, buying basic supplies wholesale that she uses to prepare her dishes, such as rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Emil

texts.ru: Emil rodilsya v 1978 qodu. On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Emil jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy. Uje 7 let kak on imeyet magazin i samje rabotayet v nem. Emil seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye magazina dlya razmesheniya razlichnix tovarov.
texts.en: Emil was born in 1978.  He is married, but does not have children.  Emil lives in the Baku region together with his wife.  He has owned a store, where he works, for seven years.  Emil now needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his store space to make room for various merchandise.

loans.use: to expand his store space

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica a la agricultura cosecha: pipián, maíz, frijoles, vive con su esposa, este oficio, lo aprendió de su padre ya tiene 3 años de trabajar en los cultivos, para esto requiere tiempo por eso todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo no tiene un horario establecido, ademas trabaja en serigrafia, haciendo rotulos publicitarios.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los fertilizantes, y de esa forma tener muy buena cosecha, y obtener buenos ingresos de su venta con los clientes y dejar una parte para el sustento de su familia.
El sueño de Francisco es que este año sea muy productivo, y sacar más ganancias para beneficio de la familia, tambien quiere capacitarse en el area de al serigrafia para mejorar el trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco works as a farmer.  He plants pipián (a type of squash), corn, and beans.  He lives with his wife.  He learned to farm from his father and he has done this work for three years.  He does this work every day from Monday to Sunday but does not have a set schedule.  He also works doing screen printing, making advertising signs.  

He will use this loan to purchase fertilizers so that he will have a good harvest and earn a good profit from his sales to his customers and leave part to support his family.

Francisco's dream is that this year is very productive and that he earns more income to benefit his family.  He also wants to get training in screen printing to improve his work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 22 años está casada con el señor Ismael desD. hace 4 años, juntos han procreado un niño D. nombre Imanol aun no estudia. Su esposo trabaja D. obrero en la comunidad.
Edith se dedica a la crianza D. animales ahorita tiene una vaca y un caballo en esta actividad lleva 2 años, la vaca la quiere para que le crías y aprovechar la leche para el alimento D. su familia y el caballo para carga pesada, esta vez ella solicita  el crédito para comprar material ya que  a sus animales le hacen falta un corral donD. vivan, porque para ella es un problema que sus animales estén afuera mojándose o que pasen el frio ahora que ya llegaron las heladas y pueden enfermar y morir, situacion que no le gustaría vivir ya que para ella fue un sacrificio enorme hacerse D. estos animales. Edith comprara montenes, lámina y  fierros para poder hacer el corral.
La esperanza que tiene Edith es que sus animales crezcan grandes y fuertes y el corral se haga lo las granD. posible, para que cuando la vaca D. su primer becerrito lo venda y pueda comprar borregos.
“Gracias por el crédito porque para mí es D. gran ayuda ya que va ayudar D. mucho a construir el corral D. mis animales porque por el momento con cuento con dinero y me urge hacerles su corral”
texts.en:
Edith is 22 years old and has been married to Ismael for four years.  The couple have a son named Imanol who is not yet in school.  Edith's husband works as a manual worker in their community.

Edith raises animals.  Right now, she has a cow and a horse.  She has been in this business for two years.  She has the cow to breed and plans to use its milk to feed her family.  The horse is used for moving heavy loads.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy materials as her animals need a pen in which to live.  It causes her problems if her animals are outsiD. getting wet or cold now that the frosts have come.  They can get sick and die.  She would not like to experience this situation as it was an enormous sacrifice for her to obtain these animals.  Edith will use her money to buy beams, sheets of metal and iron to make her pen.

Edith hopes that her animals will grow big and strong and she wants to build her pen as large as possible so that when her cow has its first calf she can sell it and buy some lambs.

She says "Thank you for the loan.  It will be a great help to me as it will help me to build a pen for my animals.  I have the money and I must build it as soon as possible".

loans.use: to buy beams, metal sheets and iron

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin de 41 años  de edad, labora como director del área del medio ambiente en la Alcaldía Municipal  desde hace 7 años, requiere de su 5to crédito para mejorar  infraestructura  de su tramo,  y así porder brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes que le visitan, en su comunidad es una persona bien reconocida por la relación social y el trabajo que desarrolla, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañera quien labora como docente, juntos tienen una familia bien estable conformada por sus dos hijos, y sus mejores sueños es formarlos y enseñarles a trabajar para que sean hombres de bien en el futuro y heredarles condiciones y herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en: Marvin, 41, has worked as a director for the city government's environmental department for the last seven years.  He needs his fifth loan to make improvements to his plot of land to provide better conditions to his customers.  He’s very well known in his community because of his good social relationships and for the work he does.  His spouse, who works as a teacher, supports his efforts.  They have a stable family composed of their two children and his greatest wish is to raise them and teach them how to work so that they will be upstanding citizens in the future and to pass down to them conditions and tools to work.

loans.use: to plaster walls

loans.name: Defina

texts.en:
Defina is 39 years old and married. Her spouse is a farmer who provides additional income. They have been blessed with five children, ages 14, 12, 10, 7, and 5. For the past 17 years, she has run a retail shop, which currently provides a monthly income of 28,000 KES.

She is borrowing a loan of 70,000 KES, which she intends to use to add inventory for her business: cooking oil, bags of sugar, maize flour, bathing soap, and crates of soda. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees and to re-invest in her business.

This is her sixth loan. She successfully repaid her previous loans well. Her hopes and dreams are to give her children a better life and to build a home.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.

Roberto has a pigpen and sells matured and grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Roberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a master tailor. He operates his shop in the market and is an expert in men's clothing.
With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and also hire a worker to assist him. This will allow him to finish the orders on time and earn him more income.

Bushra also sews clothes to financially support her husband. She sews clothes for her community ladies and earns good income due to her good quality work. The income she earns helps her pay school fees for her eldest daughter who is studying in a nearby school. Her youngest daughter is only 2 and half years old.  Bushra is confident about her husband’s business success.  He has operated his business for the past many years.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu is 44 years old. She is a member of the Duc Lan cluster. She has two children. Not only does she grow rice but she also breeds poultry. She has raised chickens for three years.

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). This is the 5th time she borrowed money from SEDA. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 28-year-old business man, who lives in Juba.  He is single. Isaac runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for one year. He has one employee. Isaac heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1000 to purchase more items like soap and dry goods. In addition to this business, Isaac has no other source of income.  In 5 years, Isaac hopes for a better future like having a good house.  His major challenges include competitors.  Isaac says that he appreciates Finance Sudan for considering low income earners by giving them loans to support their business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soap and dry goods.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she sells soup at home. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her children is a garment worker. 

Phally is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as a motor taxi. By doing so, her son can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to renew her house and expand her business of selling soup.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "JUNTOS DE LA MANO"; El banco esta situado en el Distrito de Iscuchaca en la Provincia de Anta perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica como principal actividad a la crianza de porcinos, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de porcinos la socia comprara 20 porcinos.



La socia agradece el credito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Angelica belongs to the Juntos De La Mano communal bank.  The bank is located in the Iscuchca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Angelica, age 30, is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  Her main business activity is raising pigs.  She wishes to invest the loan in buying pigs.  She will buy 20 pigs.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy 20 pigs.

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, milk, coffee, shampoos and soap. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more goods like canned goods biscuits and all food products to sell.

Bevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more good lto sell like canned goods, biscuits, and other food products to sell

loans.name: Matsatsaneng Centre Group

texts.en:
Makhothatso is an elderly mother aged 85. She is a mother of 7 children and three grandchildren with 6 great grand children aged between 10 and 6 years. She lives with her 90-year-old husband and her great grand children. Makhothatso finds life very difficult seeing that both she and her husband are unemployed and find means of living from pension and crop farming. They live in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor does it warm up well in winter. 

Together with her husband, she works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her family, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 4am and 5am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for all the children before they go to school. Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. 

Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high. Winters can get very cold, and often Makhothatso has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, death. In these circumstances, life for people like Makhothatso is very difficult. 

Makhothatso has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves, which will provide her and 6 other people from her village, who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require expensive paraffin and gas, or a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho. This stove can be started with the use of very little readily-available biomass, like dry twigs and dry cow dung, that does not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home. 

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. It is a life-improving package for these women. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates toxic inhalation, and gives them a better lit home to see in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For more stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and time spent collecting firewood.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is married with 4 children and her last born is in college. She is a retired civil servant and now her major source of income is from the sale of milk from two cows. Her last born is in her final year at Shine College doing Certified Public Accountants stage 3, she is privately sponsored and this requires a lot of money. Currently she sells 10 litres per day which gives her USD 4 a day. Damaris’ income is very low to pay for her child school fees and thus need to access a loan which will be paid in installments on a monthly basis. This would be easier for her because her business will not be affected and her cash flow will remain stable.

loans.use: She would like to pay School fees for her child who is in her final year doing CPA(K).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is an exciting woman who plies her trade with lots of humor and diligence. She is affable and very astute in her trading venture. Mary would like to increase her sales and therefore needs more capital to support her business. She needs a Kiva loan of $1200 to buy purchase more cooking utensils for sale.

loans.use: Utensils

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Shortly after Ukraine gained it’s independence in 1991, Vasiliy took advantage of new economic freedoms and opened his first grocery store in the city of Kharkiv. Fifteen years later, his business is thriving. He has expanded by opening a second store, employs ten people and is in the process of remodeling a third store that will hopefully open soon. Eventually he would like to build a new building on his own land. Vasiliy is an energetic and hard-working business owner but also very kind and caring. He strives to maintain quality service in his stores and take care of his customers. For each of his employees he provides a retirement plan – a very good benefit for a private employer. Vasiliy and his wife have two sons and are active in their church. Their desire is for others to share the hope they have in Jesus Christ. Vasiliy has requested a loan for $1000 to add to his working capital. Increasing competition makes it all the more important for him to maintain a broad and fresh product selection. He’d like to use this money to expand the amount of goods he has available in his stores.

Після того, як Україна отримала незалежність в 1991 році, Василь вирішив скористатися перевагами нового економічного суспільства та відкрив свою першу крамницю в м. Харків. З тих пір пройшло вже 15 років, бізнес Василя до сих пір успішно розвивається. Він відкрив другу крамницю, взяв на роботу 10 працівників; зараз робить ремонт в третій крамниці, планує скоро її відкрити. В майбутньому планує побудувати окреме торгове приміщення на власній ділянці. Василь – дуже енергійний та працьовитий, але й добрий, дбайливий. Він завжди намагається якісно обслуговувати покупців та привітно ставитися до кожного клієнта. Продавці, які працюють на Василя, офіційно найняті на роботу, а, отже, їм нараховується пенсійний стаж. Василь – одружений, в нього двоє синів, вони активно служать в церкві. Вірою в Ісуса Христа прагнуть поділитися з усіма оточуючими. Василь просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити власний робочий капітал. Він розуміє, що конкуренція стає все жорсткішою, саме тому вибір свіжих продуктів має бути більшим та різноманітнішим. Василь хоче використати ці кошти для того, щоб поповнити асортимент харчових товарів в крамницях.

loans.use: Broaden product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair and improve her shop, and to purchase the main ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Luís Roberto

texts.en:
Luis Roberto has two sons, ages 10 and 13. He lost his job four years ago and was unable to find steady employment. Having to provide for his family, he started selling food on the streets, setting up a small stand on a main avenue. Little by little he increased the types of food he sold and was able to get ahead and provide for his family.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $475, to be repaid over six months, to buy building materials to build a permanent food stand where he can continue to grow his business. Luis and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís Roberto tiene dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad, desde hace cuatro años perdió su empleo y le fue muy difícil conseguir otro trabajo, ante la necesidad de obtener lo necesario para su familia Luís inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, instalándose en una de las avenidas principales ahí comenzó a vender sus productos y poco a poco fue incrementando la cantidad de comida que vendía, gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.

En estos momentos Luís necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la en la compra de material para hacer un puesto para tener su negocio fijo y pueda continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye a mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Luís, él y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a food stand

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Yungain Women for Progress." Her business is selling ice cream, which she does in the Plaza de Armas in Yungay-Ancash.

She began this business by buying manufactured ice cream and reselling it. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for two years and thanks to the loans she has received she was able to buy a small machine to make ice cream, so now she makes and sells her own ice cream, thereby enabling her to increase her income.

With her loan from Manuela Ramos for 1700 soles (approximately $567US), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy ice cream making supplies such as milk, sugar, flavorings, and cones.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa Maria tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso”. Su actividad económica es la venta de helados, dicha venta la hace en la Plaza de Armas de Yungay - Ancash.

Comenzó este negocio comprando helados preparados y solamente se dedicaba a venderlos, hace dos años que pertenece a su Banco Comunal y gracias a los préstamos recibidos ella ha podido comprar una pequeña maquina para elaborar helados, en la actualidad elabora y vende los helados lo cual ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles (U$ 567 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará insumos (Leche, azucar, saborizantes y barquillos) para la elaboración de helados.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream making supplies

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina has a small grocery sales business that she operates from a space under a covered pavilion at the busy city market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Valentina is a very experienced market vendor, having been in business over ten years. She works many long hours in a week to make a good income. Her profit for a typical month is about $300, a valuable source of income for her and her husband, Alexander.

Valentina would like to continue the success of her business and has requested a loan of $500 to help purchase food inventory to sell. We are happy for this opportunity to provide financial assistance for Valentina as she works to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru:
Pardahol S. is 47 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 5 children. Pardahol plans to use the loan to purchase two bulls to feed and resell. She is confident that she will be able to handle this project as she has 10 years of experience in the area. After the sale of the bulls she plans to purchase younger, cheaper livestock to feed and resell after 40-45 days.

At the end of the credit cycle her profits will consist of 2 bulls that she plans to keep. Pardahol’s son helps her in her business. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase Livestock

loans.name: Nankulabye C(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Nulu is a single mother of four children. She runs a small hotel. She wants to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for the children. Jane sells fruits and vegetables while Juliana sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more hotel furniture

loans.name: Eza Aldeen

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. One of them is four years old, and the other is one year old. He is living in his parents' rented house. He has a small shop of glassware, and he applied to borrow $1000 to purchase new glassware and more home supplies. He also wants to make new shelves and paint the shop to expand his project. He wants to increase his income to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new glassware

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman owns a fresh fish business in the Makeni town market.  He has freezer storage for preserving the fish, and distributes them to retailers and trading centres.  His capital is insufficient to meet public demand; therefore, he is requesting a loan to increase his stock of fresh fish.

loans.use: To increase stock to meet customer demand and earn additional income

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
Born July 1, 1956 in Allada, in the south of Benin, Mrs. Odette C. is the mother of nine children. She sells religious and holy objects such as statues of Mary, Jesus and the saints in front of the Sacre Coeur Catholic church in Cotonou, located along the interstate road linking Cotonou to Porto Novo. Many people attend the church every day, and particularly on Sundays during mass and on days of remembrance. On average, Mrs. Odette C. sells 15,000 CFA francs worth of goods each day. Currently, she is facing difficulties in buying supplies from neighboring countries. To do so, she is requesting this loan in order to meet the ever-growing demand of her customers. She is a woman of excellent character who is also one of our best clients.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 01 juillet 1956 à ALLADA dans le sud du BENIN, dame C. Odette est mère de 9 enfants. Dame C. Odette vend des objets religieux et pieux tels que les statuts de Marie, de Jésus et d'autres saints devant la grande église catholique SACRE CŒUR de COTONOU située sur la route inter état reliant la ville de COTONOU à celle de PORTO NOVO. L’affluence est grande tous les jours surtout les dimanches lors des messes et les jours de recueillement. Dame C. Odette réalise en moyenne un chiffre d’affaire journalier de 15 000 francs. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés pour s’approvisionner dans les pays faisant frontière avec le nôtre. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse de croître chaque jour. Elle est d'une bonne moralité et fait partie de nos meilleurs clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 religious prints, 20 statues and rosaries

loans.name: Eunice's Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Eunice M., age 45, is married with three children (ages 26, 18, and 12). She started a business of raising and selling chickens in 2006. She works from 8am to 6pm at this business and makes a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

Eunice hopes for a loan to start a new business of selling charcoal. Charcoal is needed in many homes in Dar es Salaam to cook food and purify water because the majority of Tanzanians do no own electric stoves. In the picture, Eunice is standing third from the right.

Eunice will share this loan with her loan group, Mwanza.

loans.use: To start a charcoal business

loans.name: Maladoh Group

texts.en: Issa K. is the group leader of Maladoh group. He sells clothes and shoes in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. He started his business more than five years ago but on a very small scale. With previous loans from SMT, he increased his stock, and he is happy that his family's income also increased. Issa would like to continue expanding his business. Within the group, Bai K. sells shoes, and Isatu M. and Abdul B. own grocery stalls. The group members are requesting a loan of $1,125 to expand their businesses and to earn more income for their families.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes, and groceries to expand their businesses

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul J. lives in Nurek. She has a sales location at a city market where she sells clothing. Safargul has been in this business for 4 years. The business earns a small income; in order to increase the profitability of the business Safargul would like to increase her inventory by taking out a loan.

Safargul is 38 years old and has 4 children. She is divorced and the entire responsibility for the family rests on her.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалолова Сафаргуль проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на городском рынке. Продает одежду. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года. Бизнес приносить небольшой доход , но для того ,чтобы увеличить прибыльность дела она хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Сафаргуль 38 лет , у нее 4 детей . Но она разведена и поэтому вся ответственность лежит на ней.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Bahtior

texts.ru:
Бахтиёру 20 лет, он холост и помогает своим родителям личным вкладом в семейно-бытовые расходы. У Бахтиёра есть свой бизнес. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал с продажи муки. Данный момент он торгует на Центральном рынке города Вахдат посудами: тарелки, чайники, сервисные наборы. Его партнерам по бизнесу является брат, который помогает и иногда заменяет его на месте деятельности. Продаваемые им товары являются необходимыми в повседневной жизни. У него много клиентов и он часто ездит за товаром в оптовый рынок «Корвон».       
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа сервисных наборов хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Bahtior is 20 years old and single. He helps his parents to provide for the family by running a business. He started off by selling flour but now he sells kitchenware, dinnerware and serveware, such as plates, kettles, etc., at Vakhdat’s central market. The goods that Bahtior sells are necessary in daily life. Bahtior’s business partner is his brother, who helps him and substitutes him in his shop. Bahtior has many customers and he often travels to Korvon wholesale market to purchase goods. Bahtior would like to obtain a loan of 4100 somoni (1200 USD) for buying more serveware and increasing cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy serveware

loans.name: Hugues

texts.fr: Né  le 04/04/1978, T. Hugues est originaire de la ville historique de Ouidah. Il a fréquenté jusqu'au cours moyen deuxième année avant d'abandonner suite à l'incendie de son établissement. Il alla en apprentissage en 1992. Il se forma en tapisserie et en 1999 il eut son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage et se mit à son propre compte. Il commença par produire des meubles de tout genre, surtout des fauteuils bourrés pour la vente. Sa clientèle est constituée de certaines personnalités et de responsables de services de qui il reçoit régulièrement des commandes pour des livraisons de fauteuils et bureaux. Il livre ses commandes parfois sur fonds propres avant de se faire payer par ses clients. A cours de moyens financiers, il a eu recours à ALIDé pour l'obtention de son premier prêt. Marié, il est père de 2 enfants: Pascaline et  Lucrèce.
texts.en:
Born on April 4, 1978, Hugues T. is originally from the historic village of Ouida. He attended class through his second year of middle school when his business suffered a fire. He entered an apprenticeship in 1991 and got trained in upholstery. In 1999, he finished, was awarded his apprentice certificate, and set off on his own. He started by making furniture of all kinds, especially stuffed armchairs for sale. His customers are made up of certain well-known figures and service managers from whom he receives regular orders for the deliver of armchairs and desks. He sometimes delivers his orders using his own funds before getting paid by his customers. For financial means, he has turned to Alidé to obtain his first loan. Married, he is the father to two children: Pascaline and Lucrèce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 piece of lumber, 4 foam pads for armchairs, 25 meters of faux leather, and 2 cans of glue

loans.name: Kausachun Colca Group

texts.en:
In the small town of Colca, the community bank "Kausachun Colca" can be found with members, Magna A. A., Reyna Placida H. Q. and Gloria P. V.. The area is known for agriculture and a majority of the businesses incluD. groceries.

Magna dedicates her time to selling candies at the door of a local school and in front of a nearby church. Magna, a widow, has six children that are married. She is currently saving so she can have savings when she is older and is unable to work.

Reyna Placida runs a small snack bar which she is very happy to have as her own business. She is currently living with her husband and their 3 children. A dream of hers is to move from her small town to the city, which will proviD. better opportunities for her children in the future. She dreams that in the future, her children will continue their education, attend the university and become professionals.

Gloria is an unwed mother of 2 children, aged 19 and 10. She works selling small animals and small house ware appliances at the local fairs; she has a lot of hope and is learning to run her own business. She dreams of owning her own small snack store and that her children continue their education to become professionals.

With their loan of 1300 soles, Gloria will invest her part of the loan into small appliances and small animals. Magna plans to invest her loan to purchase more candies and food to prepare for the teachers at the school where she sells candies. Reyna Placida plans to invest her part of the loan into increasing the variety of options her customers have at the snack shop.

loans.use: The community bank, Kausachun Colca, needs a loan for 5,100 nuevos soles in order for 12 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina R. Q. es una persona dedicada a la  venta de papelería y otros artículos de escritorio, asi como productos para el hogar tiene su propia librería bazar y venta de abarrotes, con su esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta a sus tres hijos a los cuales quiere ver profesionales. Es una persona emprendedora que afronta los retos con entereza. Ingresó a la institución el año 2004 y es una persona muy conocida por nosotros, caracterizada por su responsabilidad y por ser trabajadora.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina R. Q. is dedicated to selling paper and other office supplies as well as products for the home. She has her own bookstore, bazaar, and also sells groceries. With her effort and sacrifice, she supports three children, whom she wants to see become professionals. She is a very enterprising person who faces challenges with determination. She joined this institution in 2004 and she is well-known by us. She is characterized by her responsibility and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her business

loans.name: Wally Suma Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se  encuentra ubicado el centro focal Juan Pablo II, a éste pertenece la asociación “Wally Suma” (lengua aymará que significa; bastante rico)
Casadas en su mayoría y con un promedio de cuatro hijos, se vieron en la necesidad de buscar un negocio propio, que les permita obtener ingresos diarios en sus hogares. 
Dentro el grupo la mayoría tienen negocios individuales, siendo las mas comunes; la venta de comida y venta de ropa. Realizan viajes al Desaguadero (localidad de La Paz) llevando mercadería para comercializarla allá y también compran productos de allá para comercializarlas al detalle en las ferias de la ciudad.
La asociación  Wally Suma necesita de mayor capital para ampliar sus ventas, debe comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad, de este modo genera mayores ingresos que les permita cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
The Juan Pablo II focal center is located in the city of El Alto, and in this center the association “Wally Suma” (which in the Aymara language means “Rich Enough”) meets. As most are married with an average of four children, the association members have found it necessary to have their own businesses which allow them to provide daily income for their homes. Within the group the majority have individual businesses, most of which sell food and clothes. They travel to Desaguadero (a town in La Paz) bringing wholesale merchandise to sell and also buying products there to sell at retail value at fairs in the city. The Wally Suma association needs more capital to increase sales. By buying greater quantities of merchandise they will generate more income that will enable them to cover their basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Lupe Consuelo

texts.en:
Lupe Consuelo S. Chavez is fifty-three years old, married to a chauffeur, and has eight children. Lupe supports herself and her family by running a small pensioners' house, selling bottled drinks and snacks, and also selling prepared meals from her home.

Lupe has been taking out loans with the Manuela Ramos communal bank the “Women Entrepreneurs” since 2004. The bank is based in the city of Pucallpa, Peru in the eastern jungle region of the country. The area is characterized by hot, humid weather and the Ucayali River which meanders through the dense jungle, eventually meeting up with the Amazon River.

Lupe is currently requesting a loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of groceries, bottled sodas and refreshments. She also plans to invest in maintenance for her pension house. Lupe will repay her loan in monthly payments over the course of six months.

loans.use: buying groceries, bottled sodas, and refreshments and investing in maintenance for her pension house

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet F. is 50 years old. She is a married woman and a mother with grown children. But for now ,she is taking care of two of her grandchildren who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Abofour, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the last year, she has traded in silver and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils etc. She sells every Thursday in the Abofour market and demand for her goods is booming. 

She is requesting a loan to augment her working capital and buy more stock of silver and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Janet belongs to a village bank called ‘Fear Not’. She also hope to receive GH¢500 to develop her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband with taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking utensils and plastics bowls.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun C. is a villager in Srae Kruos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Mao Mean, makes baskets with bamboo. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Hence, Mrs. Moeun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more bamboos for her husband to make baskets. She is 61 years old and the mother of two children employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more bamboos for her husband to make basket.

loans.name: Victoire Emilienne

texts.fr:
Née en 1963 à Porto-Novo,S. Victoire Emilienne réside à Foun-Foun dans le 3e arrondissement de la capitale administrative et politique -Porto Novo- du Bénin. Victoire Emilienne est mère de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. Victoire Emilienne est vendeuse de chaussures, une activité qui lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Victoire Emilienne vend aussi des sacs de sortie pour diversifier ses sources de revenu. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité Victoire Emilienne ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour mener bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus.
