Pour ce fait, Victoire Emilienne sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, Victoire Emilienne S. lives in Foun-Foun, in the third arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. She's the mother of two children who both attend school. Victoire Emilienne is a shoe reseller, a business which enables her to help her husband with the family expenses. She also sells handbags to diversify her sources of income. In spite of her being very passionate about her business, Victoire Emilienne does not have enough working capital to have a successful business and turn a higher profit. To this end, she's seeking a loan to bolster her business in order to pay for her various expenses.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell shoes and handbags

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат 1982 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование , но по специальности работать не хочет так как заработная плата очень низкая. Она торгует на рынке  более 3 лет. Она продает материалы , ее покупатели в основном женщины, портнихи. Сейчас весна и сезон шитья платья и других национальных изделий. Портные заказывают ей материалы , и она привозит то что заказали клиенты. Товар привозит сама так как не доверяет вкусу других. Для расширения бизнеса и ассортимента товара, ей потребовалось необходимая сумма, и она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой.
texts.en:
Shafoat was born in 1982, she is married and has two children. She has high education, but does not want to work in her profession because the salary is very low. She is selling on the market for more than three years. She sells fabrics and her customers are mostly women who are seamstresses. Right now is spring and it's a season for sewing of dresses and other Tajik national clothing. Seamstresses order the fabrics from Shafoat and she brings in what her clients have requested. She choses the fabrics herself because she does not rely on the taste of others. To expand her business and variety of her merchandise she needs a certain amount of money and she has come to MicroInvest for support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.ru: Тошпулот занимается откормом и продажей скота. Как и все сельские мужчины, он стремится к увеличению количества своего скота. Ему сейчас 52 года, и у него есть 5 детей. Трое из них сыновья, которым он должен разделить скот поровну. Ну и конечно некоторое количество оставить себе. Дочерям по обычаю, скот не дают. У Тошпулота стадо овец и коз. Дома есть два быка. За очередной займ Тошпулот хочет закупить еще два быка.
texts.en:
Toshpulot's business is buying, raising and re-selling livestock. Like all village men, he would like to increase the number of animals he owns. Toshpulot is 52 years old and has five children. He must divide his herd equally among his three sons (by custom, daughters do not typically receive a share) although Toshpulot would also like to keep some animals for himself. He has a flock of sheep and a herd of goats, as well as two bulls. Toshpulot would like to receive a loan in order to purchase two more bulls.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru:
Сохибназар Чуманазаров проживает в городе Истаравшане. Занимается животноводческой деятельностью.  
 Стаж работы Сохибназара в этой сфере 15 лет. У Сохибназара дома есть дойные коровы, молоко которых перерабатывает и продает  его жена Замира. Сохибназар хочет получить займ в размере 400 сомони на 6 месяцев, и потратить его для закупа одного быка.
texts.en:
Sohibnazar C. lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is involved in animal husbandry and has 15 years of experience in this business. Sohibnazar owns dairy cows. His wife Zamira processes and sells the milk. Sohibnazar wants to obtain a 6-month loan in the sum of 400 somoni to be used for the purchase of a bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Amunu

texts.en:
Amunu J. sells local brewed alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast, pipes, etc., in order to enhance her business. She is 27 and divorced with two children who attend school at St. Bakhita Mission primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. Theses are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (1431040709) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, X. owns & operates a business venture harvesting & selling river-caught fish to local community members. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. X. is requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by X. from TYM Fund.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia T., 66, is married with 10 children.  She has some experience in the food selling business.  Litia sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Litia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD).  SPBD loans are Litia’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase box of mutton flaps, box of drum sticks, box of twisties, box of fish, freezer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Vegetable and fruit vending is Virginia B.'s source of income. But most of the time she sells beans and bananas in their village. She retails her products by walking around from house to house in their village and also in the nearby villages.

She hopes to establish a typical village store somehow but she lacks capital, so she would like to borrow PHP 5000 from Kiva for additional business capital.

She does her best in vending in order to support the education of three of her children who are studying presently. Virginia is now 39 years old and she is standing both as father and a mother to her five children.

"It is hard," says Virginia, but she does her best providing her family with a better living situation. They live simply and peacefully in the rural village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

She hopes that with the support of Kiva, she will somehow uplift their poor living condition. "Just be patient and always trust God," adds Virginia.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es: Jenny Del Carmen M. D. M. vive en el municipio D. Ilopango en el departamento D. La Libertad. Como muchas madres solteras del país, Jenny se encarga D. criar y mantener a su hijita D. tan solo 10 años D. edad que estudia actualmente el cuarto grado, y a su padre, quien por ser viudo, vive con ella. Hace cinco años Jenny inicio una venta D. gallinas indias, con la que costea los gastos D. su casa y familia. Jenny del Carmen solicita un préstamo para refinanciar su negocio y comprar más gallinas, para aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Jenny Del Carmen M. D. M. lives in the municipality of Ilopango, in the La Libertad region. Just like many single mothers in the country, Jenny raises and provides for her little 10-year-old girl, who is currently in fourth graD., and takes care of her father who lives with her because he is a widower.
Five years ago, Jenny started selling free range chickens. This business pays for her household and family expenses. Jenny del Carmen is requesting a loan to refinance her business and buy more chickens to increase her sales and family income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Emilienne est née le 20/12/1964 à Houeyogbé. Emilienne est mariée à Innocent, un technicien bâtiment. Emilienne et son mari ont un enfant et un autre qui n’est pas d’eux mais qui est à leur charge. Emilienne assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la famille. Emilienne est dans le secteur de la restauration. C’est au pont bascule de Finagnon que Emilienne vend ses repas. Et Emilienne est dans cette activité depuis huit ans. Emilienne a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé. Emilienne a bien remboursé ces crédits et sollicite un quatrième crédit pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
Emilienne was born on 20 December 1964 in Houeyogbé. Emilienne is married to Innocent, a building technician. Emilienne and her husband have one child of their own and another who is not theirs but is in their care. Together with her husband, Emilienne provides for her family. Emilienne works in the food service business. It is at the Finagnon weighbridge that Emilienne sells her meals. And Emilienne has been in this business for eight years. Emilienne has already received three previous loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Emilienne repaid these loans without problems and is seeking a fourth loan to better develop her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, cans of food paste, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Danaya De Saniya Yolla Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 48 ans et 2  enfants .Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Yolla, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent  le petit commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, les fruits et légumes, les condiments alimentaires etc. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, une importante quantité de divers condiments alimentaires.
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Fana auprès des grossistes pendant les jours de foires et les condiments sont revendus en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit, sur place au marché à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser mensuellement chacune 15.000 FCFA de bénéfice. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Danaya Group are married women who, on average, are 48 years old and have two children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional families in the village of Yolla in the sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other. They have small businesses selling various products such as cereals, fruits and vegetables, food condiments etc. These women collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to successfully run their businesses and earn an income. This is their third group loan and they have repaid their previous loans on schedule. They will use their loan to buy a large quantity of various food condiments. They get their supplies at the market in Fana and sell them retail (cash and sometimes on credit) at the local market to a clientele made up mostly of women. They expect to make a profit of 15,000 CFA francs (US$33) each per month. They will use part of their profit to reinvest in their businesses and part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has give birth to six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Dorcas is a trader. She trades in provision and other food items. She sells in a store by the road side in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Dorcas has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum S., 45, is a widow and resides with one of her children in Takeo province. She is a professional clothes decorator. Since 1997, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$2.50 each day.

A decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and women wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer hand made over machine made, though. Chhum said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing this business since before she was married.

Chhum is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more silk and beads

loans.name: Joyce

texts.fr: A. Joyce est née en 1946 au Ghana, État voisin du Bénin. Joyce est mariée et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Joyce vit seule au quartier Gbodjè à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, depuis cinq ans. Mais les charges de la famille sont supportées par Joyce et son mari Parfait qui est un mécanicien. Joyce a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Joyce vend des produits de pharmacopée et également des parfums de façon ambulante. Joyce fait ses approvisionnements au Ghana. Joyce sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé dans l’optique d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Joyce A. was born in 1946 in Ghana, a country neighboring Benin. Joyce is married and is mother to three children who have attended school. For five years, Joyce has lived alone in Gbodje, a suburb of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital in Benin. The family expenses have been met by Joyce and her husband Parfait, who is a mechanic. Jayce attended school up to the secondary level. For the past fifteen years she has sold natural medicine products and perfumes from door to door. Joyce buys her supplies in Ghana. She is requesting her first loan from ALIDe with the view of increasing her business and to better satisfy her customers needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bags of tree roots, three bags of leaves and 60 empty bottles

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio es un hombre laborioso de 64 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia.
Pese a su avanzada edad, trabaja con mucha agilidad y dinamismo en sus cultivos de café, plátanos y frejol. Dedicarse en esta actividad le parece muy divertido y con su manos rudas macheta los arbustos y la mala hierba, en aras de mantener limpias sus chacras. 
El cultivo de su mayor agrado es el café, por serle muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de mayo a julio, en esta temporada trabaja en compañía de su esposa, quien le ayuda a recoger los granos de café, para que en una solo carga lleven la mayor cantidad posible a las acopiadoras de su zona. 
En el caso del frejol y los plátanos no obtienen tantas ganancias como con el café, pero le son muy útiles para cubrir los gastos diarios del resto de los meses, con los que cubre la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy motivado por los ahorros que podrá tener, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus diversos cultivos.
texts.en:
Teodosio, 64, is a hard-working man. He lives with his life partner, the mother of their four children, in his own house. In spite of his advanced age, he works his coffee, banana, and bean fields with much agility and energy. Working at this activity is enjoyable for him. He uses his coarse hands to clear the bushes and weeds in order to keep his fields clean. The crop that he likes the best is coffee. It is very profitable for him, especially from May to July. In this season he works with his wife, who helps him gather the coffee beans. They do this so that they can take one load of the largest quantity possible to the suppliers in the area. He does not get as much income from beans and bananas as he does from coffee. But, they are very useful for covering the daily expenses the rest of the months. They cover the food and the childrens’ education. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very motivated by the savings that he will be able to have. He promises to make his payments punctually. He will use the money that he is now asking for to by chemical fertilizers for his diverse crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Don't Worry Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Don’t Worry Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profits. As their profit-to-sales margin increases, they will better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu S., who is pictured in the middle. Kadiatu was born in Makeni. She is 32. She is married and has six children. Kadiatu’s husband is a driver. Three of her children are in secondary school, two are in primary school and one is not of school-going age. 

Kadiatu sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs). She also sometimes sells slippers/flip-flops. Kadiatu has been selling gara lappers for a year now. Before that, she sold skirts. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan to buy working materials like white cotton, different colored inks, powder and caustic soda. She will also use part of the loan to buy a few dozens of slippers.

loans.use: Buy cotton, inks, powder, caustic soda and slippers

loans.name: Raïmatou

texts.fr: Y. Raïmatou est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raïmatou réside à Sènadé, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis environs 30 ans. Mariée à MOUSTAPHA Ibrahim, Raïmatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Raïmatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Raïmatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Raïmatou n'a fait que l'école primaire. Il y a près de 15 ans, Raïmatou vend des ustensiles de cuisine (plats, verres à boire, bols, gobelets, glacières, etc.) à son domicile. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Raïmatou s'approvisionne. Raïmatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits dans l'institution. Raïmatou a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de développer davantage son activité, pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, Raïmatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Raïmatou Y. was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the commercial capital of Bénin. Raïmatou has lived in Sènadé, a neighborhood in Cotonou, for about 30 years. Married to Ibrahim Moustapha, Raïmatou is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives together with her children and husband. Raïmatou assists her husband in managing the responsibilities of the household. Raïmatou herself did not receive any education past grammar school. For nearly 15 years, Raïmatou has sold dishes and cooking utensils (plates, drinking glasses, bowls, goblets, ice-boxes, etc.) from her home. She stocks her merchandise from Nigeria, a border country to Bénin. Raïmatou is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already profited from three loans with the institution, all of which she has fully repaid. After increasing her working capital and developing more business, Raïmatou seeks a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sets of dishes for resale

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
A widow and the mother of five children is Mrs. Anecita P. (pictured in a colored shirt with a customer), 66 years of age and a resident of Bintana, Tangub City.

Anecita is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to support herself and her family. She started this business ten years ago and she has been able to sustain this business even in times of economic crisis. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,500 PHP per month. She is also receiving support from her children who are already working.

Anecita joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, Anecita was able to obtain multiple loans because of her outstanding credit record. This time she is given the privilege of obtaining 12,000 PHP as her 4th loan to add to the capital of her sari-sari store business.

Anecita is hoping that someday her business will become a mini grocery store.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora U. a sus 32 años posee un negocio de Venta de Verduras, en el Mercado Santos Barcenas de León, en donde ofrece: tomate, plátano, frijoles, piña y otros, ella tiene 9 años de estar con este negocio, el cual le ha ayudado para llevarle el sustento a sus cinco hijos que viven con ella de los cuales se encuentran estudiando.
Solicita el crédito de Ceprodel para la compra de tomate, repollo, plátano, quequisque y otros, al obtener el crédito le ayudara para realizar más compra a sus proveedores y de esta forma obtener un poco mas de ingresos para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
At 32, Mrs. U. has her own business selling vegetables in the Santos Barcenas Market in Leon where she sells tomatoes, bananas, beans, pineapple, and other produce. She has had this business for nine years, which has helped her support her five children who live with her and her in school. She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy tomatoes, cabbage, banana, malanga, and other produce. Obtaining the loan will help her make more sales, and this way, allow her to make a little more income to provide for her household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years of age, married, and has five children aged between six and eighteen years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family own a five-roomed house where Juliet lives with eight people. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication, and feeding the family.
Juliet owns a stall selling bananas and tomatoes in Mengo Mackay. She sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Juliet has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and tomatoes. She hopes to see her business grow and start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne est née le 12 Avril 1957 et est mariée à JOHNSON Prosper, un comptable retraité. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste encore à leur charge. Il y a 5 ans environs que Julienne s’est installée au quartier Gbéto à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec sa famille. Julienne assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la famille. N’ayant fréquenté que le cours primaire, Julienne a commencé depuis 10 ans la vente de divers produits (produits cosmétiques, lait, mayonnaise, huile d'arachide, conserve de sardine, liqueurs, couscous etc.), une activité qui lui procure des revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins. Julienne vend également des liqueurs, de façon secondaire. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Julienne s’approvisionne. Mais Julienne vend ses produits dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité, Julienne ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle. C’est au vue de cela que Julienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Julienne est née le 12 Avril 1957 et est mariée à JOHNSON Prosper, un comptable retraité. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste encore à leur charge. Il y a 5 ans environs que Julienne s’est installée au quartier Gbéto à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec sa famille. Julienne assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la famille. N’ayant fréquenté que le cours primaire, Julienne a commencé depuis 10 ans la vente de divers produits (produits cosmétiques, lait, mayonnaise, huile d'arachide, conserve de sardine, liqueurs, couscous etc.), une activité qui lui procure des revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins. Julienne vend également des liqueurs, de façon secondaire. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Julienne s’approvisionne. Mais Julienne vend ses produits dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité, Julienne ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle. C’est au vue de cela que Julienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de cartons de lait, conserves, sardines,  mayonnaises,  couscous, et bidons d'huile d'arachide etc.

loans.name: Oladago

texts.en:
Oladago is married to a food seller and they have 6 children. Oladago is not only a father and husband, he is also a grandfather and this makes him happy and proud. He has a good relationship with LAPO. 

To make a living in Ibadan, he sells rams. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is itching for progress in his business and he hopes to expand that business.  He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more rams to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rams to sell

loans.name: Elija

texts.en: Elija is a commercial motorcyclist and he derives much joy in conveying his passengers from one part of his city to another. The demands for his services are increasing and he hopes to hire a person to join him in his business. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase a motorcycle to boost his business. He is 34 years old and married with three children. His wife sells groceries to support their home. He hopes to own a big transport company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah B. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Isah is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Isah owns and operates a bakeshop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Isah has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Isah's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shallom Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Isaac O. is thirty-two years old. He is married and blessed with two children who are both currently in basic school. The first born is eight and the second is five years old. He lives with his wife and the children in a rented apartment in the community. Isaac’s wife works to help him support their family. She is a food vendor.

Isaac is a humble and hard-working man. He is a commercial driver. He drives a commercial vehicle to convey goods and people, especially petty traders and commuters in and around the community where he is domiciled. Isaac has been driving a commercial vehicle for the past four years and has acquired some experience. He aspires to grow his business to another level. He looks forward to acquiring a new car. He is hopeful to give all his children the best education he can afford and says he will be glad to see them make it to the tertiary levels.

Isaac is currently the leader of a five-member trust bank group called ‘Shalom’. The group members are mainly into trading activities and they request the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a car engine

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva, de 53 años, es una mujer  laboriosa,  y vive en compañía de sus  3 hijos mayores, en su casa propia, que esta echa a base de madera y esta ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad.Se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales (platillo típico hecho a base de maíz molido). Comercializa sus platillos  durante los fines de semana y  varios clientes acuden a su casa, y buscan sus deliciosos tamales. Genoveva atiende amablemente desde muy temprano, durante todos los días, también prepara y vende refrescos helados. Le gusta emprender  todo tipo de negocios porque le va muy bien, es por esta razón que  quiere ampliar su mercado,  y, para lograrlo mandara instalar  electricidad en su casa, ya que sus ventas serán por las noches. Además tiene planeado  iniciarse  en la venta de anticuchos (corazón de res a la parrilla) en la puerta de su casa, y está segura de lograr todos  sus objetivos.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus  cuotas puntualmente. Genoveva organizó su grupo, con la finalidad de acceder a los préstamos para seguir progresando.Tiene pensado destinar una parte del dinero, en comprar  insumos para la preparación  de sus tamales, y la otra parte del dinero, la utilizara en el pago de los trámites de la instalación eléctrica de su casa.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 53 years old and an industrious woman who lives with her three adult children. She has her own house which is made of wood and located in a crowded neighborhood in the southern part of the city. Genoveva makes and sells tamales (a traditional dish made of ground corn). She sells her dishes on the weekends when her customers come to her house to buy her delicious tamales. On the days that she sells food, Genoveva starts early to offer her friendly service. She also prepares and sells cold drinks.

Genoveva enjoys everything about her work because she has done very well. For this reason, she wants to expand her business by having electricity installed in her house so that she can sell at night. In addition, she wants to sell “anticuchos” (grilled beef hearts) on the doorstep of her house. She is confident that she can achieve all of her goals.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete all of her payments on time. Genoveva organized her group so that they could access loans to keep progressing. She plans to use part of her loan to buy supplies for making tamales. The rest of the money will be used to pay the installation deposit so that she can begin receiving electricity in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tamales & pay the deposit to receive electricity service

loans.name: Keu

texts.en:
Mr. Keu S., 60, is a low-income earner who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. He was married but his wife died of senility years ago. He has four children: one is now married and lives separately, while the other three are single. All of his children are employed in different jobs. 


Keu S. buys dried fish in bulk to resell at the local market. He also orders fresh fish and turns them into dried fish to sell. In a day he is typically able to make around $10 to control the financial problems of his family. As his current business is a very profitable one for his family, Keu S. is applying for a loan to sustain its growth

loans.use: To sustain the growth of his business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn P., photographed with her 4-year-old son, is from the town of Trento. She is 24 years old and married. She is involved in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than two years now. She sells her harvest at the market. Her husband helps at the farm and also earns money from his motorcycle transportation business. 

Arlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, the organization has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has no educational background. She is a widow and has three children.

Esi has been a palm oil extractor for about twenty years. Her loan will be used to buy extra palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her palm oil production.

loans.use: To buy extra palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Mere Theresa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MÈRE THERESA fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de la Paroisse de Louga. Il est créé depuis trois ans. il est composé de 11 femmes toutes du même quartier et de la même communauté ecclésiale de base. 
Madame Irène K. est la responsable du groupe. Elle est à l’extrême gauche de la photo. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants et a la charge de 4 autres enfants.
Elle est restauratrice. Chaque soir elle se rend au foyer de la mission Catholique de Louga pour préparer et vendre de la soupe de viande de la grillade de viande. Elle prépare également des sandwichs et des poulets
Avec son prêt elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en viande et en poulets et acheter plus de condiments. 
Elle prend entièrement toutes les charges familiales, nourriture, santé, habillement, scolarité etc.
texts.en:
The Mother Theresa solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois of the Catholic Women’s association of the Louga parish. It has been created three years ago. It is composed of 11 women living in the same neighborhood and belonging to the same church community. Mrs. Irène Kampla is the group leaders. She is on the far left in the photo. She is 53 years old, a widow, the mother of five children, with four other children also in her care. She prepares food for sale. Each evening she comes to the parish house of the Catholic mission of Louga in order to cook meat soup and grill meats for sale. She also prepares sandwiches and cooks chicken. With this loan, she would like to expand her stock of meat and chicken and to purchase more condiments. She has full responsibility for all family expenses, such as food, healthcare, clothing, school fees etc.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat, chicken and food condiments

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
El señor Jhonny V. E. conviviente con la señora María Eledey Nogales más de 8 años, viven en Colomi zona urbana tienen 2 hijos dependientes de 1 año y de 6 años que estudia en nivel primaria, 

El señor nos comenta que mas antes se migraron a España lo cual no les fue bien, de tal modo se volvieron con lo poco que han ganado, se compraron un lote de terreno mas una construcción que esta a medias, razón que ellos se aproximaron a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para hacer terminar la construcción de su vivienda para vivir más cómodos, ahora el señor Jhonny se dedica al servicio de transporte diario de Colomi hacia Cbba  y de Cbba hacia Colomi, la esposa realiza artesanías de tejido, ambos con las actividades a la cual se dedican piensan salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para tener una vida mejor a futuro, que sus hijos estudien y ganen una profesión.
texts.en:
Jhonny V. E. has lived with his common law wife María Eledey Nogales for more than 8 years. They live in the urban area of Colomi. They have 2 dependent children, a 1 year old and a 6 year old who is in elementary school. Jhonny said that they previous emigrated to Spain, which did not go well, so they returned with the little they had earned and purchased a parcel of land and a dwelling that is partially finished. They have approached us to request a loan to complete the construction of their home in order to live more comfortably. Jhonny provides daily transportation service from Colomi to Cbba and from Cbba to Colomi. His wife produces textile crafts. With these activities they hope to improve their income in order to have a better life in the future, and for their children to go to school and have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of the family home

loans.name: Las Dos Palmitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Las Dos Palmitas" se tomo la decisión de ponerle esta nombre, ya que en el patio de la casa de una de las integrantes donde se reúnen hay 2 palmas de coco, es por eso que se escogió este nombre.
 
Esta historia es acerca de la señora Tomasa L. O., ya que es una de las lideres del grupo, cuenta con 38 años de edad esta casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales 1 estudia la prepa, otro de ellos la secundaria y el menor la primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de colchas, manteles, y ocasionalmente lonas, ella dice que con el crédito que recibirá va a invertir en la compra de mas colchas, sabanas, cortinas y manteles para continuar con su negocio.
 
Ella se decidió por esta actividad por que una de sus amigas se lo recomendó, ya que dice se obtienen muy buenas ganancias y también por que quería buscar la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos.
 
Esta muy contenta ya que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, puesto que sus ventas han incrementado mucho, ya que ahora tiene mas clientes de los que tenia antes por el buen servicio y  trato que les brinda, aparte de sus excelentes precios  y es por eso que sus ingresos también han incrementado bastante.
 
Doña Tomasa dice que en ningún momento a fallado con los pagos de su crédito, ni ella ni sus compañeras ya que son mujeres responsables, puntuales pero sobre todo muy trabajadoras, puesto que se conocen unas a otras  desde hace bastante tiempo y éste es su tercer préstamo con FRAC, y se tienen mucha confianza , también por que no quieren fallarle a quienes las apoyan y creen en ellas.  
 
Esta muy agradecida con Fundación Realidad y los donadores, ya que sin su ayuda no hubieran podido lograr todo lo que hasta ahora han hecho, como mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también el poder continuar con su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en el.
 
La meta que tiene doña Tomasa es la de que su negocio continúe creciendo aun mas y prosperando como hasta ahora, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de blancos y así no tener que andar casa por casa vendiendo, también el de seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que terminen sus estudios superiores y tengan una muy buena profesión.  
 
Las personas que integran el grupo de las dos palmitas y a lo que se dedican son los siguientes:
Tomasa L. O.-venta de colchas
Bonfilia H. M.-venta de antojitos
Julia H. S.-venta de colchas y cobertores
Fernanda Anabel A. O.-venta de ropa
Cristina R. R.-venta de cosméticos por catalogo
Elizabeth H. B.-venta de colchas y cobertores
Iris Humberta G. P.-tienda de abarrotes
Balvina D. S.-abarrotes
Hidaid M. N.-venta de comida
Nayeli M. N.-venta de ropa
María Elena B. M.-taller de motosierras
Hermelinda Ana R. R.-venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Dos Palmitas” (The Two Little Palm Trees) because there are two coconut palm trees in the front yard of one of its members; this is why they chose this name. The following story is about Mrs. Tomasa L. O. since she is one of the group leaders. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. One child is in high school, one in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school. Tomasa sells bedspreads, tablecloths and sometimes tarps. She says that the loan she’ll get will be used to buy more bedspreads, sheets, drapes and tablecloths to continue with her business. She decided to go into this line of work because one of her girlfriends recommended it because she said good profits can be made and because she wanted to find a way to help her husband meet household expenses and pay for their children’s education. She is very happy because she says she is doing very well with her business because her sales have increased much. She now has more customers than she had before thanks to the good service and treatment she provides, aside from the excellent prices. This is why her income has increased notably. Tomasa says that she’s never failed to make her repayments on time. Neither have her fellow members because they are all responsible, punctual women but above all, very hard working. They have known each other for a long time and this is their 3rd loan with FRAC. They trust each other and don’t want to disappoint those people that support them and believe in them. She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and the donors because without their help she would have not accomplished all she has so far like improving her quality of life and that of her family as well as being able to continue with her business and continue to invest in it. Tomasa’s goal is to have her business grow and prosper even more than it has to date. She wants to build a locale to install her linens shop so that she doesn’t have to continue to sell door-to-door. She also wants to continue to support her children’s education so that they may complete higher education and have a good profession. The group members and their activities are as follows: Tomasa L. O.-bedspread sales Bonfilia H. M.-fast food sales Julia H. S.-bedspread and comforter sales Fernanda Anabel A. O.-clothing sales Cristina R. R.-catalogue cosmetics sales Elizabeth H. B.- bedspread and comforter sales Iris Humberta G. P.-grocery store Balvina D. S.-groceries Hidaid M. N.-prepared food sales Nayeli M. N.-clothing sales María Elena B. M.-power tool repair shop Hermelinda Ana R. R.-prepared food sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bedspreads, sheets, drapes and tablecloths.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 32-year-old married woman from Bint Jbeil. She is the mother of three children. Lina has owned an Internet shop (computer services) since 2009; this kind of business is becoming important in the region. Many teenagers seek such places to play network games with their friends and do necessary school research. 

Lina is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy extra computers for her shop. Her clients can be anyone in need of such a service. Lina hopes to expand her work in the future and start selling computer hardware.

loans.use: To buy extra computers

loans.name: Donellis

texts.es:
La naturaleza artesana de Donellis C., le ha servido de mucho, pues con ella y sin estudios técnicos ha logrado emprender un negocio de elaboración y ventas de artesanías, el cual inició hace dos años, cuando dejó un empleo donde  no obtenía suficientes ingresos. Donellis poco a poco inició en el año 2008 trabajando en la temporada de carnavales, elaboró mochilas pintadas a mano y sobre lienzo, accesorios para niñas  y adornos y con esta experiencia le fue muy bien; luego en el año 2009,  una amiga la recomendó para que participara en la feria de una gran superficie comercial, allí exhibió sus productos y perfeccionó su arte observando y comparándose con la competencia. Su primer capital fue de $350.000 COP que le prestaron e invirtió en la compra de materiales, en la actualidad tiene 4 personas que trabajan con ella y son mujeres cabezas de familia, a quienes les paga por producción y en las épocas de carnavales, fin de año, donde se potencializan sus ventas y debe contratar mas personal. 

Su pequeño taller esta ubicado en su propia casa, allí tiene un stock de materiales y sus clientes de acuerdo a esto escogen lo que desean que les elabore;  así elabora como binchas y adornos para la cabeza, bolsos, porta celulares, y últimamente está fabricando las sorpresas para los cumpleaños. Sueña con darle un futuro económico  a su familia conformada por sus padres, ampliando su negocio con puntos de ventas a nivel local y nacional; pero requiere ampliar su área de acción, y no cuenta con el capital suficiente,  razón por la cual  esta solicitando un credickiva para iniciar este sueño, el cual invertirá en compra de telas, botones, silicona, empaques, publicidad y también  exhibidores, pues se acerca la temporada de fin de año y necesita prepararse para responder a sus clientes.
texts.en: Donellis' artistic talent has served her well, since with that and no technical education she was able to start a business making and selling crafts two years ago when she left her job because it did not pay her enough. Little by little in 2008 Donellis worked during carnival season, making hand-painted canvas satchels, accessories for little girls and decorations, and this experience went very well. Then in 2009, a friend recommended that she take part in a flea market at a big commercial center, where she showed off her products and perfected her craft by observing and comparing the competition. Her first loan was for $350 COP, which she used to purchase material, and now she has four people who work for her who are all women who are the head of their households. She pays them for their production during carnival season and at the end of the year, when her sales increase and she needs to hire more staff. Her small workshop is located in her home, where she has a stock of materials and her customers come to choose what they want made. She makes things like headbands and other headwear, purses, cell-phone covers, and lately she has been making surprise birthday presents. Donellis dreams of providing a better financial future for her family, which consists of her parents. She also wants to expand her business with local and national sales points, but that requires expanding her coverage area and she doesn't have the necessary capital to do so. For this reason she is requesting the loan from Kiva, which she plans to use to purchase fabric, buttons, silicone, packaging, advertising and displays, since the end of the year is approaching and she needs to prepare herself to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use:
Purchase fabrics, buttons, packaging, advertising, etc. to prepare for the end of the year.

compra de telas, botones, silicona, empaques, publicidad y también  exhibidores, pues se acerca la temporada de fin de año y necesita prepararse para responder a sus clientes.

loans.name: Charles Kioko

texts.en:
Charles is married and has two children to support. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. Charles’ business is located in a highly populated area, so there are many customers. He is hardworking, outgoing and honest.

Charles was introduced to KADET by group members. He is servicing his second loan and repaid his previous one successfully. With this loan he will increase his stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

With extra profits, Charles plans to enlarge his business and tend to domestic and household requirements. He hopes to start juice extraction as part of his business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Olga Lydia

texts.es:
Doña Olga, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con sus padres, una hermana y un hijo de 10 años, es soltera, todos trabajan para los gastos del hogar y residen en El Transito, departamento de Usulután, doña Olga tiene 41 años de edad.
Este oficio lo inicio gracias a su familia pues siempre se han dedicado al trabajo de campo, cultivando en sus propias tierras y sin horario fijo, actualmente quiere empezar el proceso de una nueva siembra pero no cuenta con el fondo necesario para realizarla, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para salir de esta situación. Con esta ayuda comprara los materiales agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes.
Su objetivo es seguir en el cultivo del Maíz, obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Olga works in agriculture. She lives with her parents, a sister and her 10 year old son. She is a single woman. They all work to pay the household expenses. They live in El Transito, Usulután department. Olga is 41 years old.
She started working in agriculture since her family has always done fieldwork. They farm on their own lands without a set schedule. She wants to start a new sowing season but she doesn’t have the funds necessary to do so. Therefore, she sees the necessity to request a loan to get out of her current situation. With this help, she will buy farming materials like different fertilizers.
Her goals are  to continue to grow corn, to have a good harvest and to improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Yovana Margarita

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con un hijo y tiene grado de instrucción superior completa.
La señora tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, producto que es traído desde Desaguadero y entregado en la ciudad de Puno. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para incrementar  el capital  de su negocio. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitira comprar mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es tener un local para su negocio y distribuir al por mayor. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal son todas las actividades que se realiza en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the communal bank “Bartolina Sisa,” located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She has a college education.

Yovana has a business selling groceries, products that she brings from Desaguadero and delivers in the city of Puno.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to increase the working capital in her business.

Now she requests a new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to buy merchandise for her business.  Her dream is to have a place for her business, and to distribute at wholesale.  What she likes about her communal bank are all of the activities that they do in the meetings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS D. SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Amalia; ella tiene 79 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. caldos, ella venD. en el mercado D. Vinocanchon diferentes tipos D. caldos como caldo D. gallina y caldo D. carne, la socia trabajo desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. venta D. caldos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar los caldos como pollo y carne.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Amalia, 79, is a member of the “LAS LEONAS D. SAN JERONIMO” (St. Jerome’s Lionesses) communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a soup business.  She sells various kinds of soup, like chicken and beef soup, at the Vinocanchon Market.  She works from 8am until 4pm and wants to improve her business.  She is asking for funds to buy soup making ingredients like chicken and meat.

He thanks those who will be part of her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy soup making ingredients like meat and chicken.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariluz La socia es casada y tiene  2 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de comidas la socia tiene un restaurante y ella compra insumos al por mayor para poder utilizar en el mes y de este modo le resulta más económico, la socia desea comprar al por mayor en esta ocasión, aceite, carne, y otros insumos de salida diaria, como arroz, sal, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a member of the “Señor de Tayancani” Communal Bank.  The communal bank is located in the Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Mariluz is married and has two children.  She has a restaurant, and she sells food.  She buys ingredients wholesale in order to be able to use them during the month.  This makes it more economical.  This time she wishes to buy oil and meat.  She also wishes to buy other ingredients for daily production like rice, salt, and sugar.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients.  She is grateful and values the loan she was provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.
.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 29 años de dedica a la reparación de artefactos electrodomésticos (televisores, grabadoras, planchas, etc.) en un pequeño local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. Su trabajo es muy solicitado y es la única fuente de ingresos del hogar.

La continua demanda de sus servicios hace que siempre tenga que adquirir repuestos y renovarlos ya que se le agotan con facilidad. Juan desea renovar su stock de repuestos y de ese modo brindar un buen servicio, por lo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles.

Juan ya ha tenido créditos financiados por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también solicitó en crédito para adquirir repuestos y mejorar la calidad de su servicio. Juan se encuentra bastante agradecido con los prestamistas que le ayudaron a sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three of his four children in the District of Olmos, which is located an hour and 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been repairing household appliances (televisions, recorders, irons, and other devices) for 29 years from a small shop located in the center of the city. His work is highly sought after and provides his only source of household income.

The continued demand for his services always means that he must acquire spare parts to replenish his inventory that runs low easily. Juan wants to restock his inventory of parts so that he can provide good service, so he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Juan has already received loans with Kiva funds through Edpyme Alternativa and its Seed Capital Product. By taking this opportunity to request a loan to acquire spare parts, he will be able to improve the quality of his service. Juan is very grateful to the lenders who are helping him succeed in his business.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to restock his inventory

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de huit femmes toutes mariées,ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de condiments et de galettes.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso                                                                 
MAMOU T. s’approvisionne en condiments auprès des grossistes presque hebdomadairement au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi is the name of a group which is made up of 8 married women who are 38 years old on average. They each have 5 children and live in traditional families in the village of  Djekenobougou, a prefecture of Dioila in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region  of the Republic of Mali). 

They have businesses where they sell various merchandise, condiments, and cookies. 

The women of the Benkadi group request their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mamou T. acquires her condiments from wholesalers on a weekly basis in the market in Dioila.  She carries out her sales from her home and she completes them in cash or credit. Her clientele is mostly women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 30 000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, and the remainder will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments for resale.

loans.name: Pius Wambua

texts.en:
Pius Wambua M. is 44 years old and married to Kamene who contributes to the family income. He has five children aged between 17 and four years. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years with an income of KES. 20,000 per month. 


This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones well and on time. He wants to use this loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to improve the living standard of his children and give them quality education.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Memia is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Memia owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling products to local businesses and community members. Memia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Memia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Memia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Memia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en:
Hanzel V. is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Hanzel is single. 

To make a living, Hanzel plants and harvests rice for sale and runs a retail store. Hanzel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hanzel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Hanzel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Hanzel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Hanzel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat earns a living working as a taxi driver. Many weeks he works seven days in a row, always making himself available to drive. This not only makes him more efficient in his work, but it helps ensure a steady supply of customers. He typically makes between $15 and $10 per day. The more he is able to work the more money he can make. 

Shuhrat has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni so that he can have some welding work done on the engine of his car. Having a reliable vehicle is vitally important to Shuhrat’s business. We are happy for this opportunity to help him complete these repairs and continue to provide safe, dependable service to his customers. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to have some welding work done on the engine of his car.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie M. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Jeannie is married and has three children. To make a living, Jeannie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, biscuits & beverages in the local community. Jeannie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jeannie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeannie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jeannie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 43 years old and married with four children.

Juvy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sardines, oil, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Juvy has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Juvy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, electricity bills and school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Selina faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to pay school fees for her child. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Savang

texts.en: Mrs. Savang C.. a 37-year-old widow with three sons, all attending school, lives with them on National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Savang, a fruit-seller, buys her produce from a Phnom Penh market and resells it in front of a garment factory. She is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to carry her fruits.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her fruits.

loans.name: Hannah Njeri

texts.en:
Hannah, age 55, has operated her shoe shop in the town of Naivasha for the last three years. She is the widowed mother of three children. 

Hannah was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of her friends. This will be her third loan. She has repaid all her previous loans dependably and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to buy more shoes to offer for sale in her shop.

In future, Hannah hopes to grow her shoe retail shop business into a wholesale endeavor.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Israel Group 1, 2 & 3

texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the group Israel 1, 2 & 3, which is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. All the members of this group are engaged in different types of sales, such as clothing, shoes, groceries and many other items.

Olimpia, a single mother, makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. Her most difficult challenges are to educate her children, to provide for all their needs and to help her daughter recover from a hearing problem. She requires a loan to buy beauty products for her beauty salon and some natural products; she has a stall in her salon where she sells natural medicine. This is her first loan with Esperanza International.

She decided to take a loan because she is very interested in developing her businesses; also, Esperanza Internacional clients are mostly women, and she identifies with the program. She has had her business for over six years, having decided to start it after she learned about the beauty career. Olimpia will use the profits as savings.

Olimpia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy beauty and natural products.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa es una mujer muy emprendedora y bien conocida por su capacidad de trabajo y persistencia en todo lo que emprende. Ella es madre de un joven de 16 años de edad con el que sueña ver realizado en su vida personal, profesional y muy exitoso, lo que es justamente la máxima motivación de Nicolasa. Como mujer emprendedora inició su negocio desde muy joven,  vendiendo a pocos clientes, pero gradualmente con su disciplina y responsabilidad ha logrado aumentarlos, a ellos les vende ropa, calzado, cosmético, prendas de plata  y todo lo que necesiten, aplicando la modalidad de crédito en plazos pactados de acuerdo a sus características. Su meta más adelante es adquirir vitrinas para exhibir sus productos de manera ordenada, pues planea tener un gran almacén, en un punto estratégica que le facilite el acceso a nuevos compradores. Mientras Nicolasa se esfuerza y trabaja para alcanzar su sueño, maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 40%, que tiene planes de aumentar impulsando el crecimiento de su capital de trabajo, comprando de contado para ganar buenos descuentos y fidelizando sus mejores clientes, con su persistencia y buen manejo financiero de sus relaciones comerciales. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará prendas de plata que tiene encargadas y que auguran una rotación rápida de su mercánica y con ello el éxito de su inversión, porque las solicitudes  vienen de sus clientes rentables.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a very entrepreneurial woman who is well known for her willingness to work and the persistence that she shows in everything she does.  She is the mother of a 16 year-old boy who she dreams of seeing become fulfilled and successful in both his personal and professional life.  This is Nicolasa's greatest motivation.

As an entrepreneurial woman, Nicolasa started her business when she was very young, selling products to just a few customers.  However, as a result of her discipline and responsibility, she managed to increase her number of customers.  She sells clothes, footwear, cosmetics, silver jewelry and everything her customers need.  She sells on credit with payment made in instalments that she agrees upon according to each customers' means and needs.

Nicolasa's goal for the future is to acquire some display cases so that she can display her products in an organized fashion as she plans to own a large store in a strategic position that will make it easier for her to reach new customers.  While Nicolasa works hard to achieve her dream, she maintains a profitability of no less than 40% which she plans to further increase by boosting the growth of her working capital, buying for cash in order to obtain good discounts and gaining the loyalty of her best customers through her persistence and through good financial management of her commercial relationships.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Nicolasa has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy silver jewelry that already she has orders for.  This will ensure a quick turnover of her merchandise which will mean a successful investment because the orders are from her profitable customers.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry that she already has orders for

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.es: Aníbal de 29 años de edad, reside en casa familiar con sus padres, esposa y dos hijas de 7 y 1 año de edad. Aníbal es un hombre emprendedor y luchador. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en el lugar de residencia de la zona donde  él habita. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Aníbal  lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y además porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Él sueña con dar a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el y lucha por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos que permitan atraer a más clientes. Sin perder la fe que algún día logrará salir de la situación en la que se encuentra y mejoraran sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Anibal is 29 years old and he lives at home with his parents, his wife and their two daughters, aged 7 and 1. Anibal is an enterprising man and a fighter. Some years ago he decided to set up a small business in his house, in the region where he lives. The business consists of a small store that, with great effort and dedication. he has maintained through the passing of the years. He enjoys a large clients base and for Anibal the clients are what matters most.
