He always attends them with a smile and with great kindness, and for this reason he has earned the trust of many in the region. Additionally he always has what the clients are looking for. He dreams of providing his daughters with a better quality of life and his only source of income is his small business. He cannot distract himself from it and he struggles to keep it active. This is the reason why he was motivated to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). He will invest in his store and he will supply it with all types of products, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, detergents, and other products that will help him attract more clients. His faith will not waiver that some day he will leave his situation and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester, who is 28 years old and married, has been farming for the past five years. He has requested his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. A good KADET client, Silvester hopes to make a profit and use it to expand his farm. His dreams are to prosper in farming and provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilzer.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer trabajodora de 36 años de edad. Ella es soltera y vive en la parte rural del distrito de Túcume en Lambayeque . Goza de buenas referencias personales.

Simona se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves de corral, desde hace 3 años. Esta actividad la desarrolla en corrales espaciosos ubicados en la parte trasera de su domicilio. Simona conoce a la perfección su actividad y cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, Simona se dedica a la costura y este servicio también le da buenas ganancias.

Simona solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus cerdos y aves de corral. Este crédito le permitirá seguir desarrollando su negocio adecuadamente y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.

Simona es una mujer responsable y con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Simona is a hardworking 36 year old woman. She is single and lives in the rural part of the district of Túcume in Lambayeque. She has good personal references.

For 3 years, Simona has raised and sold pigs and poultry. She has spacious corrals behind her house. Simona knows her trade very well and has an established clientele in the area. She also sews which also gives her good income.

Simona asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up her pigs and birds. This will allow her to continue carrying out her business and to get profits that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Simona is a responsible woman with a great desire to better herself.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with seven children; five attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop selling household consumables to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Margret dreams of establishing a bigger shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anaclet

texts.fr:
Anaclet est né au Rwanda. Il est marié et il a 5 enfants de 1an 3mois à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans des études secondaires 
Anaclet est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les matériels de construction il va acheter 20 sacs de ciment, 2 tours de camion de sabler, 20 triplex, 15 kgs des clous pour la réhabilitation de sa maison et payer la main d’œuvre.
Dans les prochaines années, Anaclet voudrait avoir d’autres ses propres maisons. Avec les profits il voudrait améliore le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anaclet was born in Rwanda. He is married with five children ranging in age from 15 months to 10 years old. Two of them attend school. Anaclet completed four years of secondary school.

Anaclet is an employee. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he will use the credit to purchase building materials including 20 bags of cement, two truckloads of sand, 20 triplex cables and 15 kg of nails to renovate his house. He will also pay for the required labor. 

Over the next few years, Anaclet would like to own more houses. He plans to use the profits to improve his family’s wellbeing and provide for his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy the building materials needed to renovate his house, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a business woman aged 46. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been selling cereals to bring up the family. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Her dream is to open a supermarket. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy bags of beans and maize. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans and maize

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María tiene 45 años y está casada con el Señor Porfirio D. 47 años, tienen 3 hijos todos varones D. 28, 22 y 9 años, estudiando actualmente. 
La señora siempre fue comerciante, contando con varios negocios. Su marido es mecánico automotriz, gracias a lo cual siempre se ayudan mutuamente. Actualmente cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio abasteciendo a los vecinos del lugar, cuenta con varios clientes formados ya que es destacada por la amabilidad con que atienD. a todos. Comenta que uno D. sus sueños es poder abrir un local D. ventas D. lubricantes ya que su marido es mecánico y posee una gran demanda del producto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. galleta, arroz fideo, azúcar, leche, huevo, aceite, bebidas con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes, ya que desea siempre poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and is married to Porfirio who is 47. They have three sons aged 28, 22, and 9 who are now studying. 

María has always been in retail, having several businesses. Her husband is an auto mechanic, and thanks to that they can always help each other. Right now she has a store in her home selling to her neighbors. She has many loyal customers which shows the kindness with which she treats everyone. She says that one of her dreams is to be able to open a local store selling lubricants since her husband is a mechanic and has a great need for that product. 

She is asking for a loan to buy cookies, rice noodles, sugar, eggs, oil, and beverages with which to she will be able to supply her store and meet the demand of her customers since she always wants to be able to please them.

loans.use: to buy cookies, rice noodles, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad, es una jovencita con ganas de superación personal. Ella vive en la zona de la laguna Alalay de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja en un estudio jurídico como secretaria hace 2 años y también vende productos para el arreglo y cuidado de imagen personal. 
Fabiola vive en la casa de sus abuelos junto a su madre y hermanos, su padre murió hace algunos años, debido a que Fabiola trabaja y estudia necesita el préstamo para que compre mercadería de cosméticos y mejore la actividad  que tiene, de esta manera puede mejorar su nivel de vida. Ella está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de hacer realidad su sueño.
Fabiola entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para abrir una repostería donde trabaje su querida mamá.
texts.en:
Fabiola, age 21, is a young woman who looks to succeed on a personal level. She lives in the District of Laguna Alalay in the city of Cochabamba. For the past two years, she has worked as a secretary at a law firm. She also sells personal care and image makeover products.

Fabiola lives at the home of her grandparents with her mother and her siblings. Her father died a few years ago. Due to her work and her studies, Fabiola needs a loan to buy cosmetics so that she can improve her business in order for her to raise her standard of living. She is very grateful to the people who lend through Kiva for giving her the opportunity to fulfill her dream. Fabiola’s future plans include obtaining a new loan so that she can open a pastry shop where she can work with her beloved mother.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Cristhian Lennin

texts.es:
Cristhian de 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Sechura que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Cristhian se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras), su corral los tiene en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo pueden ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Cristhian es una persona trabajadora, responsable que lo único que quiere es poder salir adelante y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 23 years old and single.  He lives at his parents’ house, which includes electricity and running water, and is located in the Sechura district; part of the Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Cristhian has been raising and selling livestock (sheep and goats) for several years.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural grass and his pens are located outside his home.  Once the animals reach their optimum sizes, he sells them to his customers and uses the money to pay his personal expenses.

He has requested a 1,500 PEN ($550) loan through Edpyme Alternativa, in order to buy more animals and feed.  He will fatten them up so that he can sell them for better prices at the various markets in the zone.  This will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.  Cristhian is a hardworking and responsible person who only wants to get ahead and continue helping his parents.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Sheirel

texts.en:
Sheirel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Sari-sari (variety) Store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Sheirel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and lives in San Vicente, Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 
Marilyn has a fish-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a village store owner who has been managing her business for almost a year, which really helps her in meeting the needs of her children. She would like to borrow a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will to use to expand her business. She is planning to purchase additional merchandise for her store such as garlic, onions, bottled soft drinks, and canned goods. She will do her best to help her husband earn money for their immediate needs and education of their four children.

Elisa is 35 years old and married to her husband Isidro, a driver for a petron Company. They are blessed with four kids: Ariel, 14, already in grade six; Arnie, 13, grade five; Alvin John, 6, and Isidro Jr., 4. Despite the difficulties, they always do their best to be successful.

loans.use: To buy drinks, onion, garlic, and canned goods for her store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 48 years old. He is married to Charity, and they have two children who are in school. He has been in the transportation business as his primary business for the last 15 years, and he also practices farming. He has an income of 15,000 KES a month.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he will use the loan to service his pick-up truck and to buy some farm supplies.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family’s basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and to own a fleet of vehicles.

loans.use: to service his pick-up truck and to buy some farm supplies.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 25 years of age and married, with three children.  Jacinta owns and operates a business venture, selling porkbun.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Jacinta needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase flour, plastic bags, cooking oil, and a frying pan.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Jacinta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Jacinta's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase flour, plastic bags, cooking oil, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita a sus 50 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 22 años, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de mercancía tal como ropa interior, jeans, camisetas y blusas por catálogo, esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos para el sustento de su familia, puesto que el trabajo de la confección al cual se dedicaba la señora Margarita presentaba épocas muy difíciles en las cuales disminuía la calidad de vida y bienestar de su familia. Actualmente, la señora Margarita requiere de la compra de surtido que le permita prestar un mejor servicio para sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Con lo anterior, la señora Margarita podrá brindarle mejores beneficios a su familia y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén de venta de variedades.
texts.en:
Margarita, 50, is the mother of a 22-year-old son.  For five years she has worked selling merchandise such as underwear, jeans, t-shirts, and blouses by catalog.  This idea came from the need to generate greater income to support her family, since the clothing job that Margarita had been doing created very difficult periods in which her family's quality of life and well-being decreased.

Currently Margarita needs to buy stock that will allow her to give her customers better service and improve her income.  With this Margarita will be able to give more profit to her family and realize her dream of having her own variety store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as underwear, jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Evalina

texts.en:
Evelina is 58 years old and is married to William. They are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past five years, with a monthly income of Kes 6,500, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Evelyn will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es:
El señor Jose es originario de Esteli, tiene 56 años de edad, es agricultor, tiene 3 hijos, lleva 25 años dedicándose  a este negocio. El siembra chiltomas en la comarca donde la siembra de hortalizas es de vital importancia para la venta y consumo de sus habitantes. A sus hijos le ha enseñado como trabajar la tierra que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido para que un dia ellos la hereden y rindan buenos frutos como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
El realizo el crédito para la siembra de 1 manzana de tomates, quiere comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra. Esto le ayudara a sacar su producción con muy buena calidad. El espera que la ganancias sea muy buenas para cancelar el crédito, comprar un mejor equipo de riego, hacerle mejoras su vivienda y darle buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is from Estelí.  He’s 56 years old and a farmer.  He has three children and has been in this business for 25 years.  He grows peppers in his vegetable fields which are of vital importance for sales and for residents’ consumption.   He has taught his children how to work the land that he has cared for with such effort and dedication so that one day they will inherit it and produce good fruits like it’s been doing to date.

He took out the loan to plant a manzana [Central American unit of land area] of tomatoes and he wants to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.  This will help him produce a good quality harvest.  He hopes that profits will be very good in order to pay off his loan, to buy better irrigation equipment, to do some home improvements and to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Erdenbat

texts.en: Mr Erdenbat is 45 years old and lives with his wife and his 4 children in a ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Munhtuya, is 45 years old. She is a cooker. His older son, Galbayar, is 25 years old. His younger sons, Darambazar and Daramselenge, aged 23 and 21.They are a collage student. His daughter, Tumenjargal, is 11 years old. She is a second school student.  Mr Erdenebat started a tea house and motel  businesses in 2010 with his wife. His tea house and motel is  along the road. He is planning to enlarge a work place. He is hardworking and helpful man.  He is asking 1 500 000 MNT to prepare  a building  materials for his work place

loans.use: To prepare  a building  materials for his work place

loans.name: Adson

texts.en: Adson is a 27-year-old man. He is married with 1 child and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the cattle-rearing business since he inherited it from his family many years back. He obtains additional income from the goat trade. Adson is faced with a problem of lack of pasture during the dry season, and wants capital to buy more goats so his business can boom. He is requesting a loan for this purpose. His goal is to be a leading supplier of goats to butcheries in Kyenjojo.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Moureen's Group

texts.en:
Moureen is 40 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Moureen has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Moureen also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Moureen's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.en:
I have been working for one year in my hardware store, it is a family run business, in which my two children and other youths that I have contracted, attend to my clients. I have a loyal clientel, since, for the price, I make contracts with the houses being constructed and the builders in my city. This activity generates enough (income) to support my family.

Loan Use: Cement, sand, screws, nails, sockets, floodlights, lamps and other 

Tengo un año de tener mi ferreteria, este es un negocio familiar en el que me ayudan mis dos hijos y otros jovenes que he contratado para atender a mis clientes, tengo clientela fija, ya que por los precios hago contratos con las casas constructoras y albañiles en mi ciudad. Esta actividad me genera lo suficiente para apoyar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de cemento, arena, tornillos, clavos, toma corrientes, focos, lamparas y otros.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a market woman who sells mangoes locally called "Sallo Mango." She has participated in the TEACH lending programs of Kraban Support Foundation. Grace needs a Kiva loan amount of $800 to expand her mango business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Theo

texts.en: Theo operates a two, corn mill business. He started his business in 1998 with his own capital of $200. He is married and has two children. Due to the high customer demand in the community, with a loan of $550, Theo would be able to purchase a 30-horsepower mill, which is more powerful than the one he is currently using.  The more powerful mill will enable him to meet his clients’ needs and make additional profits. His current business capital is $2,200.

loans.use: To buy a 30-horsepower mill.

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Senora Maria Del Refugio U. has a sewing business. "I have more than 16 years sewing. I have my business at home, in a small room, but I would like a bigger room because my business is growing and I have more clients, and I want to provide them with a better service. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD which I will use to expand my business and to provide a better service and to make more money since this is the main source of income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Del Refugio U. tiene un negocio de costura. Tengo ya mas de 16 años dedicándome a las alta costura, el negocio lo tengo en mi casa en un cuarto pequeño me gustaría tener algo más amplio mas el negocio, porque ya tengo más clientes quiero darles un mejor servicio a mis clientas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para ampliar el negocio y dar un mejor servicio para tener más ingreso ya que es el ingreso de mi familia.

loans.use: To build a bigger room for sewing

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghem N. and her husband work very hard on their farm growing vegetables and making palm sugar to support their family. They earn an average of $3 each day.

Mrs. N. is 49 years old, and has five children. One of her children works as a goldsmith, another one is a tailor, and the other children attend school.

This loan will be used to purchase goldsmithing tools for her son to operate his business.

loans.use: Purchase goldsmith's tools

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is an artisan who is 18 years old and single. She embroiders cloth blouses and takes them to sell in a nearby village. With her earnings she helps her parents with the household expenses as her father is a farmer and her mother is also an artisan. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 3," together with another artisan, Reynalda Hernández Hernández. With their loan they will buy fabric and threads at wholesale prices in order to continue their production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ESPERANZA es artesana, tiene 18 años, soltera. Ella borda blusas de manta y los lleva a vender al pueblo mas cercano, con sus ganancias le ayuda a sus papas con los gastos del hogar ya que su papa es campesino y su mama también es artesana. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 3, junto con doña Reynalda Hernández Hernández (artesana). Con la parte de sus prestamos compraran telas e hilos al por mayor para continuar con la producción.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread in order to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.es:
Mrs Eleodora, is a woman with great fortituD. to live. Previously she used to do agricultural work along with the partner of her whole life, who died not long ago. Now, she lives with one of her children who offers her his company, because the eldest have already left to look for their own happiness. Far from remaining sad from these events that happened consecutively, Eleodora shows us that life is beautiful and she works tirelessly at her small farm of guinea pigs that she installed a year ago. Her wish is to have a commercial place in downtown and sell her animals. Although she suffered a terrible accident one month ago and the recovery of the bone fracture she suffered is slow, she keeps on working because she wishes to remain useful and active. Eleodora is requesting the support of your noble heart to improve the facilities of her small farm. Support Eleodora, and be an important part of the construction of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Eleodora, es una mujer con mucha fortaleza para vivir, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo agrícola en compañía D. su compañero D. toda la vida, que partió a la eternidad hace poco. Ahora vive sólo con uno D. sus hijos que le brinda su compañía, debido a que los mayores partieron D. su hogar en búsqueda D. su felicidad. Lejos D. quedarse triste por estos acontecimientos que sucedieron consecutivamente, Eleodora, nos muestra que la vida es hermosa y trabaja incansablemente en su pequeña granja D. cuyes que instaló hace un año. Tiene anhelos que desea cumplir, entre ellos está el D. establecer un local comercial en el centro D. la ciudad y vender en este espacio sus hermosos y gorditos cuyes. A pesar D. que sufrió un terrible accidente hace un mes y la recuperación D. la fractura que sufrió es lenta, sigue trabajando porque desea verse útil y activa; Eleodora solicita el apoyo D. tu noble corazón para mejorar las instalaciones D. su pequeña granja. Apoya a Eleodora, y se parte importante D. la construcción D. sus anhelos.

loans.use: Improve facilities of her guinea pigs farm.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, married, and has three children. He owns a small shop in Beylagan. He sells clothes, dishes etc. at his shop. He wants to buy more kinds of goods and because of this, needs a loan in the amount of $1200.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Fatina M.. She is married with four children, ages between 22 and 28. In 2000 Fatina established a mat- and basket-weaving business. Fatina has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional materials and dyes. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional weaving materials and dyes in bulk

loans.name: Zohir

texts.en:
S. Zohir, 38 years old, is married with three children.

Zohir sells flowers in the central market and has many clients due to the service and wide range of flowers he provides. He usually travels to neighboring Uzbekistan to purchase the flowers once every two weeks. This stable business has been in operation for more than 18 years and generates considerable income for the family. 

Zohir requests a loan of $800.00 for a term of 8 months to purchase more flowers. He thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans A. is an electrician by profession and sells electrical parts, phones and phone accessories. He is a divorcee with two children. Business is doing very well. He plans to increase sales but lacks funds.

He is asking for $425 as additional funds to purchase more phones and accessories.

loans.use: Additional funds to purchase more phones and accessories.

loans.name: Frederic Segla

texts.en:
Frederic Segla H. is married and has five dependents. He is a provisions distributor and is running out of stock.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi A. was born in Lomé on January 21, 1979. Quitting school due to a lack of money, he turned towards an apprenticeship in maintaining and repairing electronic equipment. Since finishing his training, he has not been practicing his trade very effectively because he lacked the money to open a shop. He worked with his friends who were able to open a shop, but he didn't appropriately benefit from it. Despite all his talent with electronics, Mr. A. continues to lead a difficult life.

To solve the situation, he is requesting a loan to open his shop. The loan will enable him to rent a place and to acquire work supplies. Realizing this project will launch this energetic and dedicated young man's business. This will enable him to improve his living conditions and to support himself better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossivi est né à Lomé le 21 Janvier 1979. Abandonnant ses études faute de moyens, il s’oriente vers l’apprentissage où il se forme en entretien et réparation des appareils électroniques. Depuis la fin de sa formation, il n’exerce pas efficacement son métier car il n’a pas de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Il travaille avec ses amis qui ont pu ouvrir un atelier mais il n’en profite pas convenablement. Malgré tous ses talents en matière d’électronique, Monsieur A. continue de vivre dans des conditions très difficiles.

Pour sortir de cette situation, il sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir son atelier. Le crédit va lui permettre de louer un local et acquérir du matériel de travail. La réalisation de ce projet lancera les activités de ce jeune dynamique et dévoué. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de mieux se prendre en charge.

loans.use: To open a shop and to buy work supplies

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Four years ago Nélida was selling clothing in a store owned by an acquaintance, but the business failed so she had to look for another job. She to started selling cakes 2 years ago when a neighbor told her about this business. She buys the cakes from a third person and sells them in the market near her house; she sells 50 per week. Nélida also works in the mornings for a gentleman selling chicken. In the afternoon she sells the cakes. She also sells buys and sells products that her acquaintances order from her. The loans she has request have served to buy a variety of products that her clients have ordered from her. Nélida would like to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her husband could work with it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 años, Nélida se dedicaba a vender ropa en la tienda de un conocido, pero el negocio fracasó, por lo que tuvo que buscar otro trabajo. Fue así que desde hace 2 años, Nélida empezó a repartir tortas a raíz que una vecina le informó sobre este negocio. Ella compra las tortas a una tercera persona y las reparte en el mercado cerca de su casa. A la semana entrega 50 tortas. Asimismo, por las mañanas Nélida trabaja ayudando a un señor vendiendo pollo. Por la tarde se dedica a entregar las tortas. No obstante, Nélida también compra y vende productos por pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos. Precisamente, los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar diversos productos que sus clientes le han pedido. A Nélida le gustaría comprarse una mototaxi para que su esposo pueda trabajar en ella.

loans.use: To buy a varity of products that her customers have ordered from her

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Iván T. R. works in a factory in Piedras Negras. In order to cover the household expenses and support his son, he and his wife have a taco stand that they operate at night outside their home. However, they have to rent the small cart they are using to make the tacos, which lowers profits. For this reason, they would like to obtain a loan of $350.00 USD in order to build a wall in their house so that they can serve their patrons from home and not have to pay rent for their current taco cart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Iván T. R. trabaja como obrero en una fabrica en Piedras Negras, para poder pagar todos los gastos de su casa y los de su pequeño hijo el junto con su esposa tienen un puesto de tacos afuera de su casa que atienden en las noches, pero el carrito que utilizan para hacerlos se los están rentando las ganancias son muy pocas por eso desean un préstamo por la cantidad de 350 dlls para poder construir en su casa una pared para poder atender a sus clientes en su casa y no tener que pagar la renta del carrito que tienen actualmente.

loans.use: Construct a wall for their business

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.ru:
Хосамох 1971 года рождения. Она разведена и у нее 1 сын, который учится в 8 классе. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 1998 году с продажи небольшого количества кондитерских изделий в небольшом арендуемом магазине. Сейчас Хосамох торгует конфетами, кондитерскими изделиями и сухофруктами в большом ассортименте на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте разновидность конфет производства России и Турции, пряники, сушенные абрикосы, изюм, грецкие орехи, миндаль, фисташки и т.д. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда. В дальнейшем хочет выкупить магазин.
Услышав о программе Кива решила участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для расширения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Hosamoh was born in 1971. She is divorced and has a son who is in the eighth grade. She started her business in 1998 by selling a small quantity of confectionary products in a small store that she rented. Now Hosamoh trades in a large assortment of candies, confectionary products, and dried fruits at the “Sakhobat” market in Dushanbe city. Her stock includes different candies from Russia and Turkey, gingerbread, dried apricots, raisins, walnuts, almonds, and pistachios, etc.. She buys goods from wholesalers such as “Safar-Center” in Dushanbe city as well as wholesale dealers from Khujand city. In the future, she wishes to buy a store. Having heard about Kiva’s lending programs, she decided to participate and take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni to expand her assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried fruits

loans.name: Mary K.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has three children aged 29, 26 and 16. In 2003, Mary established her farm supplies business. She opens her business six days a week and 9 - 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more farm supplies in bulk. In the future, Mary plans to estabilsh another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more farm supplies in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Julio Justo

texts.es: El señor Julio Justo Ordóñez García de 40 años de edad, Casado, actualmente reside en Paraje Tzan Sajoc, Cantón Pasajoc, a 4.5 Km. de la ciudad de Totonicapán. En donde por varios años el señor Julio Justo fue operario de una pequeña fabrica en donde se dedicaban en la elaboración de pantalones de lona, en donde se le surge la idea de formar su pequeña fabrica con su familia para poder generar ganancias y mejorar sus situación familiar ya que ahora cuenta con tres operarios en donde se tiene un porcentaje de 300 pantalones de lona en confección en una semana y de esa forma pretende incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder aprovechar la época que se aproxima la cual es la navidad donde se aumenta la demanda de dicha actividad y así mismo se hacer  a Asdir para solicitar su crédito que le permita sustir su mercaderia  en el mercado local y con el credito tiene la idea de vender su producto en otro municipio de l departamento de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Justo Ordóñez García is 40 years of age, married and currently resides in Paraje Tzan Sajoc, Cantón Pasajoc, 4.5 kilometers from the city of Totonicapán. This is where, for many years, señor Julio has been an operator in a small factory where they make canvas pants. This is where he was presented with the idea of creating a small factory with his family to be able to generate income and to better his family’s situation. Now, he has three laborers working at the rate of 300 pairs of canvas pants per week and, in this way, he aspires to increase his work capital to be able to take advantage of the Christmas season which is now approaching when demand increases. He has asked Asdir for a loan to be able to stock his merchandise in the local market and, with the loan, he has the idea of selling his product in another municipality in the department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material and accessories

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a member of the Sonriza (“Smile”) Village Bank. She lives in a village just outside of the city of Ayacuco with her husband and their four children. There she makes bricks by hand with the help of several workers. She sells the bricks in the same community, and also makes home deliveries in the city of Ayacucho.

As another source of income, she buys fruits and plants from local producers and brings them to Ayacucho to sell to distibutors. These plants include cochinilla, which is used to color makeup; tara, a plant with medicinal properties; and prickly pear. Erlinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$650) to buy tara and cochinilla. Her dreams are to expand her businesses and to continue to grow with them. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa. Erlinda es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Erlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza diariamente en un pueblo cercano a la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad y también reparte a domicilio en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Erlinda compra cochinilla, tara, tuna en su comunidad y luego de acopiar lo vende a los intermediarios. Erlinda necesita un préstamo de 2000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla. Los sueños de Erlinda son ampliar sus negocios, seguir creciendo con sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy Peruvian plants (tara, cochinilla) to resell to distributors

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz  vive en el Pasaje Patiño de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz  junto a su madre y hermanos
 
Trabaja en  el sindicato “Simón Bolívar”,prestando servicio como secretaria.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construcción para la reparación de una de sus paredes de su vivienda, ya que por esta temporada de lluvia tuvo varias rajaduras.
 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Mary Luz lives with her mother and siblings in Pasaje Patiño in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz.

She works for the "Simon Bolivar" union as a secretary.

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to repair a wall in her apartment, which developed cracks during the rainy season.

This is her first loan through Impro, whose assessment determined that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a wall in her aparment

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is 29 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Currently, the kids are in school. She has been sewing for nine years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

Through her dedication and hard work, Abena has four apprentices, to whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘Three Stars’ Trust Group. She was so happy when she was visited at her business site and was offered free business advice on management and how to retain customers. We believe this will equip her to take good advantage of the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, thread, thimbles, etc., as well as maize.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Juan A. se ha destacado por ser un comerciante de verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana se alista para ofrecer los perecederos. 

El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para que sea aprobada su solicitud de crédito para la compra de los perecederos como cebollas, yuca, limones, zanahorias, chayotes, etc. Y por esto espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Mr. Juan A. has distinguished himself as a salesman of vegetables having his own establishment where every day starting in the very early hours of the morning he gets ready to offer his products. The reason why he's waiting in Ceprodel is to see if his credit application will be approved so he can purchase his perishable goods like onions, yuca, limes, carrots, chayotes, etc., and continue to run his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A., also known as  “San,” lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, happily married, and blessed with eight children. Farming is the primary source of income for the family. Sometimes her husband accepts carpentry works from a near-by village. She dreams that her children will finish college and have decent jobs that will help them improve their standard of living. Susan decided to start a sari-sari store (variety  store) to augment the family's income. She joined HSPFI Trust Bank Program and with her first her first loan of PHP.5, 000, she was able to improve her sari-sari store. The demands for her goods are now outgrowing her sari-sari store. She plans to go into gasoline retailing to respond the needs of the jeepney divers in her village. Susan is now requesting PHP 10,000 to purchase grocery items for sale and to start her new business as a gasoline retailer.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and to start her new business as a gasoline retailer

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nikanou (La Passion) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Nikanou sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d'âge de 54 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Lafiabougou de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté.

Elles exercent la même activité d'achat et de vente  de céréales notamment le riz et de gammes variées de condiments alimentaires. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d'augmenter, le groupe Nikanou a décidé d'intégrer  l'institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son septième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 

Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des tonnes de riz  et une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires (oignons, piment, laye, épice, soumbala et autres). Elles s'approvisionnent  auprès des paysans producteurs (en riz), des commerçants grossistes de la place et des forains venant de Sikasso (en condiments). Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à la maison et au marché de San à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de femmes. 

Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 300.000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition  l'ouverture d'un magasin de stockage à San.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Nikanou are all married and average 45 years of age and 5 children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Lafiabougou district of the city of San (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). And they known one another through ties of community and kinship.

The group members work in the same business of buying and selling grain, notably rice and various ranges of condiments. The women are in high demand in this domain. In order to satisfy the needs of their continuously growing customer base, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their seventh solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding one have been correctly repaid.

The women intend to use this loan to buy tonnes of rice and a sizable quantity of condiments: onions, chili peppers, garlic, spices, soumbala (made of crushed fermented seeds or beans), and more. Supplies are gotten from rural producers (for the rice) and from wholesale merchants locally and from fair vendors from Sikasso (for the condiments). Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the house and the San marketplace. The customers are composed of retailers and women.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 300,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. The ambition of the group members is to open a supply store in San.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase items for her variety store

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 32 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She sells baby things such as cream, powder, clothes, flasks, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Diana Grace

texts.en:
Diana Grace V., a 22-year-old entrepreneur in the village of St. Tomas Saguday, Quirino, operates a small community-based store called a “sari-sari.” Married to Marloue V., a village farmer, they have one child, Arvie, who is 4 years old. Diana Grace wants to save funds for Arvie’s future education by patiently improving her little business.

She is requesting a loan from ASKI for PHP5,000.00 to purchase more store items in order to meet customer demand and increase her profits. With an increased income, she will be able to provide for the needs of her family and give them a higher standard of living. Through sacrifice and patience in life, Diana Grace believes that God will make a way to help her attain all of her goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Dolores Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Lucena is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a foodstall in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like salt, vegetables, coffee, sugar,  etc. in the local community. Lucena is just starting this business.

In 2005, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $319) from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị
loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Tumapue

texts.en: Tumapue T., 40, is married and has three children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells her products to the villagers three days a week. She has no previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (About $166 USD). SPBD loans are Tumapue’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy goods to improve business

loans.name: Avispas Group

texts.es:
En la zona Santiago II, se encuentra el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Avispas”, esta formado por quince mujeres que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace dos años, demostrando ser un grupo alegre y unido. La mayoría de ellas están casadas y tienen niños pequeños, afirman que necesitan obtener mejores recursos para el bienestar de sus familias. 
Las actividades más comunes dentro este grupo es la elaboración y venta de comida, luego de preparar sus ricos platillos, los ofrecen en pensiones y puestos de mercados, otras socias tienen tiendas de barrio.
La asociación Avispas necesita comprar insumos y productos al por mayor, con esto obtendran mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The focal centre 'Santiago II' can be found in the neighbourhood of the same name. The 'Avispas' association belongs to 'Santiago II' and is made up of 15 women who have worked together with Pro-Mujer for two years, demonstrating that it is a happy and united group. The majority of them are married with young kids, and they confirm that they need to earn more for the wellbeing of their families.

The most common activities in this group are making and selling food. After preparing their delicious dishes, they sell them in hostels, homes and from market stalls, and other members have stores in their neighbourhood.

The Avispas association needs to buy ingredients and products in bulk, and with this they will obtain higher earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and products/COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is already 60 years old. She is a resident of Barangay Parabba of Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Leopoldo, who works as a farmer and also a hog raiser. They have four children, and all of them are already married.  

Aurelia has been managing a village store for almost 20 years. She works hard and gets up early in the morning to open her store for her customers who need her service. She is still energetic and diligent in the business, though she is old. 

Aurelia still wants her income to increase by developing her business into a bigger one. She plans to expand her business by selling meat and vegetables. With this, she would like to ask the financial support of Kiva lenders to grant her loan request. She hopes that lenders will not look at her age but instead give her the opportunity to prove her worth in dealing with business.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Donah

texts.en:
Donah is twenty-six years old and married with two children between the ages of one and four. One of her children goes to school. Donah also takes care of additional family members. She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she rents a four-room house which has no electricity and no piped water, but the family does get three meals a day.

She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs for buying her merchandise, because she buys from suppliers who get charcoal from surrounding villages. Donah works seven days a week and sells to an average of twenty customers a day, from all categories of people. She has been in this business for five years. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence plus medication.

Donah has been with MCDT for two years servicing her fourth loan, and working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She has hopes of seeing her business grow bigger and eventually owning a permanent business location and home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia M. S. ( blusa roja) ella cuenta con 44 años de edad fue a la escuela donde termino la carrera técnica en enfermería , ella renta su local donde vende sus productos, ella se dedica a esa actividad por que viene de familia, vive en unión libre con el señor Juan Miguel Martínez que también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  y juntos ven por sus 3 hijos las dos pequeñas estudian la primaria y el niño la secundaria. Ella vive en la avenida 4 lote 35 de la colonia moctezuma de la ciudad de Orizaba VeraC., en esa comunidad nos relata doña Ignacia que la gente es muy pacifica, tratable y la mayoría se dedica al comercio. Esa  es una de las colonias mas viejas de la ciudad de Orizaba y con mucha tradición por el gran ambiente que se vive en la comunidad; Doña Ignacia supo de FRAC por medio de amistades y fue así como se animo a organizar un grupo llamado Estrellaspues vio que era una gran oportunidad para que su negocio creciera ya que ella quiere meter abarrotes a sus ventas, ella va a utilizar el dinero del préstamo para comprar frutas (manzana, plátano, tunas, naranja ) verduras (jitomate, chile, cebolla, papa, tomate, zanahoria, lechuga) abarrotes ( aceite, arroz, papel, jabón, mayonesa).

El grupo Estrella esta conformado por 10 señoras que llevan una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo, el fin de reunirse y solicitar su préstamo es el  de mejorar su calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familiares. En su mayoría ellas se dedican a la venta de catalogo, pero también hay quienes venden ropa, antojitos yogurt natural.

Doña Ignacia esta muy contenta ya que al recibir su crédito va a poder tener variedad de frutas, verduras y abarrotes y así sus clientes van a tener mucho mas surtido para escoger además de que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así podrá pagar el préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

El sueño de doña Ignacia además del bienestar de sus hijos es que ellos terminen sus estudios y el de tener su propio local para que así sus ganancias sean mayores y pueda aumentar a su actividad la venta de pollo.
Ella agradece a Kiva que ayuda a la gente humilde a pesar de no conocerlas y en especial la ayuda que ofrecen a las señoras que tienen una actividad económica para mejorar la calidad de vida de la Familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ignacia M. S. (in the red blouse) is 44 years old and returned to school where she finished her training as a technical nurse. She also has a vending stall where she sells products grown by her family. Doña Ignacia is in a common law marriage with Sr. Juan Miguel Martínez, who also sells fruits and vegetables. They have 3 children, two in elementary school and the other in high school. She lives at Avenue 4 Lot 35 in the Moctezuma settlement of the city of Orizaba VeraC.. Doña Ignacia tells us that her community is peaceful and well managed, and that most of the residents have their own businesses. It is one of the oldest settlements in the city of Orizaba and has a rich tradition as well as a great atmosphere that prevails throughout the community.

Doña Ignacia learned about Fundación Realidad through friends and was encouraged to organize a group, which was named “Estrella” (Star). She saw this was a great opportunity to grow her business because she wanted to add groceries to the products she offers. She will use her loan to buy fruit (apples, bananas, pears, and oranges), vegetables (tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots, and lettuce), and groceries (oil, rice, paper, soap, and mayonnaise).

The “Estrella” Group is composed of 10 women who have been friends for a long time and meet on the weekends. They are requesting a loan so that they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. Most of them sell products by catalog, but others sell clothing, snacks, and natural yogurt.

Doña Ignacia is very pleased with her loan because she will be able to offer a variety of fruits, vegetables and groceries and give her customers more choices. She will be able to get better returns which will enable her to repay her loan and improve the quality of life for her children.

The dream of Doña Ignacia is to provide for her children so that they can finish their studies. She hopes to have her own vending location so that she can increase her earnings and expand her business by selling chickens. She is grateful to Kiva for helping ordinary people who are complete strangers. The assistance provided to these women help them have their own businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, and groceries to offer a variety of products

loans.name: Jiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Jiguissèmè sont exclusivement  des femmes  mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1 un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt  solidaire, tous les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font  de la vente d’habits, de tasses,  des fruits, des articles de boutique et des prestations de services telle la couture..
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 douzaines de tasses, 5 paniers d’oranges, 2 régimes de bananes, 3 sacs d’ananas,  3 cartons de pommes, 2 sacs de sucre,  2 bidons d’huile de 20 litres,  3 paquets d’articles divers,  une dizaine de fils à coudre et 3 pièces de tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante et font leurs prestations de service très souvent à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant, quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager  un point pour leurs  prestations.
texts.en:
The four members of this Jiguissèmè group are all married women with an average age of 38 and on average, 2 children, and live in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The 3 preceding loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell clothing, basins, fruit, and dry goods, and they provide services such as sewing.

With their new loan they intend to buy 5 dozen basins, 5 baskets of oranges, 2 stalks of bananas, 3 sacks of pineapple, 14 cases of apples, 2 sacks of sugar, two jerrycans of 20 liters of oil, 3 packets of various items, a dozen spools of sewing thread, and 3 lengths of cloth. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and in the neighborhoods on foot, and provide their services out of their homes. They sell for cash and occasionally for credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings and used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a venue for their service-oriented businesses.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a single man living with his parents. He's 25 years old. He has owned a car repair shop since 2007 to provide, along with his father, better life conditions for the family. Today, he wants to take out a loan of $1000 to buy more spare parts and perform maintenance for the machineries to enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: buy more spare parts and perform maintenance for the machineries

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es: La señora Gloria Judith es originaria de la comunidad de chotacaj  a cuatro kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapan  su principal actividad es maestra de educacion primaria, trabaja en una escuela oficial del gobierno, hace cinco años inicio su propio negocio que consiste en una cafeteria, que los atiende  por la tarde y los fines de semana, hoy necesita de un credito para sustir su cafeteria, y poder mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Judith is from the community of Chotacaj, located 4 km from the city of Totonicapan. Her main occupation is primary school teacher, and she works in a government-run school. Five years ago she started her own business, a café, which she tends in the afternoons and on weekends. She currently needs a loan to stock her café and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Rister

texts.es:
La señora Rister, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 61 años y 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

Rister, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que maneja. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea: Esika, como complemento D. su negocio también venD. los Productos D. Gano Café (Productos naturales para la cura D. diferentes tipos D. enfermedades).

 Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,300.00, comprará productos D. belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices, labiales, esmaltes D. uñas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. gano café y harinas para sus dulces.

Rister, a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir D. muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Rister is a member of the Immaculate Virgin Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children of whom one is still a dependent.

Rister is a cheerful and charismatic woman who is extremely devoted to her family. These qualities help her in running her business. She sells the Esika line of cosmetics, which complements her other business selling “Gano Café” (natural products for curing different types of diseases).

With this loan of 1300 soles, Rister will buy beauty products to add to her inventory such as colognes for women, men, and children; crèmes, pressed powders, eye pencils, lipsticks, and nail polish. Some of the money will be used to buy “Gano Café” products and flour for making sweets.

Rister is a role model for many women her age as someone who has started a business and achieved her dreams through perseverance. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: R. Rachidatou est née en 1952 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rachidatou réside au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 15 ans. Mariée à IMOUROU Fouséni un mécanicien, Rachidatou est mère de quatre enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Rachidatou a un autre enfant à charge. Rachidatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Seul le conjoint de Rachidatou supporte les charges de la famille. Rachidatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Rachidatou vend depuis près de 35 ans, des divers (savons, omo, pinces, sachets, brosses à dent, dentifrices, stylos, torche, etc.) à son domicile. Rachidatou mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de nourriture. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Rachidatou s’approvisionne. Rachidatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Rachidatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rachidatou R. was born in 1952 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has lived in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nearly 15 years. Married to Fouséni Imourou, a mechanic, Rachidatou is mother to four children. In addition to her own children, Rachidatou also takes care of another child. Rachidatou lives with her children and husband. Her husband is the only one who takes care of the family's expenses. Rachidatou never went to school. To meet her needs, Rachidatou has sold, for nearly 35 years, various items such as soap, Omo detergent, pliers, sachets, toothbrushes, toothpaste, pens, lamps, etc. at her home. Rachidatou also has a second business in which she sells food items. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Rachidatou is a long-time client of Alidé who has repaid all of her previous loans. Rachidatou is requesting a third loan through Alidé to increase her working capital and increase the size of her business in order to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items (boxes of soap and Omo detergent, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Ogboko

texts.en:
Ogboko is a 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a printer and he also supports the home. Ogboko hopes that her children will be graduates in the future. Her eldest child is 12 years old. 

Ogboko sells beef in an open section of the market in Agbor, Delta State. She started this business 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to sell and attract more customers to her business. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is 42 years old, married with a child. Her child is 15 years old and still dependent on her. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. Mary is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Mary sells firewood at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Mary is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores S. es una dama que labora en su propia actividad de costurera en el municipio de Telica en León. Ella ha adquirido vasta experiencia en esta labor ya que es la que le permite llevar el sustento a su hija que se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. La señora María S. es madre soltera y hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.
Su mayor satisfacción es que su hija corone su carrera universitaria y así que llegue a ser una gran profesional de éxito. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en el pago de la universidad de su hija y así contribuye a que se logren sus sueños de que su hija amada corone su carrear profesional.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores S. operates her own tailoring business in the town of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon. She has a lot of experience at this kind of work and it has allowed her to support her daughter who is now studying at the university. Sra. Maria S. is a single mother and has had to be both father and mother to her daughter. Her greatest satisfaction is that she has given her daughter a chance to study and have a professional career. She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay university fees and fulfill her dream that her beloved daughter go on to a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
With three children, Ailyn A. doesn’t know anymore how she will budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping him  maintain the rice field. She is currently preparing her farm for planting and she is needing help to be able improve their harvest. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Omid Karema Group

texts.en:
This is Omid Karema group which has four members. The group leader is Omid who lives in 11th district of Khir Khana, Kabul, Afghanistan.

Omid is 54 years old and has three children who are in school. He wants to take a loan for his metal shop because he wants to make it larger. 

Karema wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business to increase her business, and Sarya wants to take a loan for her business sewing quilts. She wants to have more clients in her business. Also, Abdul W. wants to take a loan for his taxi business. He wants to purchase a new machine for it.

They each want to expand and progress their business and together have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. They would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To enlarge his metal shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 40-year-old single woman. She lives with her mother and she is the only provider for her after the death of her father. She has owned an accessories and perfumes shop in her town since 1988. During this long period, she has gained a large number of clients passing by her shop. 

Today, Alice is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise to meet her clients’ demands and offer all the new items for them.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Hilda Doris

texts.es: Hilda, D. 52 años,es una  mujer muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo y 2 D. sus 4 hijos, en su casa ubicada en un barrio urbanizado, del sur D. la ciudad.DesD. hace 25 años, se dedica a la confección D. ropa para  militares como: polos, boinas, escarpines y pantalones. Durante este tiempo tuvo muchos altibajos en su labor, pero gracias a los contactos que le brinda su esposo, que es militar, viene surgiendo D. a pocos. Ella es la encargada D. hacer los trazos  y cortes en su casa y cuenta con la  ayuda D. sus dos hijas, y para la costura deriva las prendas a una  casa D. confecciones especializada, ya que éstas deberán tener un buen  acabado y refuerzo, que solamente realizan las máquinas especiales. A pesar D. que debe pagar  por el cocido, la confección D. estas prendas le es muy  rentable, pues  la  contratan por grandes  bloques D. prendas. Es por esta razón que Hilda sueña  instalar algún día su propia empresa, porque ya tiene una buena cartera D. clientes.Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus  cuotas puntualmente, ya que piensa  contar con posteriores créditos, porque  quiere  seguir progresando en su negocio.Con el dinero solicitado comprará  varios fardos D. telas para la elaboración D. escarpines militares, así espera lograr atender un gran  pedido que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 52, is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and two of their four children. Her house is in an urbanized area south of the city. For 25 years she has been making military clothing like shirts, berets, slippers, and pants. During this time she has had many highs and lows in her work. Thanks to her husband’s contacts, he is in the military, the business slowly rises. She is in charge of making the patterns and cutting them out in her house. Her two daughters help her. She takes the clothes to a specialized sewing house because they need to have good finishings, and they need to be reinforced. This can only be done with special machines. Even though she needs to pay for the sewing, making these items is very profitable. They contract her to make large amounts of clothing. That is why Hilda dreams of one day setting up her own business. She already has a good customer list. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all of her payments punctually. She plans on having more loans in the future because she wants to keep progressing in her business. She will use the money she is requesting to buy several bundles of fabric to make the military slippers. This way she hopes to take care of a large order that is pending.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy several bundles of fabric for her business

loans.name: Lucy Wangechi

texts.en:
Lucy operates a school in Ndumbuini Trading Center that has all lower primary classes established. She is still constructing it bit by bit, as she gets funds. She targets children from the neighborhood and this has been her primary business, which she has been doing for the last four months. Ndubuini area has a high population, most of whom are low-income earners.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her first loan from KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET. She will use the loan advance to buy more desks for the school and also construct a few more classrooms in order to accommodate more students. 

She wants to buy a truck and complete building the school and equipping it with all the required equipment.

loans.use: To build more iron sheet class rooms, amounting to KSHS 40,000, and Buy desks for KSHS 20,000

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda G. is a 52 year old married woman who supports her family by selling water and shrimps, and via her pig fattening business. She lives in Sto. Catali, Brgy Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 54 year old husband and their children. Her husband Jerrry is a farmer. They have 5 children between 20 and 30 years old; 2 of them have their own family, while the rest are working to help the family. 

Rhoda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000. 

Rhoda is now borrowing Php 29,500 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.
