Rhoda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. In the picture you see Rhoda with her water container. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 39 years old, married with 4 children ranging from 18 years to 2 months. Anastasie sells small fish, flour, and salt. Anastasie is well-known in her business of selling small fish which is very important for her. so she can sell more small fish. Anastasie employs one person from her community so that her business runs well. She opens her business from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Anastasie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding a large quantity of small fish which will allow her to satisfy her customers. With this loan, Anastasie will be able to earn more profits which will help her to pay school fees for her children and provide them with all the necessities.

loans.use: Expanding her business through adding a large quantity of small fish for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married to a builder and they  have four children who all go to school. Hellen doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a sweet and yellow banana stall in Kalerwe market. She works in a semi-urban area and works seven days week. She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. Besides this banana business, she also owns a mini-restaurant. Her major customers are cyclists and the community around her business. Her business challenge is the seasonality (rainy season) because she works from a floody place and this hinders her customers from reaching her. She aspires to see her business grow big and to start going directly to the farmers for her bananas. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital. Hellen resides in and rents her two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water . Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira Q. is from the town of La Libertad. She is 47 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the third loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Saidoy

texts.ru: Гафурова Саидой проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж и сын работают на заводе. Сама Саидой более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Saidoy G. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She's forty-two years old, married and has four children. Her husband and son work in a factory. For over seven years Saidoy has raised cattle. She fattens it and then sells it on the market. She's requesting a loan to buy some large livestock.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large livestock

loans.name: Djekabaara 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Djekabaara 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sontiguila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le petit mil et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
Avec ce prêt, ADAMA F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  de petit mil et du haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000F CFA par campagne.
Les femmes de l’association Djekabaara I se disent satisfaites de la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekabaara 1 Group are married women who are, on average, 53 years old with 5 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Sontiguila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include, among others, peanuts, pearl millet, and beans. They are on their first farming loan. With this new loan, Adama F. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1 hectare of pearl millet and beans. The products are sold in the town of Nangola, its surrounding areas, and in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 30,000 FCFA per campaign. The women of the Djekabaara 1 Group are satisfied with their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and are fully confident that their farming during the rainy season will progress well.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour costs

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli T. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Arceli is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Arceli also hopes to have enough capital to venture into raising pigs. She says she has to work hard so she can support her children's education.

Arceli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arceli from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Katy Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Katy del Rosario B., tiene 31 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos adolecentes, que se dedican al estudio, habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, un conocido lugar de la ciudad de Managua por la delincuencia que amenaza a los habitantes que ahí moran, ellos tienen un pequeño negocio el cual es una venta de abarrotes, productos de uso diario y de casa, fue hace mas de 6 años que con apoyo de su esposo lograron instalar este negocio el cual hoy le genera un buen ingreso a la familia, ellos se sienten provechosos de la buenas ventas que genera el negocio, y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo con la intención de incrementar la mercadería que se ofrecen en la pulpería, esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones económicas con el objetivo de financiar los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, y la tranquilidad de favorecer a su desarrollo diario.
texts.en:
Katy del Rosario B. is 31 years old, married and has two teen-aged children who attend school. They live in the Lureles neighborhood, an area in Managua, known for the crime that harasses its residents. [Katy] has a small business where she sells groceries, and daily use personal and household products. She started this business six years ago, with her husband’s support, and now it generates a good income for the family. They feel privileged with the good sales that the business generates. For this reason they are asking for this loan, in order to be able to increase the amount of merchandise that they have to sell. This investment will help give them better financial conditions and will allow them to pay for their children’s university educations, as well as provide favorable conditions for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Trabajadoras es de la zona de Santa Rosa Misiones, se dedican al comercio, venta de pollos caseros y otros gracias al crédito han podido aumentar sus ingresos económicos dentro de su propia casa ya que la mayoría de ellas tienen hijos en edad escolar.    
Desean seguir trabajando en comité y crecer cada día mas unidas y en forma responsable para mejorar su calidad e vida y la de su familia.
La señora Marina es una de las integrantes quien es una persona súper activa y trabajadora, ella ya cuenta con la actividad que se refiere a la cría de animales como de cerdo y aves, y actualmente también quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropas, para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de remera, camisa, pantalones y otros.
Ella desea mucho que esta actividad le resulte bien ya que le será muy útil para su familia y agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible el crédito que ellas reciben.
texts.en:
The “Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee is in Santa Rosa Misiones. They are merchants and sell home-grown chickens and other products. Thanks to financing they have been able to increase their household income since most of them have school aged children. They want to continue to work as a committee and daily grow more closely together and responsibly to improve their own and their families’ quality of life. Marina is one of the group members. She is a super-active, hard working person. She raises pigs and chickens but she also wants to go into clothing sales now. To do so, she is asking for funding to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and others. She very much hopes that this activity will yield good results because it will be very useful for her family. She is grateful to all the people that fund the loan they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, pants, blouses, shirts, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plantain to sell

loans.name: José Aurelio

texts.es:
José Aurelio tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en uno de los barrios ubicados en el cercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

José estudió medicina veterinaria, actualmente cuenta con un consultorio en donde ofrece todo tipo de servicios para mascotas, como limpieza, prevención y tratamiento de enfermedades, así como venta de medicinas. El inició sus actividades trabajando para una empresa más grande y poco a poco ahorró dinero para poder instalar su propio consultorio. Su esposa es médico veterinaria también y juntos se encargan de atender su establecimiento.

El cuidado que ponen en la atención y tratamiento de las mascotas de sus clientes han hecho que en los cinco años que lleva funcionando el establecimiento su clientela se haya fidelizado. Actualmente el desea implementar su negocio con la compra de medicinas para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José desea seguir especializándose en su rama para seguir ayudando a los animales. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien bastante servicial y honrado.
texts.en:
José Aurelio, 31, is married and lives with his wife and minor son in one of the neighborhoods in greater Chiclayo, a very commercial city that is the capital of Lambayeque region. José studied veterinary medicine and has a clinic where he offers all kinds of services for pets like: grooming, disease prevention and treatment as well as the sale of medicine. At the beginning he worked for a large firm until he gradually saved enough money to set up his own clinic. His wife is also a veterinarian and they tend to their business together. The care with which they tend to and treat their customers’ pets has resulted in their securing a regular customer base over the five years they have been in operation. He would like to stock medicines in order to provide still better service. To reach this objective, he has requested his first, 2000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. José hopes to continue to specialize in his field to continue to help animals. People who know him consider him to be quite helpful and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines to stock his veterinary clinic.

loans.name: Marcos Rosendo

texts.es:
El señor  Marcos Rosendo M.  V. tiene 26 años y vive en la ciudad de Tarija, en calidad de casero. El cliente por ahora no tiene hijos y solamente se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros (taxista) a la vez el forma parte de un grupo folklorico llamado "embajadores del  rey" en donde el toca el violín", esto le permite a el tener un ingreso extra ya que el solo va a tocar cuando el grupo tiene un contrato. 

Marcos nos comentaba que el formar parte de este grupo le ha  permitido viajar al exterior (Argentina), con su grupo, yendo a eventos en donde fueron contratados, además que estos viajes le favorecen económicamente porque su remuneración es más alta. Marcos dice que con el crédito que sacara lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su auto, como ser suspensión, llantas, arreglo del tapiz, etc.  Además Marcos sostiene que conoce muy bien su actividad que realiza ya que desde hace tres años se dedica al mismo, como también a la de músico (tocando el violín).
texts.en:
Marcos Rosendo M. V. is 26 years old and lives in the city of Tarija where he is taking care of a property. He does not have children yet. He works as a taxi driver as well as playing the violin in a folk group, which gives him some extra income on the side as he only plays when the group are hired to play. Mario is now very familiar with both of these activities as he has worked as a taxi driver and musician for the last three years.

Marcos tells us that being part of this group has allowed him to travel abroad to Argentina, going to events where they were hired to play. These trips have also been beneficial economically as they have brought in higher earnings. 

Marcos says that he will invest this loan in the maintenance of his vehicle, which will include suspension adjustment, tyre replacement and carpet cleaning.

loans.use: Purchase of artefacts to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: El Limoncito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "El limoncito" esta ubicado en el municipio de tecoanapa, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que así se llama la comunidad en donde viven ya que como son originarios de ahí, esta historia es acerca de la señora odilia M. R., ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, cuenta con 48 años de edad, ella esta casada su esposo se llama emigdio tacuba, tienen 2 hijos, isela de 22 y Abel de 19años de edad de los cuales los 2 estudian la mayor esta cursando el segundo año de la licenciatura en derecho y el otro esta en tercer año de prepa, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con el cual lleva mas de 10 años.

Odilia se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice tiene mucha demanda y deja muy buenas ganancias, aparte de que quería ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, ella invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas mercancía para su tienda como son: arroz, fríjol, leche, azúcar, refrescos, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico y demás productos para tener bien surtido su negocio.
 
Dice que le esta yendo súper bien con su tienda, tanto que esta empezando a ahorrar parte de las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, para  construir la barda a su casa y también esta apoyando a su esposo con el sustento de la casa, y a sus hijos con sus estudios para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional y continua invirtiendo en su negocio. 

Comenta que su negocio ésta beneficiando mucho a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que tengan tienda ahí cerca, así que como ella esta es la única que vende ahí y esta mas cerca, todos van le compran a ella, aparte de la excelente atención y servicio que les brinda a sus clientes, edemas de los precios accesibles. 

El sueño que tiene doña odilia es el de construir un local mas grande ahí mismo en su casa para ampliar un poco mas su tienda, y así tenerla mucho mas surtida para obtener mas y mejores ganancias y así poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores, para que tengan una muy buena profesión.

Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables y pagadoras ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien es por eso que en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o dejado de pagar ya que no quieren defraudar la confianza que la empresa ha depositado en ellos.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho y su vida y la de su familia también esta cambiando.
Los integrantes de el limoncito y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes: 
Clara B. R.-venta de pescados
Honorina G. S.-carnicería
Leonor C. R.-venta de semillas
Odilia M. R.-tienda de abarrotes
Eloisa C. R.-venta de perfumes
Sulpicia B. L.-venta de semillas
Maria de Lourdes L. R.-carnicería
Marcelina R. G.-venta de semillas
Miriam S. R.-venta de zapatos
Elideth V. B.-venta de semillas
Luciana R. M.-venta de frutas y verduras
texts.en:
This group is called “El Limoncito” and is located in the town of Tecoanapa.  The group's members decided to take this name because it is the name of the community where they live and they all originally come from there.  This story is about Mrs Odilia M. R. who is one of the group's members.  She is 48 years old and married.  Her husband is called Emigdio Tacuba.  They have two children; Isela who is 22 and Abel who is 19.  Both of their children are studying.  One is in their second year of a law degree and the other is in the third year of senior high school.  Odilia has a grocery store which she has been running for 10 years.

Odilia decided on this business because she says there is a lot of demand and it makes good profits.  She also wanted to help her husband a bit with household expenses and the education of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop such as rice, beans, milk, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, oil, toilet paper and other products so that it is well stocked.

Odilia says that her business also benefits her neighbors a lot as there are not many people who have stores near where they live so, as she is the only one who sells there and is close by, they all buy from her.  She offers her customers excellent service and attentiveness as well as reasonable prices.

Odilia's dream is to extend her house so that she can make her store a little bigger and thereby have a much better stocked store so that she can obtain more and better profits.  This will enable her to continue supporting her children with their higher education so that they can get into very good professions.

Odilia tells us that the members of her group are very responsible and reliable payers since they have known each other for a long time and they get on very well together.  This is why they have never been late in their payments or missed any payments.  They do not want to let down the company that has shown trust in them.

Odilia is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support of the loan which they are offering.  Thanks to the loan she is able to improve her life and that of her family.

The members of 'El Limoncito' and the businesses which they work in are as follows:

Clara B. R. – fish selling
Honorina G. S. – butcher's shop
Leonor C. R. – seed sales
Odilia M. R. – grocery store
Eloisa C. R. – perfume sales
Suplicia B. L. – seed sales
María de Lourdes L. R. – butcher's shop
Marcelina R. G. – seed sales
Miriam S. R. – shoe sales
Elideth V. B. – seed sales
Luciana R. M. – fruit and vegetable sales

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise such as sugar, cookies, soft drinks, eggs, milk, oil and soap in order to have a better-stocked store

loans.name: Lat's Group

texts.en:
The village loan consists of nine people, located in Vihear village in Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Lat S., a 50-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family's living situation. 

Mrs. Lat S. is a farmer who owns a plot of rice field to cultivate for a living. Her husband, Mr. Muong Mut, 49, works as a fisherman. His fishing business needs some supplies, but they lack the money to buy them. So Mrs. Lat S. would like to use a loan to buy fishnets for her husband's fishing business. 

They have four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and two are students in the local school and also help in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de granos como arvejas, maíz, habas y moraya, la socia vende en el mercado Vinocanchon, la socia vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio y tener un pequeño puesto para vender los cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This [communal bank] member belongs to "Las Leonas de San Jeronimo" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, which is in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  Gregoria is 51 years old and lives with her partner.  She has four children.  

She alternates between her daily activities and her sales of grains like peas, maize, beans and moray.  She sells in the Vinocanchon market, from 6am to 5pm.  She wants to improve her business and have a small stand to sell the cereals.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase grain in bulk.  She appreciates those that become part of her dream in this way, and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: For the purchase of grain in bulk.

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.en: Ngoy K. is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Kim Soeur, age 46. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have three children; two are married and one is single. Ngoy K. and her husband grow different kinds of crops on the farmland she inherited from her grandmother. In the past, Ngoy K. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. She is applying for a loan from Kiva in order to buy her own cow, which will also provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy her own cow

loans.name: Marng

texts.en:
Marng B., 45, grows corns and raises pigs, earning an income of USD 7 per day. B. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 7.5 on other necessary expenses every month.

 B. is requesting a loan of USD 450 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. B. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer de edad ya avanzada de 59 años de edad, con una familia de nueve hijos, ya mayores y casados.
Su oficio que ejerce desde joven es la costura, el cual aprendió y ha sido su medio para cubrir los gastos básicos y personales. En donde a través de los años ah adquirido  experiencia y clientela.
Con este nuevo crédito será para la terminacion de un cuarto, en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, perlines, laminas de zinc, golosos entre otros.Todo estas mejoras lo ha logrado a traves de los  financiamiento, siendo cinco ciclos trabajando con  Afodenic
texts.en:
Aura is a 59 year-old woman.  She has nine children who are all now grown up and married.  Aura has been in the sewing business since she was young and learned how to sew.  Through this business she has managed to cover her basic and personal expenses.  Over the years she has gained experience and customers.

Aura will use this new loan to finish building a room.  She will buy building supplies such as: cement, sand, beams, metal sheets, bolts, etc.  She has achieved all these improvements through loans.  She has been through five loan cycles with Afodenic.

loans.use: To finish building a room that is nearly completed

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is fifty-five years old, married with ten children, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of educating his children. He has a number of income-generating activities which include farming, trading in beans and maize and grinding  agricultural output. His major challenge is customers who buy on credit and take a long time to pay, and his business dream is to have a store for all his produce. Robert intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Fiacre

texts.en:
Fiacre is 29 years old and is married with two children, 3 months and 3 and a half years old. Fiacre's wife also works in commerce.  Fiacre has owned his business for one year. It is a large and clean shop where he sells shoes. Fiacre is a hard worker who employs one other person. Fiacre keeps his shop open from 7am to 6pm every day except Saturday. 

Fiacre has requested a loan in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Lilia Joy

texts.en:
Lilia Joy G. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Lilia Joy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she sells clothing, bags, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilia Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Maria Luz Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Luz del Carmen H. M., de treinta y nueve años de edad, reside en Colon, departamento de La Libertad, vive alquilando junto a sus dos hijos que actualmente estudian, Maria Luz tiene instalada en su misma casa una sala de belleza, en la que después de 6 años de funcionamiento ha logrado una clientela muy fiel, gracias a su excelente trabajo y siempre precios al alcance de todos. Ahora Maria se encuentra solicitando crédito para poder abastecer de lociones, cremas y demás para el cuidado personal que solicitan sus clientes. Luz espera poder contar con este importante apoyo para ella, ya que como madre soltera es la única oportunidad para sus hijos
texts.en: Maria Luz del Carmen H. Martinea is 39 years old.  She lives in Colon, Department of La Libertad, and rents a home with her two children who are currently studying.  Maria Luz has installed a beauty salon in her home, in which after 6 years of operation she has achieved a very loyal clientele thanks to her excellent work and always having prices within the reach of everyone.  Now, Maria is asking for a loan to be able to stock lotions, creams, and others personal care products that her clients ask for.  Luz hopes to be able to depend on this important help, as she is a single mother and it is the only opportunity for her children.

loans.use: to buy lotion, creams, hair gel and dyes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married with two children aged six and two years, with the firstborn already in school. He has been doing mixed farming in his hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya for six years now. His produce, bananas, maize and beans, is sold locally.

Daniel has requested a third loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.His first and second loans of 25,000 KES were promptly repaid. This third loan is purposely for  purchasing installing irrigation equipment for his banana plantation. He believes the irrigation will mitigate the rampant challenge of insufficient water for farming. He adds that the income generated will be channeled to his children's education and general well-being. 

Daniel reaffirms that the loans from Juhudi Kilimo have improved his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase and install irrigation equipment for banana farm.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.   Marites works hard to provide for her family.  To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  Marites has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase biscuits, soaps, and grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marites has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns income from selling rice.

Marites aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mtawali

texts.en:
Mtawali is a single man who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, food and clothing. 

For the past five years, he has operated a green grocery business.  He sells from home to his neighbours and passersby. Mtawali faces a major challenge of competition from other green grocers operators in his area of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 he wants to purchase one sack of green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of green vegetables, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es: Ana Felicita, D. 71 años D. edad. Ella posee una tienda con la que mantiene su hogar; Ana es una señora D. avanzada edad pero eso no la detiene, sino como debe ser, aprovecha su experiencia para satisfacer a sus clientes, siempre se encuentra activa  y por medio D. su negocio complace sus deseos D. seguir adelante y es una forma D. compartir vivencias con sus clientes; por la dicha a que el lugar donD. se situa el negocio es muy concurrido, cada día se aumenta el número D. la clientela, además al buen servicio, buena calidad D. los productos y buenos precios, ha hecho que Ana genere la preferencia D. las personas que la buscan. Como toda excelente vendedora quiere mantener feliz al cliente, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer el negocio con productos como granos básicos, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas que no tiene actualmente. D. esta forma Ana lograra satisfacer a las personas y podrá mantener la seguridad económica en su hogar.
texts.en: Ana Felicita is 71 years old. She has a store with which she supports her household. Ana is a woman of advanced age, but that doesn't stop her. She is always active, and through her business she satisfies her desire to advance herself and she satisfies the needs of the customers who visit her. Because the area is very busy, the number of customers increases every day, since with good service, good quality products, and good prices, Ana has won people's business. And of course, like every excellent saleswoman, she wants to keep her customers happy. For this reason, she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will permit her to stock her business with products like basic foodstuffs, sugar, beverages, candies, etc. In this way Ana will succeed in satisfying her customers and will be able to maintain the economic security of her home.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, sugar, beverages, and candies for her store.

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Née le 12 Juin 1975, Rachidatou est mariée à Soumaïla, un soudeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Rachidatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Rachidatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Rachidatou a appris la couture, ce qui l’aide à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène, Rachidatou vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Rachidatou achète ses produits à Ilara au Nigéria. C’est la deuxième fois que Rachidatou sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Rachidatou was born on June 12, 1975 and is married to Soumaïla, a welder. They have four children, of whom a few attend school. Rachidatou and her husband share household expenses. Rachidatou lives together with her husband and their children. Since she never attended school, Rachidatou learnt dressmaking and this activity enables her to provide for her children. At the same time she has another activity, namely selling sewing supplies in her workshop. Rachidatou buys her supplies in Ilara in Nigeria. This is the second time that Rachidatou applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé, which will help her to boost her activity level and better meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia que tiene 38 años de edad, él vive con sus hijos los cuales son menores de edad.   Andrés vive en una comunidad la cual caracteriza a sus pobladores porque la mayoría son trabajadores independientes, que se dedican ala crianza y comercialización de animales. Andrés vive en un caserío que es anexo al distrito de Mórrope, con aproximadamente 50 familias 

Andrés se dedica principalmente a la compra y venta de pescado, esta actividad la realiza desde sus domicilio y recorriendo los distintos caseríos de Mórrope. Cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años trabajando en este rubro, los que e le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientela fija para sus negocio. 
También se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores , negocio que realiza pero en menor intensidad.

Andrés está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de animales menores actualmente  se ha propuesto invertir en mayor cantidad de animales debido a que la demanda de comparadores de animales es alta por la zona y poder hacer arreglos al interior de su casa.

Andrés cuenta con buenas referencias, es un padre entregado a su trabajo muy responsable, y honesto, su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés, 38, is a father living with his children who are all minors.  He lives in a community known because most of its residents are independent workers who raise animals to sell.  Andrés lives in a hamlet that is annexed to Mórrope District and has about 50 families.

Andrés is primarily a fish merchant.  He carries out his activity from home traveling throughout the various hamlets in Mórrope.  He has six years experience in this line of work which has made it possible for him to acquire experience and a regular customer base.  He also sells small farm animals, a business he does but with less intensity.

Andrés is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy small farm animals because he’s decided to invest in a larger quantity of animals because demand from buyers is high in the area and he’ll be able to do some improvements to the interior of his house.

Andrés has good references.  He is a father who is devoted to his work; he’s very responsible and honest.  His greatest wish is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his businesses and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en la comunidad de la trinchera el es una persona muy emprendedora.
Desde hace poco decidió empezar un negocio con un amigo suyo que trabaja con madera, ahora ellos se dedicaran  a la confección de muebles. Pero en este momento el no tiene todas las herramientas necesarias, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de esas herramientas. El desea poder empezar su negocio lo más antes posible para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El es  socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal de la Trinchera, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the La Trinchera community, and he is a very enterprising person.  Not long ago he decided to start a business with a friend of his, who works with wood.  They now make furniture.

However, at this time he does not have all of the necessary tools.  That is why he needs a loan for ₡500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) in order to buy these tools.  He wishes to be able to start his business as soon as possible in order to improve his quality of life.

He is a member of Crédito Comunal de La Trinchera, one of the 110 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: David Armando

texts.es: David Armando de treinta y dos años de edad reside solo en su casa; un joven optimista que siempre lucha por un mejor futuro. El posee un gimnasio el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar se ha hecho de mucha fama pues tiene el mejor equipo, en un lugar accesible a precios realmente bajos. David piensa que el ejercicio es la mejor forma de mantenerse activo en la vida y motiva a su clientela para que trabajen duro empezando por su buena  salud; el esta entusiasmado con su trabajo y quiere que el negocio crezca es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más maquinaria como pesas, cintas andadoras, bicicletas estáticas, de esta forma podrá cumplir una de sus grandes metas. David tiene fe que esto le permitirá tener en su hogar la estabilidad económica que necesita.
texts.en: David Armando is 32 years old and lives alone.  He is an optimistic young man that always strives for a better future.  He owns a gym that is frequented often by the people that live here.  He has a good reputation because he has the best equipment, an accessible location and very low prices.  David believes that exercise is the best way to stay active and encourages his customers to work hard, beginning with good health.  He is enthusiastic about his work and wants his business to grow.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy more equipment such as weights, treadmills and stationary bikes and thereby, fulfill one of his greatest goals.  David has faith that this will allow him to have the financial stability that he needs in his household.

loans.use: purchase weights, treadmills and stationary bicycles.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years.  He is 46 years old and married to Veronicah. They have four school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.  He will sell his produce at the local market.

In the future, Cyrus hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Benno est créé le 9 juillet 2011 le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il est constitué de 27 femmes qui sont parentes et amies, leur activité principale est le commerce.


Madame Ndéye Maguette la responsable est âgée de 49 ans, mariée,mère de trois enfants, elle mène un commerce de tissus et légumes avec une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans,elle fait aussi de la couture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en bazin rouge.


Elle voyage pour acheter ses marchandises (tissus et légumes)dans les villes voisines et revend au marché central de sa ville.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce pour attirer la clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite élargir son activité et réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de voyager à l'extérieur pour un commerce import-export.
texts.en:
The Benno solidarity group was formed on July 9th, 2011, the same day the Banc Villageois was launched.  It is made up of 27 women, who are all relatives or friends.  Their main business is sales.

Ndéye Maguette, the group’s leader, is a 49-year-old married mother of three.  She works selling fabric and vegetables, and has over 10 years’ experience doing so.  She also works as a dressmaker.  In the picture, she is standing on the right, dressed in red damask.

She travels to purchase her stock (fabric and vegetables) in neighboring cities, and re-sells it in her city’s central market.

Her loan will enable her to build her business to attract more customers and earn more income.

She wants to expand her business, in order to make profits that will enable her to travel outside her country to work in import/export sales.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos de 53 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, frutas que no necesitan mucho tiempo para ser cosechadas, su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Santos es un padre que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Santos, 53, lives with his family in a house that he owns--a house that just has electricity--in a rural part of Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  The local people make a living from farming, livestock-rearing and traditional crafts.

Santos is a farmer.  He grows lemons and mangoes, fruits that can be harvested quickly.  He sells what he grows in the markets around Piura and uses what he makes to support his family.  

Santos is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy fertilizers for preparing his land for planting.  The better the land, the better the crop and the more he will make when he sells it at market.  Santos wants to make a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is married, with no children yet. He has been carryng out this farming for the past six years. He learned this kind of farming from his cooperative.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est commerçant;depuis l'age de 5 ans il est dans le commerce avec son pére et ses 3 fréres dans le magasin de leur pére . Par la suite il a quitté le magasin pour fair son commerce personnel.

Cheikh est un célibataire sans enfant depuis 10 ans il fait son propre commerce; il veut persévérance dans le travail quotidienne en vue d'accroitre son commerce.Il achete des marchandises à dakar ou dans une ville du sud pour augmenter sa boutique parce que toujours sa demande supérieur à l'offre.

Cheikh veut avoir une grande boutique et construir sa propre maison avant de se marié.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a retailer. Since the age of five, he was in business with his father and his three brothers in their father's store. Later on he left that store to set up his own business. 

Cheikh is single with no children. For 10 years he has had his own business. He wants to persevere in his daily work so as to grow that business. He buys his merchandise at Dakar or in a city in the south to add to his stock since his customers' demand is always greater than he can supply. 

Cheikh wants to have a big store and build his own house before he marries.

loans.use: to buy coolers, glasses, thermoses, etc. wholesale to grow his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yvoty Ii Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Yvoty Ii se conformó en el 2011, con mucho esfuerzo se encuentran en el primer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
La Señora Florinda se dedica a la venta de pescado. Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que además ayuda el ingreso de su marido que es empleado en un negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, con lo cual podrá aumentar su stock y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women's committee named "Yvoty Ii" was formed in 2011.  With a great deal of effort they came to their first lending cycle, and they are united and committed to each other in the program.  In addition to the work that each one does, they also are developing activities together to collect funds with the goal of gaining some capital for the group.  Together they help each other to reach their objectives, which are to work to be able to support their families financially.

Señora Florinda works selling fish.  She tells us that through this business her family's financial situation has greatly improved.  She is also able to help out with the income of her husband, who is employed in a business.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, with which she can increase her stock and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy fish for later sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex, tiene la edad 26 de años, está en unión libre y vive con su hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar abarrotes para suministrar su bazar. El cuenta con el bazar desde varios años atrás y le ha ido bien con su pequeño proyecto a sacado su familia adelante y cumplido sus metas. En estos momentos es una temporada alta para la venta de utensilios en los bazares por lo cual el opto por el financiamiento y así surtir  aun mas su local y aumentar sus ventas. El tiene como meta sumistrar a sus clientes lo que necesiten y darle un mayor surtido de productos.  El quiere salir adelante día a día con su negocio e ir generando ganancias para el bienestar de su familia tratando de mejorar día con día su economía.   Es el tercer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alex, age 26, lives with his son and live-in partner, who are his biggest priorities. With this loan, he will purchase goods to restock his bazaar. He has owned this bazaar for several years, and it has been prosperous. With his small business, he has been able to help his family get ahead and to accomplish his goals. This is now the high season for utensil sales in bazaars, which is why he opted to take out a loan so that he can restock his business and boost sales. His goal is to supply his customers with what they need, and to offer them a wider selection of products. He wants his business to progress day by day so that he can generate the profits he needs for his family's well-being, trying to improve their daily finances. This is the third loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR. He had never had loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his bazaar.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Mr. Sour is a brave and polite man. He has spent most of his life to protect the country, working as a foot soldier. He sometimes takes missions and goes away from his lovely wife and children. He is married to a local farmer, Mrs. Phal (44 years old), and has 5 children. Most of his children are living with him in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. 

With the rainy season this year, Sour is concerned that he won’t be able to help his wife in farming because of the missions. Therefore, Sour is requesting for a loan from Kiva through HKL to hire laborers working on his farm. He says that he is thankful for all lenders who generously help his family that is in need.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Through patience and hard work, Melanie believes that she will improve their quality of life and give her family a better life. She is 33 years old and has two school-aged children. Despite being a widow, she is confident enough to continue sending her children to school. To earn a living, Melanie cooks and sells snacks in their village. 

She aims to strengthen her business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy sugar, milk, tamarind, flour, food coloring, and gelatin. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tamarind, flour, food coloring and gelatin

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 27 years old and has an embroidery business. She receives orders from community members and earns money after completing them. She does this work to financially support her husband. Her husband is a cobbler by profession; he makes shoes on order. He has business contacts with many shoe-selling shops in the market, and he completes their orders to earn income for the family.
 
Naseem is the mother of two daughters. Both of them are young and haven’t started their education. She is also a very good mother and a wife, taking care of her family by fulfilling their needs.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's shoe-making business. With the loan, he will buy material such as leather and nails and a shoe polisher for making shoes in larger quantities to earn maximum profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past nine years and is very confident that an investment will help him make his family’s financial life easier.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and a shoe polisher for a shoe-making business.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is 53 years old with 6 children aged 12 to 24. She has been running a business selling foodstuffs for 15 years. She would like a loan to buy more sugar, bread and rice to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and to save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, bread and rice to sell

loans.name: Sidoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sidoeun, a 35-year-old married mother with two children who are dependents and still in school.  She lives in a village in the Ponhea Krek district and grows cassava plants, supplementing her income by running a small business in the front yard selling biscuits, cakes etc and also raising pigs to gain additional income. She has been with this business for more than 1 year. With her current business, she earns less than 7 US dollars per day. Sidoeun leads of a group of four female members. 

This is Sidoeun's group’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow more cassava and earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Guido  con su primer credikiva compró materiales y reparó electrodomésticos,  que tenía pendiente por hacer, así respondió más rápidamente a su clientela y reinvirtió sus utilidades. Desde que recibió su credikiva pudo comprar de contado, adquirir descuentos que  trasladó al costo de sus productos e incrementó sus ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para producir bovinas y en repuestos para reparar muchos más abanicos, que es su especialidad. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda agregándole a ella su taller.  Guido envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: Gracias por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito a un bajo costo. “
texts.en: With his first Kiva loan, Guido purchased materials and repaired household appliances, responding more quickly to his customers, and he reinvested is profits. Since then he was able to pay in cash and receive discounts on his products, and increased his profits. He is currently requesting another Kiva loan, which he plans to invest in the purchase of materials to make coils and spare part to repair many more fans, which is his specialty. His goal in the future is to add a workshop to his home. Guido sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the opportunity to receive the loan at a low cost."

loans.use: purchase materials to make coils and spare parts to repair fans.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has two school going children. He is a tailor, a business that he has run for the last fifteen years. He employs three other people. 
John is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothing materials for the business.
His main challenges are some customers do not pay on time. He looks forward to opening other shops. He will use the extra income to meet this family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Leana Teresa

texts.es: Leana es una emprendedora que ha tenido éxito, con muchos esfuerzos  ha emprendido su propio negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos  y brindarle  una vida mejor para ellos. Leana ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en el cual nos expresa que la oportunidad que le han brindado le ha ayudado mucho su inventario ha aumentado y sus clientes también, ya que le ofrece variedad de productos. Leana está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio en la compra de gaseosas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos naturales entre otros productos que los clientes más demanda.
texts.en: Leana is an entrepreneur who’s had success. With a lot of work she has opened her own business to support her children and give them a better quality of life. Leana has already had a loan with Fundación León 2000. She says that the opportunity given to her has greatly helped her increase her inventory as well as her customer base since she offers them a variety of products. Leana is asking for a loan to be able to invest in the business with the purchase of soda, bread, biscuits, juices, natural juices and other products that her clients demand more of.

loans.use: to buy soda, bread, biscuits, juices, natural juices and other products

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, 58, lives with his wife, son, and grandson. He’s been growing cacao for most of his adult life - 30 years. “I like farmers. We have to work otherwise we don’t have anything. It’s hard, but it’s a farmer’s life,” says Felipe. 

Beside cacao, Felipe also receives income from corn sold at the Punta Gorda market, one hour down the road from San Jose, as well as beans and yams sold locally. He has used this money to invest in one of few solar panels in the village of San Jose, Toledo District, which is not connected to the grid due to poor road access. The solar panel is hooked to a battery and an inverter to provide electricity for stable phone use and light. What helped Felipe beat his peers in installing electricity in the home? “I never neglect anything,” he says, and lives by it. 

Felipe will use the loan to invest in cleaning his cacao plots. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to the trees for pruning and harvesting and is fundamental in preventing spread of mold in the rainy season. Cacao farms located in lowland tropical forest require cleaning every 3-4 months. 

An entrepreneur at heart, Felipe is all about diversifying his crops and is one of few farmers to grow fresh vegetables – cabbage, tomato and peppers among others on his farm. Why diversify? “Corn is just not tasty without the pepper sauce to go with it,” he told us in perfect English – his second language after Maya Mopan.

loans.use: To hire help to clean 4 acres of cacao farm.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 51-year-old married mother of seven children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Gulnaz runs a small boutique at home with the help of her daughter. She sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews and then sells the clothing at a profit in her community. The ladies in town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive designs and colors. Her husband covers all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings so she can collect a dowry for her daughter. 
She wants to increase the variety of clothing and has requested a loan to fulfill the demand. Gulnaz wishes for a bright future for her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ladies' garments for reselling from her boutique.

loans.name: Fruit Haie Vive Group

texts.fr: FRUIT HAIE VIVE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tossinmè Jeanne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Tossinmè Jeanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Tossinmè Jeanne est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tossinmè Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Tossinmè Jeanne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Tossinmè Jeanne vend des fruits de saison depuis une trentaine d'année, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Tossinmè Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Tossinmè Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe FRUIT HAIE VIVE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with a daughter who is in school. She also takes care of her mother. She sales soft drinks on a retail basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She makes crafts to get additional income. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings to buy  pineapples, watermelons, passion fruit, and oranges for making juice, and crates of soda. Her business challenges includes power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a better fridge to stock more drinks . She lives in rented house with access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy  pineapples, watermelons, passion fruit

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in 20', she is married with one little child. She has been running a food vending smallrestaurant for 2 years now. She works from 8 am day to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  
  
This will be Asia’ 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock for her restaurant and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. 

She used the profit to repay her loans and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant. She dreams of opening a new restaurant at the city centre.

 Asia will share this loan with her group "RUFIJI" which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.en:
Everyone knows me as dona Maria, I have had my business, located in the community of Chichicaste, for two years. Aside from selling second hand clothing, I also sell bananas and plantains. I am a widow, upon my husband's death, I had to begin working in order to support the needs of my family. I have two children who help me, but I always like to be independent and to work in order to save and to finish building my house.

Loan Use: Buying bundles of second hand clothing

Todos me conocen como doña Maria, tengo 2 años de tener mi negocios ubicado en la comunidad del Chichicaste, aparte de vender ropa clasificada de segunda, vendo bananos y platanos. Soy viuda al morir mi esposo tuve que comenzar a trabajar y suplir las necesidades de mi familia. Tengo dos hijos que me apoyan pero siempre me gusta ser independiente y trabajar para ahorrar y terminar de construir mi casa.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa clasificada.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin breeds  calves in a private farm shed. He runs this business for 4 years.
In he beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 to buy fodder, grass.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves or expand his business.
Emin is 27, married,has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga is a Deplaced Person from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married, and has two children. She started her family business in 1994, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $1900. Now she is willing to borrow $1200 to increase her variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipe is separated and has a 25-year-old son. His son helps him with the business, just as Felipe got started by inheriting it from his father; this is a family business, which is why Felipe knows it so well. He has 30 years experience with this business, which started out in his home and later moved to the trailer which he uses to this day to sell barbecue in tacos and by the kilo. With this work he has been able to support his family and help his son get ahead by giving him an education.

Felipe is asking for a loan in the amount of $750 to buy merchandise to keep his business stocked and stable, and in this way take care of his customers. He will repay the loan in 6 months. He and his son thank you for the support you give them as they continue with their business and improve their quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Felipe esta separado y tiene un hijo D. 25 años D. edad, su hijo le ayuda en el negocio y él empezó con el negocio heredándolo D. su padre, ya que es un negocio que viene D. familia, por ello es que Felipe conoce muy bien el mismo. Tiene 30 años con su negocio y empezó en su domicilio y posteriormente compro un remolque en el que actualmente se dedica a la venta D. barbacoa en tacos y por kilos, con este trabajo ha podido mantener a su familia y sacar adelante a su hijo dándole educación

Felipe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 750 para comprar mercancía y mantener surtido su negocio y estable, además así atender a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su hijo te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ye Marie

texts.en: Ye Marie S. is married with two children.  As an orphan, she could not continue with her education and was forced to marry at an early age.  At twenty-eight years old she runs a business of selling bowls.  She learned trading from her adoptive mother whom she is now taking care of.   With her previous loans, she diversified her business by including rubber bowls.  She would like to include other types of utensils such as spoons and saucepans to attract more customers.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Diversify types of kitchen utensils to increase business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is the mother of two small children who are enrolled in basic courses at the school in their city. She enjoys the support and company of her husband, who makes a living through the extraction of wood. It is for this reason that Nelly decided to begin selling the wood to increase their profits and to avoid the loss of money that happens when they use third party sellers. With the intention of starting her work soon, Nelly set up a small space in her home to keep the wood her loving husband obtains through his sacrifices safe for its later marketing. Before summer starts (along with the scarcity of wood extraction), they have to increase the quantity that they have in their small warehouse, and to be able to carry out their goal, they need the help of each one of you. With the profits that they receive from the sales of their products, they hope to open a small bakery so they can consolidate their income and increase the quality of life of their children. Let's help this family make their dreams a reality and remove the obstacles so they can have peace and happiness in their hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly es madre de dos pequeños niños que se encuentran aún cursando estudios básicos en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, goza del apoyo y compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la extracción de madera; es por esta razón que ella decidió incursionar en la venta de estos productos para incrementar sus ganancias y evitar la pérdida de dinero cuando recurre a las personas intermediarias.Con el propósito de iniciar pronto con su labor acondicionó un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio con el objetivo de mantener a buen recaudo el sacrificio de su querido esposo para su posterior comercialización Antes de que se inicie la temporada de verano en la que escasea la extracción de madera, requiere acrecentar la cantidad que posee en su pequeño almacén y para llevar a cabo su propósito requiere de la ayuda de cada uno de ustedes.Así mismo con las ganancias que reciban por la venta de sus productos desean aperturar una pequeña panadería para que puedan consolidar sus ingresos e incrementar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.Hagamos que esta familia convierta sus sueños en realidad y extraiga los obstáculos para sembrar paz y alegría en sus corazones.

loans.use: Purchase and supply of wood to increase their sales

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa belongs to the Corazon de Jesus (Jesus Heart) community bank. Her business is located in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She makes a living selling general merchandise, fruits and fresh vegetables; she also makes and sells snacks, like pastries made from yucca starch and sweets made with wheat and corn flour, that are in much demand from her customers. She's been working at the business for 20 years. During all that time, too, she's been selling local drink favorites such as "chicha de maiz" (a corn-based liquor) and "mazato"

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (500 Peruvian soles or about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, Luisa will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, candy, eggs, cookies, soap, and detergent.

Luisa, 58, is married and has 3 children, the oldest of whom is independent. The second, a boy, studies at the university in Lima and the youngest is still in a local school. Luisa is very hard-working and persistent. She's driven by the satisfaction of being able to help with household expenses and support her husband when something unforeseen affects the family.

Translated by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Corazón de Jesús, tiene ubicado su negocio en la Localidad de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras frescas; además complementa su negocio con la producción de bocaditos como son las rosquitas de almidón de yuca y otros dulce de harina de trigo y maíz, que son muy requeridos por sus clientes; se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de bebidas regionales como la chicha de maíz y el mazato (bebidas de la zona).

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más productos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 saco de cada producto), muchas golosinas en paquetes (08 paquetes de diferentes productos), huevos en jabas (02 casilleros), galletas (02 cajas, entre dulces y saladas), jabones (1/2 caja de cada marca), detergentes de diferentes marcas.

Ella está casada, tiene 58 años y tiene 03 hijos, la mayor ya es independiente, el segundo es varón y estudia en la universidad en la ciudad de Lima, la ultima aun está en la escuela. La señora Luisa se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y empeñosa en sus actividades, lo que le impulsa es la satisfacción de poder contribuir en los gastos de su hogar y ser un respaldo para su esposo cuando se presente algún imprevisto en la familia.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio is 34 years old. He lives with his partner Lorenza (32 years old). They have two sons, 10 and 7 years, respectively, and both children are still in elementary school.

Due to the fact that he came from a very poor family, he was unable to complete his studies and only completed his studies through 6th grade.

Eulalio is automotive electrician, and says that he began working as an assistant from the time he was 12 years old, until he managed to become independent at the age of 18 years, when he constructed his own shop in a rented space.

He states that he's doing very well in his business, and has had enough clientele and work throughout the year.

He is now in need of a loan to make improvements in his current space (he wants to build a small shed) and purchase more tools that are necessary in his daily tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalio tiene 34 años, vive en pareja con Lorenza de 32 años y tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años respectivamente. Ambos niños están estudiando aún en la primaria.

Debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde, no pudo terminar sus estudios, llegando a completar solamente hasta el 6to. Grado de la educación primaria.

Eulalio es electricista de automóviles; comenta que comenzó a trabajar como ayudante desde los 12 años hasta que logró independizarse a la edad de 18 años montando su propio taller en un local alquilado.

Afirma que le va muy bien en su negocio, cuenta con bastante clientela y tiene trabajo durante todo el año.

Necesita un préstamo para realizar mejoras en su local (construcción de un pequeño tinglado) y compra de más herramientas que les son indispensables en su tarea diaria.

loans.use: To build a shed and purchase tools. (construcción de un tinglado y compra de herramientas)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Veronika M.. She is married with three children, ages 7, 14, and 20. In 2002 Veronika established a grain business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock of rice, maize, and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Asmanah

texts.en: Asmanah is 38 years old and married to S. B., who no longer has a job. To help her husband cover their family's expenses, she has gone into business working out of her home as a seamstress. She earns about $20 a week and generates enough profit to pay their bills. Asmanah has requested a loan of $100 to buy dress-making supplies and a sewing machine. She is a member of MBK and will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy dress-making supplies and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
