Señora Jeny Sánchez Flowers is an associate of the “Picota” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region , Province of Picota, district of Picota. Her business is located in the settlement of Nueva Unión, 15km from Picota in the north central part of Peru, in which she sells food daily.

The idea to sell food arose because of the lack of this type of business in the community in which she lives. This service was always needed by the settlers and visitors. It started as something very small but now has grown.

With the loan of 800 soles, to be repaid in full in 6 months, she will buy daily supplies such as sugar, rice in bags, noodles in packages, and meat from chickens, hogs and other animals in order to offer a varied menu to her patrons. She will also buy carbonated beverages in different sizes that are greatly appreciated in the community.

Jeny is a woman of 38 years. She is active and hard-working but with the humility that characterizes her, she is doing well. In this manner she contributes to the progress of her community that gave her the opportunity to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Jeny Sánchez F., es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el caserío de Nueva Unión a 15km de Picota en el Jr: Perú s/n en el que diariamente vende comida.

La idea de vender comida surgió ante la falta de este tipo de negocio en la comunidad en la que vive, era un servicio siempre requerido por los propios pobladores y visitante, se inicio como algo muy pequeño pero ahora ha crecido .

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses lo empleara para comprar los insumos del diario como azúcar, arroz en sacos, fideos en paquetes, carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y así brindar un menú variado a sus pensionistas. También comprará bebidas gasificadas en tamaños diferentes que tiene gran de manda en la comunidad.

Jeny, es una mujer de 38 años, activa, trabajadora que con la humildad que la caracteriza esta saliendo adelante, y de esta manera contribuir al progreso de su comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, meat, carbonated beverages and other supplies for sale in her food store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel J., a teacher, is 45 years old and the single mother of a 16-year old girl. They live in the Manuel Fernandez neighborhood. Her aim is to give her only daughter a brighter future, providing for her a quality education so she can survive well throughout life. Mrs. Maribel seeks a loan to build a porch and thus provide more security for her home since it is empty all day long while she works and her daughter is at school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La maestra Maribel J. de 45 años es madre soltera de una jovencita de 16 años quien reside en el barrio Manuel Fernandez quien tiene como objetivo en la vida darle a su unica hija un mejor futuro, dandole la mejor educacion para que pueda defenderse en la vida. Doña Maribel solicita el prestamo para construir un porche y darle seguridad a su hogar ya que permanece solo todo el dia mientras rtrabaja y su hija anda en clases.

loans.use: To build a porch on the home for added security.

loans.name: Crobéshi

texts.fr:
Born in 1957 in Ekpui, in Vo prefecture, Crobéshi A. is married, the mother of four children, and is responsible for another child. She sells fruit in her district. Since her husband was admitted into retirement, the small pension is no longer enough to cover family needs. You see, Ms. A. sees herself needing to strengthen her business to increase family income. This is why she struggles each day to feed her children. But the burden of household expenses is decimating to all the effort she puts forth.

She therefore wants to improve her business by delivering fruit wholesale to retailers in Lomé. To do so, she is requesting a loan to be able to stock up in the villages where fruit abounds, for reselling. This will increase her bottom line and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1957 à Ekpui dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Crobéshi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et un autre enfant à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse de fruits dans son quartier. Depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, la petite pension ne suffit plus pour assumer les besoins de la famille. Du coup, Madame A. se voit dans l’obligation de renforcer son activité pour augmenter le revenu familial. C’est ainsi qu’elle se bat au quotidien pour pouvoir nourrir ses enfants. Mais le poids des charges du ménage annihile tous ces efforts qu’elle fournit.

Elle veut alors améliorer son commerce en livrant des fruits en gros aux détaillants de Lomé. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir s’approvisionner dans les villages où les fruits abondent et revendre. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et l’aidera à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in fruit

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Coming from the northern region of Benin, Mrs. Abiba A. was born around 1971 in Bassila in Donga County. She is the mother of two daughters who live in Bassila with their polygamous father. Mrs. Abiba A. lives in a slum in Cotonou where she sells groceries which allows her to support herself. She previously received a loan of US$ 300 and is now requesting a third loan in the amount of $ 375 to bolster her businesss.Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerOriginaire de la région nord du BENIN, dame A. Abiba est née vers 1971 à Bassila, dans le département de la DONGA. Elle est mère de deux filles qui vivent à Bassila avec leur père polygame. Dame A. Abiba vit dans un bidonville de Cotonou où elle vend des produits vivriers qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge. Elle avait bénéficié d'un crédit de 130000F CFA et vient solliciter un troisième prêt de 150000F CFA pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of rice, and 10 liters of vegetable oilAchat de 3 sacs de maïs, de 2 sacs de riz et de 10 litres d'huile végétale.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana, a member of the Brisas Village Bank, is a 49-year-old mother of seven children. She and her husband make traditional breads such as chapla and wawa (breads made of oat flour shaped like babies or horses) during the Todo Santos celebrations. Cipriana sells these breads by cart in the Santa Clara market. She also has a car which her spouse uses for their taxi business in the city of Ayacucho. Cipriana now needs a loan of $575 to invest in flour, sugar, yeast and salt for her business.

Ciipriana’s dreams are to construct her house, improve her business, and provide her children with a good education so that they become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in flour, sugar, yeast and salt.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort N. is 32 years. She is married with three kids. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She has been trading in used clothes and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past five years.

She requests the loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of used clothes and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Comfort is a member of a community group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of used clothes and plastics.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
This is Emiliana M. who is 33 years old. She is married with three children between 8 and 19. She sells soft drinks such as sodas and drinking water. Neighbors and people who are passing through the place are her main customers. She started this business in 2007.

Emiliana is currently earning a monthly profit of US$ 100 from this business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and pure drinking water. In future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future. .

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Silvia Rosario

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa. Silvia es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo de casi 3 años está en el nido. Silvia vende limones en el mercado de la Ciudad, reparte por bolsas, también vende manís y habitas desde hace 4 años Silvia trabaja con su esposo ,ellos compran en Piura su mercadería y la venden en Lima en la Av. San Juan por Pista Nueva.

Silvia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de más mercadería . Silvia recibe préstamos desde hace 2 años , ahora tiene un capital para invertir y la vez también ahorra. Silvia sueña con tener su casa propia y también su propio local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa Communal Bank. She is a common law wife and is 24 years old with one child who's almost three and is still in the "nest."

Silvia sells bags of limes in the city's market; she also sells peanuts and lima beans. For the past four years Silvia has worked with her husband. They buy their merchandise in Piura and sell it in Lima on San Juan Avenue near Pista Nueva.

Silvia needs a loan for 2,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. She has received loans for the past two years and now has capital to invest and she also saves.

Silvia dreams of owning her own home and also her own locale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. G. S. habita en la comunidad de La Peña-Tecolostote junto a su mamá y 3 hermanos , como hijo mayor asume la responsabilidad de la familia, ya que su papá por su edad se ve incapacitado, sus hermanos y el se dedican a la siembra de arroz, por esfuerzo propio tienen establecidas 6 mzs de arroz secano; durante su cosecha se ven obligados a vender su produccion en granza a bajo precio. El Sr. G. es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza a traves de la cual tiene la oportunidad de participar en la construccion de un trillo de propiedad asociativa, para lo cual requiere de un financiamiento de C$.15,000.00, de esta manera considera que estara realizando su sueño de ser socio de esta futura empresa productiva en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. G. S. lives in the La Peña-Tecolostote community with his mother and 3 siblings. As the oldest son he assumes the responsibility for the family, as his father is incapacitated due to his age. His siblings and he grow rice, and through their efforts have established 6 blocks of rice for drying. During the harvest they are obligated to sell their harvest at low prices. Mr. Gonzales is a member of the agricultural cooperative “La Esperanza” (Hope) through which he has the opportunity to participate in the construction of a threshing machine owned by the cooperative, and requires a financing of C$.15,000.00 and in this way realize the dream of being a member of this productive business in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Support 30% of the construction of a rice thrushing machine

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy T., 29, is married and lives with her two young children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband, Ken Chanthy, pictured above, works in construction and operates a mototaxi making US$5 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have made this a problematic economic year for many Cambodians, Tuy T. included. In light of these economic challenges, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for use as a taxi

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana tiene 25 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de joyería desde hace 8 años para solventar sus gastos económicos, siempre ha trabajado, desde que terminó los estudios secundarios, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir con estudios superiores, pero gracias a su gran esfuerzo logró consolidar su negocio, en el cual ahora le va muy bien. A Yobana le gusta su trabajo, ya que piensa que con él ayuda a las mujeres a mejorar su apariencia y que se sientan bien consigo mismas, así consiguió muchas amigas en este lapso, las cuales son ahora sus clientas más fieles. Lo difícil de su trabajo son los viajes a diferentes ciudades para adquirir las joyas que vende. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a otras ciudades a comprar más mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yobana is 25 years old, lives alone, and is single. She has sold jewelry for 8 years to pay for her expenses. She has worked ever since finishing high school because she did not have the opportunity to continue with higher education. With hard work, she was able to build up her business, and it is going very well for her. Yobana likes her work because she believes that it helps women improve their appearance and feel good about themselves. She has made many friends through the years who are now her most loyal customers. The difficult part of her work is the travel to different cities to get jewelry to sell. This is her eighth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with payments. With the money she is requesting, she will travel to other cities to buy more merchandise and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Grupo El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo   El Progreso, que cuenta con  tres integrantes: Doña Ileana del Socorro S. G., Marisela del Socorro E. G. y Don José Adrián A. R., están ubicados en el Municipio de Diriomo, todos ellos vecinos.
Doña Ileana del Socorro de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos en su comunidad, vendiendo de contado y crédito en menor grado, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad porque considera que es un producto que se vende bastante y que las mujeres siempre necesitan a toda edad, además no es muy cansado una vez que ya tiene su clientela, ofrece productos en su casa y ambulante.
El crédito lo utiliza para comprar perfumes, desodorantes, bolsos de estudiante y todo en el ramo de cosméticos. Ella es viuda y vive acompañada de su nieto de 19 años que decidió vivir con ella, es estudiante y ella le apoya con sus gastos. Sus sueños de ella es ver graduado a su nieto en la carrera de Contabilidad y tener siempre su sustento.
texts.en:
This group is called The Progress, and it includes three members: Mrs. Ileana del Socorro S. G., Marisela del Socorro E. G. and Mr. José Adrián A. R., who live in the municipality of Diriomo. All of them are neighbors. Mrs. Ileana del Socorro is 50 years old and sells cosmetics in her community. She sells her products for cash and on credit to a lower degree. She has spent 2 years pursuing this activity because she considers this product to be one that sells very well and one that women of all ages will always need. Also, it is not very tiring. Once she has a client, she offers her products in her house and by walking. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, deodorants, student bags, and a whole range of cosmetics. She is a widow and lives with her nineteen-year-old grandson, who decided to live with her. He is a student, and she supports him with his expenses. Her dreams are to see her grandson graduate into an accounting career and to always have sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest more capital into her business so that she can satisfy her clients

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna F., a 57 year old widow with two children, owns a rice field. Previously, she worked in the Middle East where she bought a small parcel of land. Now, in the Philippines, she would like to expand her business. Her harvest serves both for family usage and business sales.  She sells rice to traders in their village and the profit that she receives from her harvest goes to pay for her family's daily expenses, her children's college fees, and their other needs.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticide. She will also buy quality seeds for her farm. Myrna is also thinking of venturing into other business. Aside from farming, she is interested in trying other possible income areas to support her family's needs.

CEVI provides clients like Myrna not only credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda N. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has two daughters and a son who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Kwahu Da in the Eastern region of Ghana. Linda’s husband is a food crop farmer. She also runs a table-top grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for two years now.

Linda sells items such as "gari", rice, groundnuts, tins of tomatoes, milk, sugar, etc. Linda procures her goods from wholesalers in the big towns around such as Nkawkaw. She is seeking a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her kids' education. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda T., 56 years old, is married and blessed with nine children, six of them married. A member in good standing of Paglaum MPC since 2004, her source of income comes from pottery-making. Her project started only thanks to her experience from her neighbors. 

Short of capital to start her pottery business, she accessed a loan in the amount of  PHP 3,000 from Paglaum. The business is doing well and now she needs a bigger amount to buy some stocks of clay, and for cost of labor and transportation expenses. Her hopes and aspirations are to generate employment in the future and send all her children to college.

loans.use: To buy clay and pay labor  and transport expenses

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Mahbubahon

texts.ru: Махбубахон занимается продажей парфюмерии и декоративной косметики на рынке "Панчшанбе". Она арендует магазин на втором этаже рынка. Товар ей поставляют разные фирмы: Nivea, Dove, и другие. Еще она заказывает продукцию от косметических компаний Oriflame, Avon и Faberlic. За заказы фирмы требуют предоплату. Поэтому Махбубахон хочет взять кредит, чтобы оплатить за последнюю партию заказа от Oriflame. Махбубахон сотрудничает с нами уже 2 года. В будущем, когда у нее расширится бизнес, она планирует открыть свой фирменный магазин.
texts.en:
Mahbubahon's business is selling perfume and cosmetics at the "Panshanbe" market. She rents a store on the second floor of the market, where she sells different brands of products, including Nivea, Dove, Oriflame, Avon and Faberlic. To order products from these companies, she needs to pay in advance. For this reason, Mahbubahon is applying for a loan to pay for her most recent order from Oriflame. Mahbubahon has been an MLF client for two years. As her business develops and expands in the future, she plans to open her own name-brand store.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: 02-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh N. Thị is a 44 year old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Minh is the group leader of a 7 member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Hải (16.02.02).

Minh is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Minh owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Minh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 900.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Minh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị Oa is a 46 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. Thị Lập is a 46 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. Thị Quy is a 62 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Lê Thị Thắm is a 26 year old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

5.  Lê Thị Bình is a 37 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  N. Thị Xuân is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6.000.000 VND with a 20 month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Minh N. Thị (22) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Minh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Hải (16.02.02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Minh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Minh kiếm được khoảng 900.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Minh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Minh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lê Thị Oa (21) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
2.  N. Thị Lập (23) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
3.  N. Thị Quy (26) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
4.  Lê Thị Thắm (60) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
5.  Lê Thị Bình (99) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
6.  N. Thị Xuân (6) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.
*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Osato

texts.en: Osato is 32 years-old and married with 2 children. He sells cows to support his family. He is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 which he will use to purchase more cows to sell. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden C. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Eden is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice in the village. She sells it per sack or even by kilos; sometimes she offers credit payable at the end of the month. Eden has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP (US$300), which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan Eden has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R. is from the town of Panaon. She is 56 years old. Myrna is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ammabelle

texts.en:
Ammabelle F. is from the village of San Simon in Cagayan De Oro. She is 34 years old. Ammabelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ammabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells many different products to the people in the local community. Ammabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ammabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ammabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ammabelle is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Ammabelle's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jodi Fe

texts.en:
Jodi Fe C. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 23 years old. Jodi Fe is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jodi Fe owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jodi Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jodi Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jodi Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jodi Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jodi Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On C., 27 years old, is married to Mr. So Sann, age 29, and they live with their two children in their medium-sized family home in Siem Reap Province. This couple earns a living by buying and selling used goods in the village and typically makes their current income of US$ 6 per day to help alleviate the destitution of their family’s living conditions.

The family own and always use their old bicycle to support their business. On C. will be using her loan to purchase a used motorcycle to be used instead of her old bicycle. With the motorcycle as transportation, she will be able to be faster.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo Group

texts.en:
Argelia P. is an associate of Esperanza International currently looking to take out her first loan. She lives in a modest home with cement walls and a cement ceiling in Santiago, a city in the northwest region of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are unreliable. She lives with her two children, ages 14 and 18.
Argelina runs a bakery out of her home, a trade for which she has received training, and hopes to expand it by purchasing more merchandise. Her bakery will become the family's main source of income since currently they do not have a regular source of income. She expects her family to be much better off after completing this loan and looks forward to ensuring a better education for her kids and improved nourisment for her family. She is very grateful to the donors for helping her achieve this goal.

loans.use: Bakery items

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte O. cooks and sells red, red (a soup or stew of mashed beans).  She boils beans and fries plantain to sell at Elmina.  Charlotte has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Charlotte has been selling red, red since 2007.  Her income helps pay the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain, beans and oil to use in her cooking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more plantain, beans and oil for cooking.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa and her husband Larry P. are blessed with two children namely; Elmalyn- 17 years of age, 2nd year college student, and Crisel Joy- 16 years of age, 4th year high school student. They are living at the area of San Francisco in Alicia, a rural and plain area, were people have their own unique ways in dealing with their business.
She operates a retail store for almost 12 years now, her weekly net income is PHP 800.00. At present she decided to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000.00 to purchase grocery items and some beverages to sell in her small general store. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible. She said that "happiness and blessings will come, if you know how to share your blessings". That's why she is very friendly to her customers and she is always willing to extend help to them especially in times of trials.

loans.use: Additional Capital to purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Elia M. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva para cama, desodorantes, camisas y blusas.
quiere comprar cosmeticos para vender en la epoca de navidad.
a parte de vender su ropa, los fines de semana hace nacatamales por encargo, el viernes en la noche empieza a preparar los ingredientes para hacer los nacatamales los cuales el sabado temprano ya los tiene listos para venderlos. dicho alimento se vende bastante ya que es muy rico de sabor, un nacatamal se puede comer en los tres tiempos de comida. muchas personas prefieren comerlo de desayuno.
con estos negocios ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y su hogar, ella desea el credito para invertirlo en ropa para la epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Elia M. is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the Sagastume housing development in the city of Tegucigalpa. She has her own business in which she sells bed linen, deodorant, shirts and blouses. She would like to purchase cosmetics in order to sell them during the Christmas season. Aside from selling clothing, she also makes nacatamales—Central American tamales—by special order on weekends. She starts preparing the ingredients for the nacatamales on Friday night, then has them ready by early Saturday morning to sell them. This dish is very popular because it is so delicious and can be eaten throughout the day. However, many people prefer to eat nacatamales for breakfast. With these two businesses, she has managed to support her household. She would like this loan in order to invest it in purchasing clothes for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed linen, deodorant, footwear, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores; vive junto a su esposa en el caserío Mocape, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, empezó a trabajar como peón agrícola y poco a poco, con sus ahorros y esfuerzo pudo adquirir un terreno agrícola donde actualmente siembra maracuyá, mango y tamarindo en asociación con otros agricultores de la zona.

Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (carneros, chanchos, cabritos), con estas actividades ellos han salido adelante desde que empezaron a vivir juntos.

El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la siembra y mantenimiento de 500 nuevos plantones de maracuyá con los que piensa ampliar su negocio.

Juan es responsable y muy trabajador, en la asociación en donde siembra todos los agricultores se brindan apoyo cuando lo necesitan. Su más grande anhelo es ver terminado un proyecto hidroenergético en la zona que le permita regar su cultivo con mayor facilidad ya que ahora riegan sus arboles frutales extrayendo agua de pozos subterraneos.
texts.en:
Juan, 63, is married and has four grown children. He lives with his wife in the Mocape settlement, which is located in the Olmos district, Lambayeque province. This is two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been farming for 20 years. He started working as a field worker. Little by little, with his savings and much effort, he was able to get a piece of farming land. That is where he currently plants passion fruit, mangos, and tamarinds in association with other farmers in the area. His wife raises small animals (sheep, pigs, goats). With these activities they have gotten ahead since they started living together. He finds himself, for the first time, asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN. He will invest in the planting and maintenance of 500 new passion fruit plants, which will expand his business. Juan is responsible and very hard-working. In the group where he plants, all of the farmers offer support when necessary. His biggest goal is to see the hydroenergetic project in the area finished. This allows for watering the crops with greater ease. Now they water the fruit trees by taking water from underground wells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and maintenance of 500 passion fruit plants

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.es:
La señora Gioconda Gutiérrez con muchos esfuerzos logro poner una pulpería  lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio, el trabaja en una ferretería, procreo cinco hijos de los cuales dos trabajan y tres cursan sus estudios. Tiene 44 años de edad, las dificultades que se le presento es que comenzó a dar crédito y mucha gente no le pago lo que causo quedar con poco en inventario, como alternativa junto con su cuñada 
Pusieron una venta de tortilla lo cual palmean día a día para lograr ingresos y alimentar a su familia, ya que son mujeres emprendedora e independientes. Doña Gioconda desea recoger pronto dinero y poder aumentar productos  ala pulpería. Con este préstamo comprara paca de ropa para vender y atraer a la clientela, ya que mucha gente compra lo mas barato por la crisis del desempleo y por que todo esta mas caro, y no alcanza. Contenta por el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado lo cual espera lograr superar este ciclo en su vida.
texts.en:
With much effort, Gioconda Gutiérrez managed to start a grocery business. Her startup capital came from her husband who works in a hardware store. Gioconda is 44 years old. She and her husband have five children; two are working and three are in school.

The grocery business encountered problems because they extended credit to their customers and many were unable to pay. This left the business with a shortage of inventory. As an alternative source of income, Gioconda then started a tortilla business with her sister-in-law. They pat out tortillas day after day to make an income and feed their families. They are independent and ambitious women.

Gioconda needs this loan to increase the products in her store. She plans to buy a bundle of used clothing to sell. This will attract customers, who are looking for the lowest price because, with the current unemployment crisis and high prices, many are having trouble making ends meet.

Gioconda is pleased with the support given by Afodenic. She hopes this will help her get through this difficult time in her life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bundle of used clothing

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
Celyn C. is from the village of Zone 1 B, Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 26 years old. Celyn is single. To make a living, Celyn runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Celyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Celyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Celyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Celyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Moruf

texts.en: Moruf is 30 years old and married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells medicine to support the family. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He sells phone accessories at retail prices to his customers to make a living. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Julia Leonor

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor presente y futuro para sus familias  y con su trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco, la Estancia es una comunidad del cantón Paute éste lugar se caracteriza por su gran productividad de flores y frutas como  manzanas, duraznos, claudias, etc. y su belleza sin igual. 

 Julia R. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia  incentivada por sus compañeras formó parte del banco, ella es madre soltera de cinco hijos, su hijos mayores trabajan y aportan para los gastos de la casa, a sus 42 años se siente tranquila porque tienen su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos pero también a  criar pollos y cuyes que los vende en la organización campesina una comunidad de su sector.

 Este es su quinto ciclo en la fundación y los prestamos le han beneficiado para incrementar su negocio poco a poco y con el crédito que estan por entregarle va a  comprar más  cuyes y hierba para alimentarlos.

Su sueño es superarse cada día  más  junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Estancia” was formed by a group of women who seek both a better present and future for their families. They work daily to reach this goal a little bit at a time. The community of La Estancia is in the Paute region and is known for its high production of flowers and fruits, such as apples, peaches, and plums, as well as its natural beauty.

Julia R. is a member “La Estancia” Communal Bank and was convinced by the other members to join. She is a single mother with five children. Her older children work and contribute toward the household expenses. At 42 years of age, Julia feels at peace because she has her own home.

Julia engages in her household chores, but she also raises chickens and guinea pigs to sell at a farming cooperative in her community. This is her fifth loan cycle with the Foundation. Her previous loans have helped her to gradually grow her business. She will use this loan to purchase more guinea pigs and the grasses needed to feed them. Her dream is to improve each day along with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of living of Anita, 61 years old. She manages a rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. She has eight children in the family to support and needs financial support for her business.

Anita joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requests a loan of Php 15,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs. This way the basic needs of her family will be met.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad C. is from the village of  Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Trinidad is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Trinidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Trinidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 55-year-old woman and the mother of five children who are between the ages of 20 and 32 years.

To make a living, Dorcas sells frozen food like fish and chicken and also sells sarongs in Lagos State. She opens her shop every day of the week. Her greatest joy is been able to support and assist her husband, who is a carpenter, financially and ensure that the family’s needs are met. She hopes to expand her business in future.

Dorcas is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Las Cometas Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue sacada en la papelería de Mireya Hernández Gómez, es integrante del grupo Las Cometas que está ubicado en la comunidad de Tepeji del Río en el estado de Hidalgo de México.   Ella se dedica a la papelería y novedades que inició hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y hacer de esta forma más atractivo su negocio. Sus clientes piensan que da un buen servicio y siempre trata de tener algo nuevo aunque sea pequeño por que en realidad le faltan aún muchas cosas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente emocionada y feliz.  Tiene 32 años, estudió hasta el 6to  año de primaria,  tiene 3  hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón).  Quiere este crédito para surtir su papelería y tener variedad. de artículos.   También  tiene la esperanza de tener más surtida su papelería para poder agrandar su negocio.

María Mayel Sánchez Pérez es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta el 3er año de preparatoria,  tiene 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón).  Ella es estilista  inició hace 2 años una estética. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes, líquidos y demás materiales para mejorar el servicio que da a sus clientes. 

El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes, los otros integrantes son:

•	Pérez Gómez Yadira (calzado)
•	Pérez M. Felipa Elvira (colchas)
•	Fernández Quiñones Mará Edith (calzado)
•	Mejía B. Abelina (pulseras de fantasía)
•	Sánchez Pérez Araceli (estilista)
•	B. C. Raquel (bisutería)
•	Gómez R. Alejandra (antojitos mexicanos)
•	Méndez Gómez Antonia Bertha (conejos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Mireya Hernández Gómez’s stationery shop. She is a member of the “Las Cometas” (Comets) group, which is in Tepeji del Rio, in the state of Hidalgo, México. She has sold stationery items and novelties for about a year now. She is asking for funds to buy more stock items so that her store will be more attractive. Her customers believe that she provides good service and she always strives to have new items to offer, even if just a trifle; she still needs lots of products. At this moment, she is happy and thrilled. She is 32 years old, finished 6th grade and has three children (2 girls and 1 boy). She wants the funding to stock her store and have a variety of items available. She hopes to expand her stock so that her store business will grow. María Mayel Sánchez Pérez is the group president. She is 26 years old, finished high school and has two children (a boy and a girl). She is a hair stylist and opened her beauty shop 2 years ago. She is asking for funds to buy hair dyes, liquids and other supplies to improve customer service. The group is made up of 10 members. The others are: • Pérez Gómez Yadira (shoes) • Pérez M. Felipa Elvira (bedspreads) • Fernández Quiñones Mará Edith (shoes) • Mejía B. Abelina (costume bracelets) • Sánchez Pérez Araceli (hair stylist) • B. C. Raquel (notions) • Gómez R. Alejandra (Mexican fast-food snacks) • Méndez Gómez Antonia Bertha (rabbits)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and make her store more attractive.

location.town: Tepeji del Río, Estado de Hidalgo

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Pour le cinquième sous groupe (Femmes Commerçante N°5), il est composé de :
-	Madame Yacine S.. Cette femme est la présidente de ce sous groupe, elle est née en 1962. Elle vend au marché depuis 17 ans des poissons séchés, de l’huile de palme et des tissus. Madame Yacine S. est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant âgé de 26 ans. Elle s'active, dit-elle, pour combattre l'oisiveté et régler ses besoins et ceux familiaux. Avec ce crédit, elle compte compléter son budget d'approvisionnement.
-	Madame Mbery  D. qui place divers produits (arachide….) à ses clients qui sont au marché. Elle est dans cette activité depuis 5 ans.
-	Madame Ngousane N.  qui s’active depuis 4 ans dans la vente de fruits en face de l’hôpital régional de Thiès
-	Madame Amy T. vendeuse de niébé (haricot local), du mil et de l’arachide chez elle depuis 4 ans
-	Et Madame Amy D.  qui loue des chaises et bâches pendant des cérémonies. Elle compte  avec sa part du prêt augmenter  son actif en quantité en achetant d’autres chaises

loans.use: strengthen their business

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
María Maribel tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en el caserío Tepo del distrito de Mochumí, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que la zona queda ubicada lejos del pueblo mas cercano y no tienen acceso rápido a productos de uso diario. María utiliza los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más produtos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de la zona y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan seguir adelante. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una joven emprendedora y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para poder ayudar a sus padres a obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Maria Maribel is 24 years old, single, and lives in the Tepo housing development, Mochumi district. This is in an agricultural area, in the Lambayeque province, located one hour from Chiclayo. For six years, she has sold basic provisions and groceries in a small store located in a room of her house. Her business has been well received, since this area is a long way from the closest town, and there is no easy access to items that people use daily. Maria uses the income from this activity to cover personal expenses and help the family with financial support. Maria would like to expand her business by purchasing more basic provisions, groceries, and beverages, to satisfy demand in the area, enjoy higher earnings, and get ahead. For this reason she is making this first-time request to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 new soles. Maria is a young, enterprising, hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to continue to grow her business and help her parents enjoy a better standard of living. She is well known in her community, and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items to expand her store

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid M. A., tiene la edad de 53 años, está divorciada, y no tiene hijos. Vive sola. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado para engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Ingrid tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Ingrid M. A. is 53 years old. She is divorced with no children and lives alone. The loan she is applying for will be used to purchase cattle and feed. She hopes to maintain her animals better and thus make higher profits when she sells them. She also hopes to increase the number of animals and in order to keep them in better condition she has an ideal space to raise and maintain her cattle. This is the first time that she will receive a loan from FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the terms that they offered. Mrs. Ingrid has raised cattle for many years. She hopes that in the future she will have a better quality of life, more economic stability, and the ability to keep growing as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Marsel

texts.es: Marsel, de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora, y vive en su casa propia,  junto con su esposo y  sus 2 hijos pequeños.Con mucha perseverancia, sube y baja los cerros empinados de su distrito, ofreciendo diversas prendas, pues se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, que son muy solicitadas por sus amistades y conocidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es ser cumplida en la entrega de sus pedidos, sólo que a veces no cuenta con dinero suficiente para atender todos sus pedidos, perdiendo así, buenos clientes. Lleva 3 años en esta labor, y  es muy conocida por  la zona donde vive. Con este negocio, y junto al esfuerzo de su esposo, han construido su casa,  y en la actualidad  planean  contar con electricidad,  pues  piensa mejorar  la condición de vida de su familia.Es el primer crédito de  Marsel con MFP, y  se compromete a pagar oportunamente sus cuotas pues esta muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todos los integrantes  trabajan responsablemente.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  la compra de mercadería, además pagará la  instalación de  una caja eléctrica en su casa, pues necesita contar con este  servicio básico en su hogar.
texts.en:
Marsel is 34 years old and a hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. With great perseverance, she travels up and down the steep hills in her district selling various types of clothing that are requested by friends and acquaintances. What she enjoys most about her job is fulfilling and delivering her orders, but sometimes she does not have enough money to complete all of them. As a result, she has lost good customers. Marsel has been in business for three years and is well-known in the area where she lives. With her income, together with that of her husband, she was able to build a house and is now looking forward to receiving electricity which will help improve her family’s living conditions.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marsel promises to submit her payments promptly because she is happy with the work of her group. All of the members work responsibly. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of merchandise. Marsel will also pay for the installation of an electrical box in her house, which she needs in order to receive electricity service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & pay for the installation of an electrical box in her house

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima N. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Merima is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merima runs a general store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Merima has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 9,100 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2007, Merima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merima is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Merima from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking young farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He is 33 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 1½ and 6. Two of his children attend school.

Richard has been farming for 5 years and employs one farmhand. His products are bananas, tea, maize, beans and millet, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a spare parts shop (pictured above). His major challenges in farming have been the fluctuation in the prices of his products and crop diseases which affect his output.

Richard has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully completed his second loan. He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to expand his farming business by planting more bananas and purchasing a dairy cow. He says that with this loan, he will be able to increase his food production both for his family and for sale. He would like to practice large scale farming in the future.

loans.use: To expand his farming business and purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: cette femme est une femme célibataire, elle est mère de deux enfants. le commerce qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelées "sodabi". elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de charbons de bois. elle  fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait s'approvisionner. elle sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de boissons locales appelées "sodabi" et de quelques sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Massan A. is an unmarried woman and the mother of two children. She runs a business selling an alcoholic beverage called “sodabi" to provide for the needs of her family. She also has a business selling charcoal. Her supplies are about to run out and she would like to stock up. Consequently, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase the beverage known locally as “sodabi” and several bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Madame Ngoné F. est une femme mariée de 46 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff plus précisément dans le quartier de Dagoudane. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 12 et 23 ans.
Madame F. a choisi l’activité de commerce dans laquelle elle évolue  depuis plus de  15 ans par passion mais aussi l’influence de  son mari a beaucoup contribué à ce choix. Elle est en même  temps artiste et évolue  depuis  plus de 20 ans dans la troupe Mame Ndiaré de Yoff.
Madame F. est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2009. Elle a déjà  remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits pour enfants et autres marchandises diverses destines à renforcer son commerce. 
Son objectif étant  de réaliser  des bénéfices  en vue de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille, madame F. pense que ce crédit  lui sera d’un très grand apport.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoné F. is 46 years old and lives in the locality of Yoff, or more precisely in its Dagoudane borough. She is married with four children whose ages vary from 12 to 23 years. Mrs F. chose the commercial activity she embarked on 15 years ago by passion but also through her husband’s influence, which contributed significantly to her choice. For the past 20 years she has also been a performing artist in the Mame Ndiaré troup of Yoff. Mrs F. is a member of the Yoff branch (of UIMCEC) since April 2009, and has already reimbursed two previous loans. She is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs destined to buy children’s clothing and various other merchandise to bolster her business. Her objective being to generate revenue to satisfy her personal needs and improve her family’s social situation, Mrs. F. believes this credit loan will help her significantly.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up her stock

loans.name: Reyna  De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Reyna  de los Ángeles F. B., tiene más de 34 años, con su esposo y sus 2 hijos pequeños habitan en el Barrio Laureles Norte, ellos habitan en una humilde casa, la cual ha sido construida por el esfuerzo de su esposo el cual es Ingeniero Industrial y con sus ahorros apoya la obra y fusiona como el soporte económico de la familia. Pero ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, para edificar un muro en la sala principal de su casa que divida las áreas de estar, brinde seguridad y fuerza a la infraestructura de su vivienda, esta inversión le traería mejores condiciones y comodidades para habitar, y la satisfacción paternal de ofrecerle  a sus hijos un hogar digno donde desarrollar sus días venideros.
texts.en:
Reyna de los Ángeles F. B. has been with her husband for more than 34 years. They and her two young children live in a humble home in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. The house was built with great effort from her husband, who is an industrial engineer. He provides financial support for his family through his earnings. They are asking for this loan in order to buy building materials to build a wall in their living room and bring more security and strength to the infrastructure of their house. This improvement will also offer better living conditions and comfort and will provide the parental satisfaction of having given their children a dignified home for their future development.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: La señora Ana Cristina, tiene 42 años ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas de 13 y 18 años de edad. Ana tiene un negocio de venta de sopa y comida, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación, esto es todos los días además que los fines de semana también elabora nacatamales y comida rápida por las noches. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, empezó este negocio con recursos propios buscando como tener un ingreso económico para brindar manutención a sus hijas, cabe señalarse el negocio lo heredo de su mama quien le enseño a trabajar desde pequeña. Ella solicita este préstamo con el propósito de invertir en el negocio para que tenga un mayor crecimiento y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. El sueño de su familia es ampliar más el negocio y comprar más material para el negocio y obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has two daughters, ages 13 and 18. Ana has a business selling soup and food, which she distributes out of her home. She does this every day, and on the weekends she also makes tamales and other fast food in the evenings. She started her business about five years ago with her own resources, looking to earn an income to provide for her daughters. She was shown how to run the business by her mother, who taught her how to work from a young age. She is requesting the loan with the plan to invest in the business so that it has more growth and in this way she can increase her profits. Ana's goal is to expand the business and purchase more ingredients for it so she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia vive en la zona  Chauira Chico, Provincia  Omasuyos, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su  pequeña hija  la cual se encuentra en edad escolar, se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado. Es el primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Zonia lives in Chauira Chico, Omasuyos province, La Paz department, with her school aged daughter. She raises dairy cattle whose milk is sold to Pil Andina (large, commercial dairy products maker). The loan will be used to buy cattle. This is her first Impro and first Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Gina is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, pancit noodles, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, biscuits, powdered soap and bread  in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which are sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the basic needs of her family. Her primary challenges in this business have been diseases and fluctuation in the market price of milk.

She has requested this loan of 46,800KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of her children. She hopes that, in future her milk productivity will increase and she will be able to open an agrovet shop. She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys Obdulia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Gladys Obdulia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la enseñanza de niños, ella es profesora del nivel primario en el distrito de Paruro, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her job teaching children. She works as an elementary school teacher in the District of Paruro. Gladys works between the hours of 7am and 1pm and would like to open a grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to perform maintenance on her house.

Gladys is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Home maintenance expenses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for seventeen years and employs five farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, millet, kale and milk, which she sells locally. She also operates a bar and a hotel in the same location. She is pictured here outside her business premises.

Mary is 41 years old. She is married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

She has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully repaid her previous loan of 50,000 KES. She has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to continue to farm maize, beans, millet and vegetables. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve their livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been unreliable laborers, which affects her business performance.

loans.use: To continue farming maize, beans, millet and vegetables.

loans.name: Toribia Joaquin

texts.es:
Toribia D. 63 años, venD. ropa en un puesto del mercado. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno D. los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión D. mariscos.  

Empezó hace tres años con L. ayuda D. su esposo deambulando las calles para vender L. ropa, pero como ya estaban cansados D. caminar decidieron ubicar un puesto D. ropa en un mercado. Trabaja desD. las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días pero los martes y domingos se ubica a lado D. L. playa en mercado para tener más ingresos. VenD. pantalones a $ 14.00, camisetas a $ 5.00, ropa D. niño a $ 4.00. Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, ropa D. niño para surtir más su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local ya que ahora venD. en L. calle del mercado y tener una vejez asegurada con su esposo.
texts.en:
Toribia, age 63, sells clothing from a stall at the market. She lives in a canton called Playas, one of many tourist spots in Ecuador that offers a wiD. variety of seafood.

Toribia started this business three years ago with the help of her husband, who travels the streets selling clothes. However, they both became tired of walking and decided to set up a clothing stand at the market. Toribia works from every day from 7am to 7pm, but on Tuesdays and Sundays she relocates to the beachsiD. market so that she can generate more income. She sells trousers for $14, shirts for $5, and children’s clothes for $4. With this loan she will be able to buy more clothing such as trousers, shirts, and children’s outfits so that she can restock her business with more merchandise.
